Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, friendly staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Sb
Reviews.Content: Just back from Venice. Stayed 2 nights in Ca'Dogaressa. Located in a quiet part of Venice this hotel is an ideal place to have a rest after visiting all the sites. Clean, tastefully decorated rooms are charming. The hotel owner Paolo is a perfect host, always helpful and constructive. Daniele is friendly and efficient. Thanks to their recommendations, we had very good lunch at Mimmo and dinner at Gigio, both at very reasonable price. Thanks to Paolo, Daniele and other staff of Ca'Dogaressa, our stay in Venice was really perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: maxim730
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2012. Some notes: - about 40 min water bus (alilaguna.it, orange line, second stop) ride from Marco Polo airport to hotel. Get off at the Guglie stop ( second stop) , turn left and walk for 2 mins. - a short 7 min walk to the train station - about 25 mins walk to St Mark's Basilica, and other tourist spots - great breakfast and very friendly staff Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Venetian Elegance”
Reviews.Author: MinnieBreaker
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old daughter and I spent four nights here in a classic room. It was very comfortable, warm and elegant. We had no view to speak of but the room was peaceful and in good weather the roof terrace offers a great view and a chance to sit in the sun.The location of the hotel is perfect- really beautiful and quiet, yet within easy walking distance of the Piazzale Roma where the airport bus from Treviso dropped us off. There are plenty of local shops and cafes and you can walk to all parts of Venice from here, providing you are reasonably fit. You can also pick up a vaporetto really nearby and travel by water instead. Paulo and his team are charming and friendly, and we felt very safe and well looked after. We managed breakfast by the canal on our first morning as the sun was shining and that was a great introduction to Venice. The breakfasts could have been a little more varied but they were perfectly fine for a short stay. I would throughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly owner and staff, room is very nice and big.”
Reviews.Author: iamleo
Reviews.Content: Very nice environment, breakfast serve nice hot chocolate, coffee, when nice weather day, you can enjoy your beautiful breakfast at outdoor. They are very helpful and friendly, make my Venice trip become easier and relax. I and my wife spend more time in hotel, as outside of Venice are crowded or raining. I will recommend everyone I know stay this hotel when go Venice

Reviews.Title: “Simply lovely canal view room!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBGS
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. Once in 2009 and once in 2011. Our first trip there were 5 of us in 2 rooms. The second time it was just my husband and I. Both visits we stayed in the canal view room. It doesn't share walls with other rooms, so it is quiet. Open the shutters in the morning to hear the church bells and watch working Venice go by with supply boats. The staff is wonderful the wi-fi is complementary. There is a discount if you pay with cash. Both visits we only used a few things from the mini fridge and both times they refused to let us pay for what we did have. Andy will make you coffee if you get downstairs when breakfast first starts and he makes the best espresso in all of Italy. JMO!! Maybe it's that you drink it while sitting right next to a canal. I don't know... but it's la serenissima at it's best.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: msphx12
Reviews.Content: Attention to detail perfect! Rooms are a nice size with on suite bathrooms in marble and tile. Super clean. The owners are extremely helpful and make you feel at home. Don't forget to go to the roof top terrace for sunset! The hotel is not on the grand canal so it's very reasonable and much quieter. Short walk over the bridge and you are on the main street to anywhere in Venice Don't miss this one!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value.”
Reviews.Author: Aus_PM_73
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with this hotel. I loved its location - walking distance from the train station, easy to find and, even better, just off the main tourist thoroughfare through the city (linking the train station with St Mark's Square). Once you get off that thoroughfare, suddenly it feels like you have Venice to yourself and the Cannaregio area (which the hotel is located in) is perfect for enjoying a quiet but attractive part of Venice away from the masses. The hotel is excellent value - I chose one of the cheap rooms and, as a bigger one was available for the first two nights (of our four night stay), we were invited to use it for those two nights and then move to the room we'd booked after that. We were grateful but decided against given the amount of packing and repacking we'd already done on the trip! I would, however, advise booking one of the larger rooms unless you're minimising travel costs because you'll get a canal view and the bed may be bigger. This was the one downside of the room we had - the bed was just too small. I'm not exactly tall, just 177 cm (slightly under 5' 10") and my feet were over the edge which made sleeping uncomfortable. The smaller bed might have been a necessity given the size of the room. Other notes: The bathroom, like many in Italy, offers only the hand held shower head that can't be mounted on the wall for the type of shower you might be used to in other countries; breakfast offered some good options though I'll never understand why, in Italy, a country full of wonderful food, there is an obsession with providing cold croissants (known locally as cornettos) as a standard breakfast item. Finally, the hotel provided free wi-fi connection and we were given the details for it on arrival. Ah, if only more places did that :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Venetian Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: alxevt
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else this was booked having researched trip advisor extensively. Previous reviewers are right again. We have just returned from a four night stay in this fabulous little hotel/B&B situated in an ideal part of the city. We decided to get the bus directly from the airport which takes about 20 minutes and cost 5euros each. We then walked the short distance to the hotel (we actually did it in a little over 10 minutes but I would say 20 mins at a more leisurely pace!) I'd seen planty of pictures on trip advisor so new what to expect from the outside and this is typical of most of the buildings in the city. We arrived very early expecting to drop our luggage off and head off for the day before booking in, we were pleasantly surprised to be offered a lovely cup of coffee upon arrival and a very warm welcome from the member of staff (I didn't catch her name but she was the maid) The owner arrived a few minutes later and showed us to our room. I had booked a superior double based on other reviewers recommendations. I thought I'd be a bit cheeky and ask if we could have a nice view with this room and was told this wasn't available!! We stayed in room 3 which is on the first floor at the rear of the building. It looks directly over the neighbouring property, however I can thoroughly recommend this room if you want peace and quiet. Breakfast was simple but sufficient (fresh croisants, yoghurt, cornflakes) and as much piping hot strong coffee as you can drink! Regarding the walk from the hotel to St Marks Square..... I'm afraid I can't give you the best timings for this strole because each time we headed off in the morning we kept finding different alleyways all of which lead to something new or another beautiful monument or building. The room was cleaned and beds made up every morning. All of the staff were pleasant, professional and unobtrusive. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending Ca Dogaressa to friends and family and hope to visit again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Value”
Reviews.Author: texasfight
Reviews.Content: We stayed here some time ago but the wonderful memories still remain. We picked Ca' Dogaressa based on other Trip Advisor reviews and once again everyone is spot on! We stayed in the green room overlooking the canal and it was so nice to be able to open the large windows to watch the boats and people go by. It was a large room with a small seating area; it was huge compared to other hotels I've stayed in Italy, London, and Paris. We were able to eat breakfast on the canal and it was fun watching morning deliveries being made via boat up and down the water. I liked the fact that it was a bit out of the way; no throngs of tourists everywhere. We stumbled upon a great little restaurant that was filled with locals: Pizzeria Ristorante Al Faro located in the Ghetto Vecchio. We ate there two of our three nights in Venice. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a nice, quaint spot to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor contributors were right again, recommended”
Reviews.Author: phayaoThailand
Reviews.Content: It took me several hours to go through the opinions on some hotels in Venice. I decided to book "Ca' Dogaressa" in view of the many good comments that I read. I booked the best room available (#1, the Green Room, over the Cannaregio Canal) for â‚¬120 per night and I was very well impressed by the size of the room, its cleanliness and the beautiful views over the canal. On the map it looks a bit out of the way, but I can assure you that is well connected, only 10' walk from the railway station and with the Guglie stop of the boat-bus just yards away. The service is friendly and efficient. The TV in the room has English, French, Spanish, German and even Chinese channels. The WiFi is good (ask for an plug-adapter at the reception). The only two things that I consider can be improved were: the lack of a screen in the bath-shower and that you can hear every step of the people occupying the upper room. Maybe a thick carpet may prevent the continuos "toc, toc, toc" of our neighbours heels and a simple clear screen may prevent the shower water splashing the floor and becoming hazardous. The breakfast, although simple, was sufficient. I did not look at the other rooms, but -definitely- my Green Room was worth the price I paid. We had a king-size bed and a double sofa bed, so a couple and two children can easily sleep in this big room. It has a mini-fridge in a cabinet and a safe-box in the wardrobe. The bath-room has a hair-dryer, toiletries and plenty of towels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: It's so comfortable here I never want to leave, the staff are all friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious and elegant and it's a joy to come back to after a long day out. Will be back for sure! Stayed November 2011 with friends

Reviews.Title: “Great position, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Another great find through Trip Advisor. This hotel is particularly handy if you arrive by train. It is about 10 minutes walk from the station, close to the canal transport stop and close to many restaurants. We spent a couple of very pleasurable days just wandering though the lane ways of Venice. The city is small enough that you will always find the main canal and you can just catch the water bus "home" Our room was quite small, but perfect for two and great for the price. it was very clean and beautifully decorated - even a glass chandelier! The manager is very friendly and helpful, which certainly lends a homely feel. The free wifi worked well and the included breakfast was basic cereals, toast and croissants, with excellent coffee. We were in two minds whether to include venice in our itinerary since we are not really art fiends and don't really like tourist traps, however we thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great rooms PLUS very cheap compared to others.”
Reviews.Author: corporatetraveller69
Reviews.Content: We found this hidden gem through tripadvisor. The hotel front seemed a little daunting however it is great inside. The man on the desk was very accommodating making the stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jacobo_Bloomfield
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel, few people. Good service (personal thanx to the manager, who is friendly and helpfuly) and very close to the city â€‹â€‹center.I advise everybody to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: JasonMarni
Reviews.Content: This hidden motel was in a great location, it was particularly lovely to eat breakfast (included) by the canal. Unfortunately the walls are very thin and we were kept awake one night. It was very convenient that we were able to check out at 5am with no problems. It was a short walk to the train station and close to some lovely restaurants and boat stops.

Reviews.Title: “romantic and quiet”
Reviews.Author: AnnaAnton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at CaDogaressa for our short honeymoon vacation and had 5 fantastic days. Very clean rooms with super location: quiet, not very touristic, still close to major attractions. Breakfast is served on the embankment what is a real experience! You seat in the morning with your cup of coffee at the canal, look at the boat pass by or at Paolo chating with his neighbors. We had a deluxe room and it was large and has a canal view, std rooms have no canal view, I think. This hotel is just a perfect value for money, located in the area, where real life dominates (not only pigeons at San Marco are intersting to look at )and Paolo is a superb host. What else can you expect from such a touristy destination. Ciao Paolo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo M
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, near the railway station. Rooms are very clear and furnished in old-venetian style (~1700). Moreover the zone â€“ near the Jewish quarter â€“ is beautiful and quite. Excellent price and hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: robodada
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at this hotel! The staff welcomed us with open arms and even tried their best to speak to us in our own language! The room was breathtaking, with a great view of the canal. Location was great for us too, walking distance from all the things we wanted to see, and close to a lot of restaurants and places for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good B&B near central venice”
Reviews.Author: KimandJay
Reviews.Content: We stayed January 2012 for 3 nights, Booked on the basis of previous reviewers, hotel not far from st Lucia train station and a short walk, or even shorter and more atmospheric ride by water ferry, into the heart of Venice (good because it wasn't in the touristy main part, but it was still a good 10 mins walk to the main square - but seriously when you're wandering through the winding cobblestone streets of Venice who can complain)! Extremely friendly and helpful staff, very efficient and clean, wifi a definite plus. Breakfast was more than adequate considering the amount of food on offer in Venice, and the chocolatas were a real treat. Overall great value for money in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: SSAN21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in a classic room based on reviews from tripadvisor. The location was good, staff really nice, room nice with a good bathroom and shower, room heated etc. I would definetly stay here again. Only improvement i could suggest is a better breakfast as the food choice was limited - croissant, breadroll and yoghurt. We stayed at many hotels during our trip aroud europe and this was the poorest breakfast we had.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and lovely room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: BabuLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dec 2011. I am so pleased I chose this hotel after reading several reviews on here. We booked the Suite with canal view and it was perfect. Our room was really very big and exactly as you see on the website. We were given a very warm welcome on arrival after getting of the water bus which drops you off on the other side of the canal ( about a 2 min walk). The location of the hotel was perfect as it is in a lovely neighbouhood with lots of atmosphere but away from the tourist traps.All the sights are within walking distance down narrow streets, busy shopping streets and accross all sorts of bridges - unforgettable! The room was perfect and the bathroom although not fitted with the most modern of showers was absolutely fine being spacious and clean too! Breakfast just ok but delivered to your room FOC ...to be honest we preferred to soak up the Italian atmosphere and grab a coffee and pastry in one of the many cafes in the neighbourhood en route to our sight seeing! I want to go back to Venice one day and I will stay here again without a doubt! Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Dreaming of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Stefanie W
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with beautiful Venetian dÃ©cor and friendly staff. The room was scrupulously clean, the bathroom modern and the bed comfortable. The price was very reasonable â€“ 53 euros per night for mid-December, with a simple breakfast included (croissant, yogurt, cereal, rolls, juice, bottled water, and hot drink). We also had a fridge and free wi-fi. It's about a ten minute walk from the train station, which was convenient because we didn't have to deal with a vaporetto or water taxi to reach the hotel. It's located on a quiet canal right next to the old Jewish ghetto.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our belated Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: drixld
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our postponed honeymoon in Paris, Berlin, and Venice. Staying in the Hotel Ca' Dogaressa was by far the best place we stayed through our trip. To begin with, you are staying in one of the greatest parts of Venice(the Jewish Ghetto.. don't let the name confuse you) , and right on one of the major canals that the airport water buses drop you off.(you are also very close to the Saint Lucia Train Station) Once we got to the hotel the gentleman at the front desk was very helpful and kind. This is a small hotel with only 9 rooms,and I believe it is family run. When we got up stairs we were stunned by how beautiful everything was. The chandeliers, wallpaper, bathroom all have the charm and quaintness of that really cute european hotel room we all dream of(but typically you end up in a crap hole) The room also came with a free breakfast! We did stay here in the winter time, which is the offseason, but even so the prices were amazingly low. If you have the option to stay here, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Lyn652
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Ca Dogaressa and had the most beautiful room overlooking a quieter canal. The owner was so helpful and polite and breakfast (included in the price) sitting outside in the sun was delightful. We were able to easily walk from the train station to our hotel with our luggage. This hotel was a definite highlight and helped make our stay in Venice a special memory.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and good location”
Reviews.Author: Hugh128
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews we saw on Trip Advisor, we stayed at Ca' Dogaressa for two nights in November, 2011 in a Superior Double room. We had booked 2 seats on a shared water taxi from the airport and asked the driver to drop us off right outside the hotel. As other reviewers have said, don't be put off by the appearance of the hotel from the outside, the entrance is actually just off the Canal side down a small street a few steps. Very clean, very helpful Father and Son team who run the hotel - great value. It is only one bridge away from the train station so would be convenient for those arriving by train as well. It is away from the St Mark's Square area with its noise, but yet close to the Grand Canal and all of the action. Would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Expected more..”
Reviews.Author: Emily M
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveler and had 3 nights here in November 2011. To be honest, after reading all the reviews on the website I expected more. My room was very clean. However it was tiny, had a view of the wall but my biggest complaint is the terrible bed!! It was two singles pushed together (which I can overlook) but they were SO short. I'm about 5ft and my feet hit the end of the bed. I didn't like having to leave my key at reception every time that I left. Kind of made me feel like I was staying at a hotel, whilst I stay in B&Bs because its like having your own little apartment, with a lot of privacy. I didn't feel that as much here. Also, I wasn't exactly sure who the hosts were. I kind of like having a couple as the hosts as I feel like they are alot more attentive etc. Whilst the people working here were nice and polite, they were a bit impersonal. That said, the location of the place is great. In a non-tourist spot and very close to train station. I wasnt unhappy at all with my stay here. It was pleasant but I just think that you can find a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Moment”
Reviews.Author: JKEMtravels
Reviews.Content: I was originally disappointed that the hotels (those higher ranked on this site) we wanted to stay were fully booked, but in the end was very happy that we ended up staying here!! Staff was very friendly, rooms were spacious and very charming. Hotel is located conveniently from the train station (about 10 to 15 min walk). Although not centrally located near the square, it is on quaint street on a canal where it is quieter. Husband and I enjoyed our breakfasts on the patio overlooking the canal...loved watching the vaporettos zoom by. Would stay here again with no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of Venetian life.............”
Reviews.Author: misssyd
Reviews.Content: Being our first time in Venice, my husband and I decided to spoil ourselves by staying in Venice itself rather than on the mainland. It turned out to be the best choice EVER! Staying on the canal really gave us a real insight to life in Venice. We loved every minute of it! The room was spacious, clean and adorned in the traditional Venetian way - Murano glass and very ornate.The host was super friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was served by the canal and it was a real treat being able to enjoy seeing the vaporetto's zip by and the workmen going to work on their boats. It was also away from the touristy crowds which made it a lot more enjoyable! We walked everywhere which was fantastic too! A fantastic and memorable stay! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip”
Reviews.Author: Gemma M
Reviews.Content: First time in Vencie. Stayed early November, on recomendation from TripAdvisor. Took the junirop suite with canal view, which was gorgeous. Beautifully decorated, spacious, and very clean. The staff were welcoming and friendly and very informative. Due to flooding we took breakfast in our room which was perfect - watching the world go by from the large canal facing windows. Location was perfect - felt like being in the middle of a proper local community - very few tourists but a bustling lively italian atmopsphere. Price was extremely reasonable. Cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better location.”
Reviews.Author: blackfred
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in September 2011 and loved this hotel. Could not be more pleased with the area- Cannaregio as we hated the area around St Marks. This was so pleasant being away from the crowds and we loved just being able to stroll around at night and be vertually the only people around. It was quiet, clean and the staff were very accommodating. Having breakfast outside and watching the world go by was extra speciall and I don't think we would of liked Venice nearly as much is we were in the thick of things. Some people might think it is in too quiet a spot but this is what we loved about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Coeury
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant Stay. A lttle Gem in the Cannaregio. Very friendly staff. Free Wireless. nicely decorated room. Good location away from touristic crowd. We enjoyed the room on the ground floor with very few minuses regarding the very competitive price we paid (50 â‚¬/room incl Bkfst... in winter:) Will bo back again with lots of pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Small room”
Reviews.Author: beargoh
Reviews.Content: The room we had were clean n nicely decorated, but a bit too small. The breakfast selection was limited. Our hotel in florence (cheaper than this) had a much better spread.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: S B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great--it's located close to a vaporetto stop and has an Alilaguna stop (direct to the Marco Polo airport). The staff were polite and congenial. They also helped provide us with the departure times of the vaporettos. The rooms are clean and spacious, with great facilities. All in all a wonderful stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location away from the maddening crowd”
Reviews.Author: RobABalmain
Reviews.Content: Great location in the old Jewish sector that is just a twenty minute stroll to all the sites. Rooms large with great bathrooms and oh so quite at night. In the morning have breakfast on the canal before the hustle starts as the city awakes. Try a lunch or a dinner at Trattoria da Mimmo up the canal and around the corner to the left... the food is fab... And if you like liver... Well it's very very good here...

Reviews.Title: “Great find and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: allpoints2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights after a long haul flight and couldn't fault it. Directions on their web site exactly right and an easy 15 min walk from the train station with luggage. The room was spacious (room 9) and squeaky clean with good amenities including wi fi. Nothing was to much trouble when we asked at reception and their hotel info guide also includes a good map of the streets/canals and the vaperetto (ferry) routes which we used often. Vaperetto stop literally on the door step which can take you direct to island of Murano and St Marks. Early morning walks through Cannaregio well worth it prior to the hustle and bustle of the day starting. Lots of eateries around including bakeries and delis which were much cheaper than other places we saw throughout the city. Discount avail through web site deal if you pay in cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveDonut
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, the best location in Venice. You could argue for some 5 star hotel near St Marks or overlooking the lagoon or the Grand Canal, but this is a REAL neighbourhood. You can sit out and have breakfast by the side of the canal, can walk on both sides of the canal. There is a little shop a hundred yards away where I bought 66ml bottles of beer for one euro! Compare that with the 15 euro we paid to sit by St Marks. They have a small fish and veg market which also gives some sense of neighbourhood. We were given a free upgrade and had a good sized room overlooking the alley. Great shower. As they do in some rooms in Italy, the rooms are not wallpapered but covered in fabric - which is a touch of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PJseattle
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at Ca' Dogaressa in Venice and we had a wonderful time during our stay. Originally I was looking for a hotel on the Grand Canal, but now I'm glad we went with this place which is still located across the street from a smaller, less hectic canal. We were pretty much able to walk anywhere on the main part of Venice, and the water bus was really close and easy to take as well (although they could get really packed and people could get really pushy so we usually opted to walk places). The room was nice, although the bed was hard (as were all the other beds in Italy at the various places we stayed). Breakfast outside in the morning was lovely, and we also enjoyed relaxing at the bar next door, which also had a very friendly staff. Overall it was a great choice and we would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great spot”
Reviews.Author: sunshinelollypops
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for 2 nights. The service was outstanding. Arriving after a 10 minute [hot] walk from the station, we were offered a cool drink of water - without even asking! The owner even assisted my husband with our luggage up the stairs [no lift]. Our room overlooked the canal and had a pull out bed for the kids. It was large [for Venetian standards], clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was large and also spotless. Breakfast by the canal was lovely and we were offered 2nd cups of coffee/tea. There is a vaporetto stop just a short distance away. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: cloudsrest57
Reviews.Content: This a small, affordable hotel is conveniently located just outside the bustle of Venice. Small, nicely decorated rooms with a lot of charm.The hotel is located on one of the larger side canals. The staff is helpful, we enjoyed our stay here very much. Only negatives are very hard beds and just bread and cheese for breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Terri1960
Reviews.Content: Very quaint Little hotel in Venice. Water buses just down street, close to excellent restaurants, quiet area. Great value for cost, would highly recommend. Rooms a bit small but who spends much tome in your room in Venice? Would come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: 4Doc
Reviews.Content: This property was an easy walk from the train station even with a rolling bag, and was in a good, safe neighborhood for walking at night. In very close proximity to the waterbus station and two minutes from a great street for shopping, eating, getting a few groceries (water, fruit, wine/beer), baking, etc. Breakfast was adequate with cereal, croissants, tea/coffee, and served by the canal when weather permits. The rooftop is a great place to sit with a bottle of wine to watch people on the street and the canal below. Some of the staff did not speak much English but others got by just fine. We walked to the bus station(15mins from hotel) the day we left at 4am, to get the 5euro ride to the airport. The bus ride took 25mins....was an easy cheap way to get there. We heard of others that took water taxis for 110euro that still took 20mins. Would recommend a transport pass when you arrive of 18, 24 or 36hrs depending on your needs, so that you can ride the water buses all you like.....if you want one-way or return bus ride to airport included you must ask specifically for that kind of transport pass as it costs a little extra. The pass is well worth the money as each water bus ride costs 6.50 euros for 60minutes of use. You have to validate your ticket each time you get on the water bus to make sure the time is still valid. You can purchase these passes after you exit the railway station, there is a booth along the canal to your right, and I am certain you can buy them at a similar booth at the airport. We loved Venice, it is so beautiful at night. You will be charged a service charge to eat at most restaurants and even at some bars, so be sure to check on that before sitting or ordering (we adjusted our tip according to how much this charge was). Eating can be very expensive so watch the menus and be sure of what you are ordering. If you take a seat in San Marco's Square, it can cost you a pretty penny just to sit, so make sure you can afford to sit down. A trip to Burano is well worth the 30min water bus trip to spend a lazy couple hours walking around. We walked all over the little streets of Venice and got lost a few times, but that happens to everyone!! Would recommend this property for value, location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Maxwell03
Reviews.Content: This a a tiny family owned Bed and Breakfast set on a small canal in Venice. It is one block of the main Venice thoroughfare and boasts huge rooms and clean accommodations. We were in one of two suites. It was worth the price increase b/c you have 6 huge windows facing the canal. If the weather is nice, you can open the windows and hear the water lapping on the boats moored in the canal. Breakfast was simple. Pastry and yogurt served by the owner on the canal. But it was nice to sit outside with coffee or cappuccino. The decor was authentic with glass chandeliers and brocade wall paper.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeet5153
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 'Ca Dogaressa' 2 years ago with my husband for our 35th anniversary, and it was a delight!.....So, when planning a return trip to Italy with my best friend in celebration of our 60th birthdays, I didn't hesitate in making a reservation there again!!! We were not disappointed!!! Though Paulo was recouperating from surgery, his staff went out of their way to ensure our stay was a comfortable and enjoyable one. Our room was so 'Venetian', with fabric on the walls, a gorgeous 'Murano' chandelier and beautifully decorated furnishings. Breakfast by the canal, watching day to day life unfold was delightful!!!.......and the chocolate croissants as yummy as ever!! It is located a little out of the way to San Marco square (about a 20 minute walk) but, is convenient to the train station and vaporetto stop, Guglie, where you can hop on and get anywhere you want, if walking isn't your 'thing'. The best thing about Venice, after seeing the main attractions, is getting lost down the side streets and alleys - you never know what you'll discover!!! Ciao, for now 'Ca Doagaressa', but I'll be back - I consider you my home away from home now, whenever I travel to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: shipster
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the best deals in Venice, great room - maybe 750 yards off main walk way, close to water taxi stop with two line, clean, quiet and - for europe , spacious room. Great and gracious hosts, felt secure, helped up stairs with luggage, would have done anything for us. Note we took aerobus from airport to main Venice stop, quick, inexpensive. Was a long walk with luggage- had to go over two bridges. Would recommend get a water taxis (with pass) to hotel stop(see their website) depending on your luggage situation, Would also reccomend you get a water taxi pass -, hopped on when we wanted a rest or were farther than we we wanted to walk, or to go to one of the other islands. One night we just took it around - very romantic. Would not recommend host restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “What a spot to Relax”
Reviews.Author: JimiHalifax
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights, with friends. Daniele on the front desk was great, gave us lots of info on things to do etc. Reviews here are very accurate, super clean hotel so quiet and off the beaten path yet so close to everything. Easy 10 min walk to bus or train. Water taxi stop 30 sec from room. Great complimentary light breakfast. You've got to catch a sunset on the 3rd floor balcony unbelievable. We sat canalside after a long day and had a few drinks just watching how the locals live, it was great. Don't worry about a canal view from your window just sit at the tables and take it all in. Hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “good service and nice location”
Reviews.Author: victorluk
Reviews.Content: The host is very friendly and the staff are all nice. We booked a canal view room. The room is spacious and air-conditioning is good. I love the big restroom and the canal view. We enjoy breakfast by the canal and it is about 10 min-15 min walk from the train station which is good if you plan to leave/arrive by train.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking, stay here”
Reviews.Author: cooperrinzler
Reviews.Content: Trip: 2 weeks in Rome, Florence, Venice, Modena, Milan, Cinque Terre w/ sister and fiancÃ©. Ca' Dogaressa was, without doubt, the accommodation highlight of a 2 week trip. The facilities are of a quality that you rarely find even at 4 stars in Italian cities, much less Venice. Spacious, colorful, and well lit rooms. The proprietors and staff were above-and-beyond accommodating and helpful. If you're worried about location, please note that it takes approximately 15 minutes to get to the middle of the island via winding route. Having stayed at 2 to 5 star hotels throughout Italy, there is no doubt in my mind that this is one of the highest return-on-value stays you can achieve in the country. You'll pay 3-star rates for 4-star service and facilities. I will be going back, and will be staying at Ca Dogaressa.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Glembidor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011, unfortunately only for 1 night due to our packed schedule. The host unexpectedly upgraded our room to suite for free! THANK YOU! He also gave us a direction to a local restaurant, great food & very cheap; not one of those tourist trap restaurants. The room is nicely decorated in Venetian style, with windows overlooking the canal. Only about 10-15mins stroll from the train station. Will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous....but with a few small (typical) problems.....”
Reviews.Author: Hundleychick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in August and we chose the hotel based mostly on its proximity to the train station (being that we were arriving and departing via train) and price. If those are your top 2 criteria, then this is THE place for you. The hotel is a very easy 10 minute walk from the train station and given the uneven walkways, countless bridges, and the heat of August--we were thankful for the proximity to the train. As for price, they are extremely reasonably priced, especially in a very expensive city. Obviously you get what you pay for, but for this price--I was thrilled to get a spacious, clean, and beautifully furnished room--with very welcome air conditioning after a long hot day of sightseeing. I will not complain about the fact that I had the ground floor room that others have complained about, b/c as I just said, you do get what you pay for--and I knew when i booked it that I had booked the cheapest room in the hotel. So no, there is no view of the canal from the back room on the ground floor. (if you want that you have to pay a premium). However, there were a few small issues that did not ruin our stay....but were still enough to be a minor annoyance. 1--I do not understand why the room did not have a shower. I dont know what the bathrooms are like in the other rooms, but the one we had only had a tub and a hand-held shower head.....so needless to say, "showers" caused a mini-fllood in the bathroom every morning b/c there was no curtain or way to stop the water from going all over when you tried to use the hand-held shower head. 2-The breakfast was good but sparse compared to other hotels. You were served canal side (very nice!) a box of cereal, yogurt, and a croissant. 3--Perhaps the most annoying thing (but unfortunately common in European hotels) was the fact that the bed was 2 twins pushed together so it was a little hard for my husband and I to get comfortable with a big crack in between the two of us! Overall, if you can overlook the minor annoyances that are actually very common in 3 star European hotels, the Ca' Dogaressa is a wonderful property, with lovely owners, clean spacious rooms, and very reasonable rates considering the high prices of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting but was pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTravellers22
Reviews.Content: As this hotel as rave reviews on here, I booked having some expectations. On arrival I was shocked as it is looks very run down from the outside (but that's Venice's charm we learnt!). We entered to a tiny lobby and noticed there was no lift. But things all changed when we were met by the nicest man at reception! The staff here are just AMAZING! They sell the place. They are very helpful and chatty and extremely welcoming. The room was beautiful but very cramped. The bed wasn't long enough so our feet stuck out the end (we are 6 ft tall). But it was the cutest and most charming hotel. The breakfast was quite small but was outside, right on the canal which was lovely! The hotel isn't in or near San Marco Piazza - that's about twenty odd minutes by water taxi BUT it is in the cutest area filled with restaurants all along the small canal and it was probably more romantic the fact that it's away from the crowds, especially at night. We would recommend to all and would stay again!! Do not judge a book by their cover they say and it's true. The outside looks like traditional, run down Venice but its a beautiful hotel filled with the warmest staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel away from usual tourist hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Bhamtraveller_7
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel on canal side. Quiet area but only 15 minutes stroll to Rialto. Very good rates (for Venice), so easy to get to by water bus from airport (stop very close to hotel), very comfortable and stylishly decorated rooms and very helpful staff. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Undercliffe
Reviews.Content: The Dogaressa was stylish but our room was on the small side and the bed was a bit short. The location on the canal was excellent and in a lovely part of the city. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the Dogaressa is good value for Venice

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the highlight of Venice - hope to be able to stay there again one day!!!”
Reviews.Author: L0ves2TravelTheW0rld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here for 3 nights for the start of our honeymoon in Italy. Let me tell you - everything you've read on Tripadvisor reviews about this hotel being wonderful...is all an understatement! This hotel is perfect in every single way. It's location is fabulous - on a quiet, beautiful canal that is far enough away from the hustle and bustle that you can actually enjoy the tranquility of the city but close enough to all the action when you want it. Breakfast on the canal in the morning is a little slice of heaven. The terrace is wonderful - we highly recommend sharing a bottle of Prosecco up there at least once. The only fault that we could find is that the beds and pillows are very firm. Now, this is completely a personal preference so it's hard to say that is a complaint. Our only REAL complaint is that we couldn't stay longer. :) My husband and I aren't sure if we'll ever make it to Venice again, but the allure of staying at Ca'Dogaressa again certainly increases the odds. Our advice: stop driving yourself crazy and reading reviews (like we did). Book this hotel, relax, and know that you've made the absolute best decision.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Worldpeople123
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding experience here. Paolo is the most gentle and helpful person, and everybody went out of their way to make us feel at home. Location and facilities are excellent, do not look any further, this should be your place in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it position on TA. I'd be back!”
Reviews.Author: rcontieri
Reviews.Content: Staying in Venice island is expensive. These guys make the money worth it. We got a lovely well decorated room, very friendly staff - looks more like a family - and having breakfast by the cannal is priceless. We bought pizza one night and they offered us to go to the roof terrace to eat it. Just perfect! Venice is a difficult city to get by and the hotel is located near 2 Vaporettos station and it is not that far from the train station, if you are up to a 10 minutes walking. Just go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: Acadianorth
Reviews.Content: When we were planning to go to Venice we considered staying off the island but after we stayed at this hotel, we were glad we spent the extra money to stay on the island. Great location, out of the crowd, easy commute in and out of Venice. Excellent service and tips from the owner. Modern facilities with great internet speed. Breakfast on the canal side. Overall a pleasant surprise. Only thing they could improve is a variation on their breakfast menu, after 3 days we were a bit sick of the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, Beautiful Room.”
Reviews.Author: Giveret
Reviews.Content: Located in a non-touristy area this is an excellent family run B +B .Everyone was so helpful, and welcoming during our 4 night stay. We were close to everything-the trains station was a short walk, the vaporetto stop was virtually outside the door. Our room was very large with lots of room for our clothes, and was totally soundproof. Breakfast on the canal in front was dreamy. Mostly there were many local people and quite a few grocery shops. Our best find was the local "bar" next door to the hotel-MQ 10-they served wonderful coffee, dessert and drinks, all day. great place to hang out and take in the local culture.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jane1112
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend trip with my sister based on tripadvisor.com reviews and every single rave was true. The location is perfect. We arrived late and had no problem finding it since it is very close to water taxi stop. The quiet neighborhood is charming and relaxing but, no need to worry if you want action, because it is a brisk but easy walk to the hustle and bustle. That was a big benefit since we were working off some of the amazing Venetian pasta. All of the staff was so friendly and accommodating. We had a departing flight in the late evening and they even let us use the shower although we had checked out many hours previously. Our room was quiet large compared to a lot of European hotels...especially the bathroom. The breakfast at the canal was lovely and the cappuccino is to die for. If you are ever in Venice, definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoRosenthals
Reviews.Content: Staff is superb, room is comfortable and immaculate, and location is great. Having a large room on the canal was a treat. Breakfast on the canal is just the way to start the day in Venice. Although the hotel is conveniently close to the vaparettos, it is in a peaceful and quiet part of town. Good restaurants are nearby and the ghetto is just around the corner. The boat to the airport is a half block from the hotel, and there is no better way to travel to the airport than by boat.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: HSTGM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights in Ca Dogaressa. Our room was too tiny but perfectly clean. The highlight could be the breakfast served in front of the Canal which is very relaxing and a good start for the day. Comparing with the other properties where we stayed in Italy the breakfast items were very limited. No cold cuts like a good Italian cheese or prosciutto, or fruits served. The expresso was good. The hotel is very conveniently located to visit Venice. We were not overwhelmed but satisfied !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: jakob59
Reviews.Content: Venice is a tricky town, concerning hotels. It's quite difficult to find a decent hotel at a price that you can afford. But Ca' Dogaressa certainly is one of those. Situated in a very nice neighbourhood, near to the main street, but in a very quiet place with one of the nicest canals in Venice. We booked a standard room, and it was allright for two nights - but not more, because though the quality of the room was okay, it only had a tiny window facing directly into a brickwall one metre from the room. So there was practically no daylight. But a nice breakfast by the canal, and a very helpful and nice staff made this hotel a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastif - Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: nygugie61
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Perfectly charming rooms with everything you need, beautifully decorated and comfortable. Gracious bathroom. Lovely furnishings. Super friendly staff so helpful and cracious with suggestions. While we were there, the city was doing construction on the sidewalks but we were all handled very well and carefully. Nice breakfast outside everyday. Great location for arriving via the train and near to a vaporetta stop. Easy walking around. Couldn't have been happier there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: suraleh
Reviews.Content: The owner of the hotel is very hands on and super kind. The rooms are small but very pretty and had great ac. Would love to go there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: caljang
Reviews.Content: ca Dogaressa is a short walk (10 minutes) from the train station. We were greeted by the very friendly and helpful owner. The rooms are clean and up to date. Each of the rooms are distinct - a nice touch, we had the "emerald room". We were served a pleasant continental breakfast everyday alongside the canal. There is even a rooftop deck where you can enjoy a nice glass of wine while taking in the weather and scenery. I wouldn't hesitate staying at ca Dogaressa the next time we're in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our anniversary getaway!”
Reviews.Author: CashsGirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on its tripadvisor reviews and it was fantastic! The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was so nice at a table by the canal. They served us cornetti, rolls and yogurt plus drinks to order. The hotel is a very easy walk from a vaporetto stop, which was perfect for us with our 3 day vaporetto passes. The rooms were clean and beautiful and the prices were reasonable. They also have air conditioning and blinds that black out the room, those were important to us too. I have no complaints. It was a perfect place to spend my anniversary with my husband!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Service...”
Reviews.Author: mjzalord
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night in June. The hotel was fantastic. The rooms were spacious and very Venetian. The owners were tremendous. It felt more like staying in their home than in a hotel. Breakfast in the morning on the canal. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: DANI_CT_SA
Reviews.Content: The staff were lovely and friendly. The rooms were beautifully decorated in typical venecian style and were clean and spacious. They ofered great value for money and a lovely breakfast was included.The location is perfect, right next to the station and walking distance from all the main sites but enough outside of the hustle and bustle for when you wanted some peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A very warm and friendly welcome from the start.”
Reviews.Author: Franki89
Reviews.Content: We arrive around 10am and of course we didn't expect to be able to get into our rooms, but without hesitation they sat us in the sunshine with a complimentary coffee and rushed round to get our rooms ready within 10 minutes. It was lovely to be able to get straight in, unpack, shower and start the a days sight seeing. The rooms were so comfortable and nicely decorated. If we are ever lucky enough to find ourselves back in Venice some day, we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time...great owner”
Reviews.Author: San_Diego2007
Reviews.Content: We just left the hotel and we cannot say enough about Paoulo and his hotel. This is a beautiful place with great service. A welcome change from some of the other businesses in Venice. The hotel has a great view of the canal, and great recommendations for meals. It was a nice stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Nice B&B Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChaitanyaMehta
Reviews.Content: It was near the end of our tour to Italy in March this year that we visited Venice and stayed at Hotel Ca' Dogaressa for two nights. We spent nearly one hour trying to locate the hotel despite showing the printed address to a number of people including the local policemen. It turned out that the hotel is located by the side of the canal five minutes walk from a boat stop called Guglie. It is just that the hotel is on a narrow lane perpendicular to the canal and is apparently not very well known in the neighborhood. The room we got was clean and adequately spacious . Breakfast was simple - cornflakes with milk, toast, eggs and coffee. The staff was fairly friendly and provided us with hot water (for us to make tea) even outside breakfast hours. The hotel manager offered the use of a laptop for internet, but unfortunately, the system crashed and I had to go out to a nearby Internet cafÃ© to check mails. The highlight of our visit to Venice was a Vivaldi concert (Four Seasons) which we attended at Scuola Grande di San Teodoro, Campo San Salvador, San Marco, Venice. For food, there are several small joints along the canal near the hotel. On the whole, the hotel was quite ok and I would recommend it to fellow travelers. Would we stay in this hotel if we visit Venice again? Yes, we would consider it depending on whether the hotel tariff at that time is competitive. Chaitanya Mehta

Reviews.Title: “Good value, with a very caring manager/owner.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie Sierra
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a narrow street 200 yards or so from the waterfront, Acquamarina was the perfect place for us to stay overnight while awaiting a flight out of the nearby airport. Only 15 minutesâ€™ drive from the airport terminals, with friendly and very helpful owners, it provide us rest in a protective environment. The two upstairs rooms with private baths were clean, nice sized, and quite adequate, the wireless connection was included, and we felt the price was very reasonable in comparison with other possibilities in the area. A continental breakfast was provided earlier than normal to accommodate our flight departure, and the restaurant recommended was very good. There are several restaurants within walking distance, and the center of town is not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant interior”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeMrsLee
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel which we will definitely come back again. Although the rooms are small, but it is so cosy and elegant. When we reached the hotel, the reception was already expecting our arrival. He was very helpful and friendly and speaks pretty good English. The bed and bathroom is very clean which i thought was newly renovated. But to my surprise, the last time they renovated the place was 9 years ago! ( They really maintain the place very well). We had a lovely breakfast facing the canal. It would be better if our room was facing the canal as ours was facing the wall! Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, wonderful people, and the way to experience Venice”
Reviews.Author: Linoluck
Reviews.Content: We were amazed at this hotel from the moment we walked down the canal. We were experiencing the real Venice (away from the tourists). Located on a large canal you are able to use almost any mean of transportation. We preffered walking but the Vaparetto station was just down the canal. Breakfast on the canal was excellent and I would recommend having some wine atop the hotel's terrace and let life in Venice pass you buy. The people were also extremely kind and went out of their way to ensure we enjoyed our stay. The proximty to the train station was also ideal for those of you traveling by train. Overall the Ca Dogaressa provided excellent value. I don't think we'd stay anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Italian, very peaceful, lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Travellers10
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Ca' Dogaressa was really lovely. The hotel is on a canal (very exciting to see for the first time) and we found our room to be nice, private and quiet. It was also very pleasant to have breakfast outside watching all the boats and taxis and life in general passing by of a morning. The owners were most helpful with places to go and restaurants to try and always friendly. Breakfast was adequate, featuring lovely croissants, coffee, yoghurt etc.plenty for us to start our days off with. It is also a very clean establishment and I personally love the charm of the place and the furniture, very pretty and Italian. A nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: lupinrocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca Dogaressa at the end of April. We arrived in Venice by train and the hotel was an easy walk from the station. We loved the location - it was in a quiet neighbourhood yet overlooking the canal. Breakfast was served canal side in good weather. We found breakfast to be absolutely fine - there was enough food to keep us going until lunchtime. There's a really good bar next door where we had a quick drink after a day sightseeing. The bar was relaxed and not loud or rowdy. Our room was at the back of the hotel and overlooked terracotta rooftops. It was wonderfully quiet. The only noise came from our neighbours when they came in at night - the walls aren't soundproofed. The bed was really comfortable. The decor was so pretty - it felt very indulgent and luxurious. I loved it. I also thought the main reception man was wonderful. He was welcoming and friendly and answered all our questions (we had a lot!) with patience and humour. He's an asset to the hotel. It's an easy, pleasant walk to all the sights. We thought the hotel was ideal for us. I'd love to go back ASAP!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: feline2ca
Reviews.Content: An absolutely beautiful hotel with beautiful rooms that are immaculate. We were greeted by the owner on arrival, who showed us around our room, and welcomed us to Venice. Staff was always very helpful and nice. We had fresh fruit waiting in our room, and breakfast was out on the canal in the mornings. We could borrow a laptop for free internet. Air conditioner was nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone...it was perfect and comfortable. While not close to San Marco Square, it was a nice walk down the main street and easily walkable to many restaurants, shops and the train station. Also located right by a waterbus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emster_26
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on flights and were looking for the same from a hotel - with the hotels early booking rate we found it. This small hotel felt very Italian and our room was lovely. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast is a simple continental style, with very stong coffee :) but fab before walking round and round the venice streets. Our only negative was that we couldn't get the WIFI to work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Alan85aa
Reviews.Content: After using Trip Advisor to do an extensive review of hotels and B&B in Venice, we selected Ca Dogaressa for a three night stay in May, 2011. We could not have been more pleased with our choice as the location was perfect, the room was exceptional and the service was exemplary. We had a junior suite overlooking the canal, which was a primary goal we had for our stay in Venice, and the room was perfect. It was spacious, quiet, decorated in 18th century style with beautiful furniture yet with very modern conveniences, and with very comfortable beds. We thoroughly enjoyed the location, as it was on a quiet canal with few tourists, and we were able to appreciate life in Venice and not just the touristy side of Venice. We went to a neighborhood restaurant all three nights because it was a typical neighborhood restaurant and not a tourist destination and we thoroughly enjoyed the food, the waiters and the convenient location. The owner of Ca Dogaressa and his family/staff went out of their way to help us with whatever we needed, and served a delicious continental breakfast sitting next to the canal. A great hotel that was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint small hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mdkott
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel! The staff was so attentive and helpful. The rooms were decorated in Venetian style. The location was the greatest. We were served breakfast on the canal each morning. They also have a terrace overlooking the canal for breakfast or a nightcap. The neighborhood location was convenient to the airport and the train station. We have stayed in the touristy San Marco area in the past but much preferred this quiet neighborhood to get a real "feel" for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, elegant authentic Venetian boutique hotel- perfect location, wonderful hosts - always wish we could stay longer.”
Reviews.Author: Willstars
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay and again we had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautifully furnished and maintained. Serviced daily, very clean and comfortable. Breakfast served beside the canal gives a magical start to every day. Hosts and staff are warm and welcoming..

Reviews.Title: “I miss this place”
Reviews.Author: Drworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple times- once in December 2010, and then had to return when I revisited Venice January 2011. The rooms are majestic and charming. It is a quaint hotel off the beaten path in Venice. Such a nice stroll from the main road. I would recommend this place to someone comfortable being a bit removed, and able to carry your own suitcase from the train station- not easy to get to by boat. I stayed here on my own, and truly it was very enchanting and magical.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: workanai
Reviews.Content: I debated whether to get a hotel closer to the Grande Canal- and I am so glad I went with this place! First off, it's close to the train station! So we were able to walk with our luggage when the ATVO bus dropped us off, and easily walk to the train station when catching our train to Florence. Secondly, the service at the hotel is great. We really appreciated that they prepared our breakfast for us at 7am when they found out we were catching an early train. Lastly, the breakfast on the side of the canal is priceless. I am not quite sure if any other hotels offer this unless you are staying at a high-end hotel on the Grande Canal. It's really nice to see a less busy canal in the morning before the day gets started. The rooms are great- very spacious! And they were very clean!!! We would def come back here when going to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Little Charmer away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: NellyD_80
Reviews.Content: Charming little room, beautifully decorated and very clean and tidy. Lovely staff. We had a car and parked at Garage San Marco, and this was about a 10 minute walk with our bags (which was very close compared to some other hotels). It's also quite close to the train station, as well as a water ferry stop. It is however, a fair distance from St. Marks square and the Rialto bridge, but we didn't mind the walk through the bustling streets. Breakfast by the canal was a great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: ju55y71
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went for a long weekend for my birthday, the hotel was every bit Venetian as the pictures show on their website, making it even more amazing to stay in. The area was peaceful and far enough from touristy areas but near enough to be in walking distance of everything. Had a wonderful trip, the staff at the hotel were very accomodating and helpful. The maps they provided us with were great.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Pilatesboy
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Ca' Dogaressa in Venice. The location is very close to the train station, with a validates stop just 200m away. Paolo is an excellent host, and always charming and helpful. Daniele is efficient and a problem solver. The rooms are lavishly furnished in Venetian style, but with all modern amenities- wifi, sat tv, clean, modern bathroom. able to walk everywhere within 30mins, and only 25 mins ferry ride from murano. Breakfast by the grand canal was a great way to start the day, and paolo's coffee is excellent! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: London_G_and_T
Reviews.Content: I booked for a surprise romantic weekend with my partner and could not have asked for a better hotel. It looks as quaint and traditionally venetian as it does on their website. I asked for flowers in the room and they supplied a beautiful bouquet for a very reasonable price, and even better they upgraded us to a lovely suite overlooking the canal. The rooms have double glazing and blackout shutters so we had the best sleep ins ever. The hotel is in a quiet area, just 10 mins walk from the train station, right next to a peaceful canal with a river bus stop outside, breakfast is al fresco and canalside....perfect! The owner and staff are very friendly and helpful, with good English too so can help with any tourism queries (but unlike some hotels they do not try and sell you things at commission).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1_w0rld
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from the Venezia SL train station. about 10mins walk. follow their instruction. don't buy the useless map from train station - waste of 50cents. only 1 bridge to cross that has ramps to help with rolling luggage over. Delightful staff - Paolo and Danielle. They can give you a good map. Stayed 2nights with 3ppl. Absolutely gorgeous rooms. Beautifully furnished - speechless. Good breakfast by the canal. Would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Really great”
Reviews.Author: chariot
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. It was reasonably priced (for Venice) in a great location away from the main tourist areas. It's a short walk from the Guglie vaporetto stop and the directions given by the hotel make it easy to find. You can also walk from the bus station or train station, although getting the vaporetto is very easy and better if you have luggage to carry. The door to the hotel is round the side down the small alleyway. Our room and bathroom were comfortable, very clean and quiet with wireless internet, TV and plenty of storage, and we could [just] see the canal. There is a lovely roof terrace at the front of the hotel for guests to use which gives a great view of the canal and it especially pretty at night. The staff were very friendly and helpful, giving suggestions on places to eat and visit. Breakfast is just breads and croissants but there is plenty available, and tea/coffee and juice too and if the weather is nice you can have it outside next to the canal or in your room for no extra charge. There is a mini bar in the rooms which isn't too expensive. There's also a safe free of charge for your valuables, and they will kindly hold your luggage after you check out if needed, with a bathroom (toilet, sink and shower) to freshen up in. Some tips for Venice: If staying for a few days and are going to use the vaporetto & bus from the airport then it may be worth getting a pass from hellovenzia which covers 24, 36, 48 etc hours. Book more than 1 week in advance from veniceconnected to get discount. I think you can also get discount on attractions from this website too. Take bus number 5 from Marco Polo airport to get to Pizzale Roma (the stop is just outside the airport). Then take vaporetto 42 or 52 to get to the Guglie stop for the Ca'Dogaressa, and 41 or 51 to get back to Pizzale Roma at the end of your stay. Everywhere is in good walking distance - it's great to walk and get lost down the little streets and alleyways as you nearly always come out at the Grand Canal. Take comfortable shoes and stop at one of the many cafes, and it is useful to take a map and/or small guidebook with you so you can look up what things may be around you. Note things are much more expensive the nearer St Marks Square/the tourist areas you get (e.g. bottle of water is 1 Euro near this hotel but over 3 Euro near the square) - stock up before you go! Gondolas are expensive - around 80 Euro in the daytime and 100 Euro at night, although it's a very special experience at night.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel fairly close to the train station.”
Reviews.Author: usfBullsFan1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. The breakfast was very limited however it was enough to get you going. They had croissants and cereals available along with various juices and coffee. The hotel has Internet access available for free which I found to be a plus. The room was nice and large and the bathrooms were nice and clean. The bed was rather hard however. There did not seem to be many restaurants around the immediate vicinity. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I would stay here again if I were in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DARAMARKB
Reviews.Content: Location was great - we walked from the train station to the hotel (about 8 - 10 minutes) with our bags - very easy. Off the main drag so there wasn't too much noise at night. The hotel and our room was beautiful and clean - gorgeous room. Quite large with a huge bed and a large sofa bed and plenty of room to move around. Gorgeous bathroom - seemed brand new. The only problem with our room was that it had a big tub with a hand-held shower-head and no shower curtain. Free wifi worked great. Breakfast was included but was kind of sparse - just bread and jams and yogurt - nothing else ...But the staff was friendly and helpful and always smiling. Great stay in an amazing city (and during Carnival which was great). Definitely recommend this hotel and Venice in general...no other place like it in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Well decorated, very clean, comfortable and romantic!”
Reviews.Author: hlocke
Reviews.Content: We were really surprised by Ca' Dogaressa, but in the best way possible! We didn't really expect too much with the price we paid, but this place would surpass any expectations. First of all, it is in a great place, very close to Guglie vaporetto station, and also in easily walking distance from the main locations in Venice. The rooms are decorated very nicely, in a vintage style. Even though the room is a bit small, it makes up for that with a big and comfortable bed, and a big bathroom. Everything was extremely clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was Italian style (croissant, different jams and Nutella, coffee or tea), but seconds of everything are always offered if you wish for more. Oh, also a nice touch were the books on the first floor: Venice guides and other books in English, which I presume were left by guests. My thanks to the person who left the Lonely Planet Venice guide there, it was excellent reading.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and welcoming hotel in beautiful and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JSW23
Reviews.Content: Very friendly welcome, staff were keen to help and answer any questions. Very clean hotel, in great location next to the canal and a very short walk up from Guglie vaporetto stop. Plenty of nice places to eat nearby. Breakfast is included in price, and we didn't need to ask for 2nd cup of coffee. Wi-fi was being installed during our stay, it wasn't particularly reliable but it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: JeevesNapa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2009, and there could not be a better place to stay in Venice. This hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in my entire life. I loved this hotel. The people were wonderful and they gave us excellent restaurant recommendations every night. The rooms were beyond my wildest dreams. I loved this hotel, and I would not dream of staying anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful atmospheric hotel with excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: antoniasorenson
Reviews.Content: This hotel was delightful! The rooms are impeccably decorated in old Venetian style, with all modern amenities. Breakfast was delicious and abundant. The owners and the staff were warm, helpful and excellent representatives of the Venetian people. We stayed for 7 days and it really felt like home to us. Would absolutely stay there again should we return to Venice in the future. (Oh, one note of warning: pack knee-high rain boots for the flooding that happens with certain phases of the moon and the tides of the ocean. The street outside the hotel and many of the streets of Venice (including those by major tourist attractions) are sometimes filled with 12" of water! We managed to purchase boots for everyone in our family for 15 Euros each, but we ruined our shoes in the process of making it to the store. Several days during our stay were dry and we were grateful -- the adventure of wading in water lost its charm quickly!)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: annorken90
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ca'Dogaressa for one night. We had a wonderful time in despite of the bad weather (rain). Polo and staff were extremely helpful. Thank you for your help on tracking our lost luggage. We would definitely return here if we return to Venice. Room was very clean and breakfast was great. Nice walk from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a lovely short stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: MZE83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one short night in December 2010. We chose the hotel because it is close to the train station and we had a late train to catch. We read positive reviews in TA and we were not disappointed. Hotel is located on a quiet strip approx 10 mins walk from the main train station and approx 20 mins walk from the "touristy" area of Venice. We like the walk so it was not at all a problem for us. It's a lovely hotel. Our room was well furnished, clean and spacious- perfect for relaxing after a long day in Venice. Breakfast was adequate and served in the dining room. Wi-Fi is not available but we were given a DSL cable for our computer which was fine. The hotel staff were extremely warm and helpful. We kept our bags at the hotel after check out and were permitted to use the bathroom to freshen up upon our return. Only complaint is that we were given a room which is immediately next to reception and breakfast room therefore quite noisy at times. As we only stayed one night it was more convenient than problematic though. Some of the larger hotels in the centre had amazing discounts during this time of year (not much more expensive than this hotel) but Im still glad we chose this place and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: grumpymum42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the St Mark's square area- Thank Goodness. There are so many things to see in Venice and St Marks is only 1 of them. My Mother and I spent 5 days in Venice. We extensively used the water buses. Every where we travel in Europe people say WALK. If you just walk you miss so many wonderful sights. Make sure you go on the Venice Connected site and buy your water bus pass, toilet pass and look at all the information, including DIY walking tours. Also go on the Rick Steve's website and downlad all the relevant pod casts for Venice. I down loaded the Venice connected walking tour of San Polo District. You can get on the water bus stop outside the hotel and get off at the train station to start this tour. I downloaded the Rick's Steves podcast of the Frari Church and this walking tour became a special experience. Try Rick Steve's DIY Grand canal tour. It works very well. We especially enjoyed visiting Ca Rezzoica (an old palace-now museum) and the Acadamia. All the great sites are a water bus ride away. The hotel was a cool and relaxing place to return to. It is in a friendly area with lots of markets and shopping 300m away. We did not feel as safe at night in the St Marks area. The staff were wonderful. The room was old world charm with modern facilties. The TV was tiny but to be honest we never turned it on. Do some research first and enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and Venice!”
Reviews.Author: betterholmes
Reviews.Content: We took a bus from the airport into Venice and followed the instructions on the hotel website to walk. It took us about 10 mins and so easy to find. The other reviews are spot on, it is a lovely find, the inside is beautiful. The staff are all without exception helpful and very welcoming. We had a standard room that looked over a simple walkway but was still beautiful to look out onto the other buildings, just typical Venice. Our room was gorgeous and had everything you would need - hairdryer, lovely big shower, fridge, safe and tv with English news. We enjoyed breakfast, plenty of delicious croissants, very hot strong coffee, fresh bread and jams and cheese. It was lovely to start with a simple breakfast for a change. When we left we caught the river bus to airport which stops outside the hotel and takes you direct for 13 Euros each. Venice is devine and the sights and shopping are what you would expect. We will definately go back and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small family hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sayer
Reviews.Content: The Ca' Dogressa Hotel is a family run hotel on the Canaregio Canal. We stayed in the suite, which overlooks the canal at the front of the hotel. It is ideal for a family with two children as you can all stay in the same room. The room is furnished in a traditional Venetian style is a good size and has a decent sized bathroom. There is a good size bath, but only a hand shower and no shower curtain. The hotel is located close by to the Old Jewish Ghetto. Indeed on both the Friday and Saturday nights there along the canal, up from the hotel long tables were set up outside and a large group of Jewish people celebrated the Sabbath. The Old Jewish Ghetto is well worth a visit, not least of all because it feels very different from traditional Venice. Despite our stay being late in October we were able to have breakfast outside by the canal each morning watching the world go by up and down the canal. The hotel is in a residential area where real Venetians live. This is nice to either begin or return to at the end of the day and you feel like you have escaped from the tourist crush that is St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. The hotel is located close to the top end of one of the main shopping streets and there are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants close by. It will take around twenty minutes to thirty minutes to walk to St Mark's Square, but the walk is both pleasant and interesting. Alternatively there are two water bus stops close by. The hotel can sell you tickets and passes for the water bus. This hotel is not luxurious, nor is it the most romantic location, but I would highly recommend it for a family weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!!”
Reviews.Author: seagullrob
Reviews.Content: We were travelling around Italy with 3 other couples, spending time in Rome, Venice, Tuscany and Cinque Terre. We chose Hotel Caâ€™ Dogaressa in Venice after internet and Tripadvisor research. It was brilliant.
