We had booked two Junior Suites and two Classic Doubles, but one couple was luckily upgraded to a Superior Double, so we got a look at all of the types of rooms. My wife and I had one of the Junior Suites overlooking the Canale di Cannaregia, on the second floor. All of the rooms looked great (very ornate, but in keeping with the atmosphere of Venice), but the Suites were terrific. Ours was all yellow; the one on the first floor was decked out in green. There was plenty of room in the Junior Suite, which had a double bed, wardrobe, chest of drawers, fridge, TV, and suite of furniture. The bathroom was full of marble, with a bath (and shower attachment) and bidet. Thereâ€™s a terrace on the roof with furniture to enjoy. And yes, as mentioned, we had a great view of the Canal from our window. Breakfast was very good â€“ juices, teas, hot chocolate and real coffee; croissants and pastries; yoghurt, cereals and the like. There was nothing cooked, but the pastries were all fresh. All of the staff were fabulous â€“ really helpful and friendly. Shops were numerous and close by, as were restaurants and cafes. There was a couple of vaporetto (water bus) stops on the Canale di Cannaregia. Incidentally, in case there is any doubt, Venice was just awesome! We travelled in from Florence by train to the main train station on the island (Stazione Santa Lucia) and followed the directions on the website. They instructions were accurate and easy to follow. We left Venice the same way, walking over the Guglie Bridge with our cases. Hotel Caâ€™ Dogaressa was a terrific choice, and I would have no hesitation in staying here again (and indeed, hope to do so). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: jotoJesusPobre
Reviews.Content: Thank you other trip advisor travellors you were all correct in your reviews! Lovely helpful service, breakfast on the edge of the canal in October in the sun! Near the station, boat stops, and car rental so ideal for travellers, and in an area less expensive but very interesting

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Gem”
Reviews.Author: oldmungobhoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this excellent hotel for 6days and managed to get the junior suite for the last 3days. The hotel setting isexcellent as it is only minutes away from acess to all the main tourist sites but still manages to portray a peaceful idllic setting.It reminded me of those sleepy old american western towns although there is a vibrancy about it in the mornings as all the working barges sail into Ven ice with their various goods. The hotel seems to be almost exclusively family operated and this reflects in tha care and attention shown to the guests, nothing appears to be a problem and as well as regaling you with stories if his Venetian ancestry, Giampaolo, il padrone,is only to happy to advise you of all the best restaurants etc,so don't hesitate to ask.

Reviews.Title: “"Impossibly" good”
Reviews.Author: TrufflesAndCo
Reviews.Content: - Incredibly friendly service, down to the complimentary bottled water that we were offered when we checked out - Wonderful residential location, very peaceful. About 25 mins walk to St Marks Square (and a chance to get lost on the way) - Charming rococo decor in the room - Roof terrace with views of the peaceful canal - No down points, although some people may find the beds slightly on the hard side

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel on Quiet Side-Canal”
Reviews.Author: JandK-Sydney
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed room. Daniel is extremely helpful and friendly and staying at this hotel added to a beautiful 5 night stay in Venice. Would recommend this hotel - close to station and ferry stop almost at the door but away from the busy tourist route.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Charming”
Reviews.Author: wwtraveler11
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we (and the other couple we were traveling with) were both upgraded from a classic double to a superior double and a superior double to a junior suite with a canal view. Both rooms were large with the suite having a separate sitting area. The only complaint both of us had was that there was no actual shower. It was very interesting for my 6â€™-3â€� husband to take a bath! Iâ€™m surprised they didnâ€™t glass in the tub and make it shower (which seems like it would be easy to do). The rooms were very clean and the breakfast in the morning was wonderful which included juice, coffee, yogurt, cereal, and bread/croissants. There is free internet at the hotel; we just had to ask the front desk for a cord. The staff was wonderful and was always there when we had a question. Also, at the time we booked, there was no minimum two night stay which was very helpful since we were taking a cruise the next morning. It is about a 10-15 minute walk from the train station and very easy to find. When we return to Venice someday, we will be sure to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “One night was not enough ...”
Reviews.Author: aatrip08
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel in August for 1 night. We had originally booked for 2 nights but were held up elsewhere & couldn't get there for the first night. I contacted the hotel & they were nice enough to amend my booking with no quarms. We arrived by car which dropped off at the car rental return and walked to the hotel. The hotel was a nice walk and is located in a perfect spot just off the main tourist walk. The location was perfect. Venice is made for walking and this hotel was perfect for venturing out and seeing all of the sights. It was great to be able to come back to a quieter area of an evening! The owner of the hotel was a lovely man who checked us in, we were lucky enough to have our friend who could speak italian with us who helped us with check-in. The owner explained how he usually doesnt do the check-in and wasnt very fluent in english, but he was fine! We checked-in and left our bags as our room wasnt ready as we were there early. When we returned to the hotel & check into our room, we were so thrilled with the room. We had a junior suite which was perfect!! Great king bed, sitting area, spotless bathroom. The view also had a view across the canal out the front. We had asked the lady at the reception of a recommedation for dinner, she recommended a resturant at the start of the street close to the main tourist area, we checked it out and it was quite expensive, so we decided elsewhere. There are plenty of restaurants directly across from the hotel, we ate at the restaurant which was directly across & closest to the bridge. It was great, reasonably priced, good food & good service. Breakfast at the hotel was a light continental served out front on the canal. Overall, this hotel is a real find in Venice. I'm so happy that i found it on tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Exceed Expectation !”
Reviews.Author: Juli881
Reviews.Content: Quite lame to travel here alone but still, this is the best hotel for the most romantic city in the world. As you might guess, Venice is very small, so location is not so important as from this hotel, you can walk to anywhere. I like the rooms in this hotel. They let me preview some of the rooms before deciding and there are rooms that looks over the canal, very nice. Traditional bathroom, but nice. Very comfortable. Top tip for this hotel is the staff. They are very friendly and exceptionally helpful and knowledgable. They gave me advices on which restaurants in Venice. I would recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Pure charm”
Reviews.Author: Nightflight
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, Paolo,the manager was all cham and helpfulness. We were offered a choice of well appointed rooms, were given complimentary bottles of chilled water as it was warm day and offered a complimentary bottle of prosecco on the roof terrace later! Breakfast was on the canalside each morning, served with a smile.All the staff were helpful whenever we needed anything. The hotel is in aquieter part of Venice and so was not swamped with other tourists but the stop for the vaporetto and the airport waterbus (Linea Arancio) was only 200m away, sogetting to and from the airport was a doddle, compared to most of the hotels in the San Marco area. Ww would happily book there again. It is worth bearing in mind that, like most old buildings in Venice, there is no lift.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Venkatesht
Reviews.Content: Location and people make the hotel a gem. My wife and I along with out 3 year old son spent two nights on a short break in Venice. Would be hard to find a better host than Paulo. The hotel price is worth it just for the pleasure of breakfast by the canal. The breakfast itself is basic, but the experience is priceless. The location only a little distance away from the grand canal and the main tourist siteswas for us the best feature. The vaperetto stop is conveneiently located and we also got the opportunity to walk through the streets of Venice. We will go back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away excellence on a canal”
Reviews.Author: scochranesalem
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at this location on a hot and sunny day, we were greeted by the owner, Paolo with 2 chilled bottles of water. It was a welcoming site. The room we stayed in was on the main floor next to the front desk, yet very quiet. The room was very large. The bathroom was quite roomy with all the necessities needed. Larger accommodations for our travel items would be a nice gesture. Other than that, no other complaints at all! The location was a short stroll to the main piazza and shopping. Lots of restaurants to choose from. On the last day in Venice, Paolo presented us a complimentary bottle of champagne. My lady friend had dropped a hint that I was there to celebrate my 50th birthday in Italy. He took the cue and ran with it. It was great leaving Venice on that note...drinking a bottle of bubbly. We reached the roof-top terrace and took-in the view and reminisced about our 17 day, 5 city tour of Italy and saying over and over, "I don't want to go home"....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice clean big rooms, nice helpful owner”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveler8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel Ca Dogaressa in August 2010 based on its great Trip Advisor reviews. We were pleased with the hotel. It was a short (10 minute) walk from the Santa Lucia train station to the hotel. The directions on the hotel's website were easy to follow. The hotel is in a good area on a larger canal (but not the grand canal). I liked the location because you got a bit of a break from the noise and congestion of St. Mark's Square and the other touristy areas. The hotel has a laptop with internet which you can borrow and use in your room- this was very convenient. The hotel owner is very friendly and helpful and speaks excellent English. We paid 125 Euros per night for a double superior room which, based on my research of other hotels, I think was pretty reasonable for Venice. The room was a good size & the shower was the largest of the 3 hotels we stayed in Italy. The only downside I would say was the breakfast- it was very small (yogurt, a croissant, and coffee/tea/juice). The other hotels we stayed in Italy had a bit more options for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Too good to miss !”
Reviews.Author: Bomiles
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for 2 nights before heading back to Milan. But this hotel has given us more than we expected. In term of location this is just a short walk from the bus terminal. No complaint ! About the rooms, the hotel doesn't have many rooms but what we got was a suite, looking over the canal... very nice ! It is designed as such as what one would imagine to be classically Venitian style. About the service, i love the breakfast as it is light but delightful and you can see all the boats along the canal. The staff were all very attentive and helpful. Anyway, we love this hotel as much as we love Venice itself.

Reviews.Title: “well worth recommending”
Reviews.Author: milledyn
Reviews.Content: This hotelâ€™s location is good. The members of staff are exceptionally kind and helpful and they speak English perfectly. We arrived very early following a train journey all night and were offered breakfast and storage of luggage until our room was ready. We were upgraded to the suite overlooking the canal â€“ beautiful room, nice view, nicely furnished and clean. Amenities include shampoo, toothbrush and paste, showercap. Internet is available in the room if you ask for a cable, and the boat to the airport is just 200 metres away. We were even offered bottles of water for the trip when we left. Actually, the only negative is that the air-conditioning is noisy even when turned off, other than that it is an exceptional value for money hotel, well worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: “A Great, Non-Touristy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elk34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two teenage daughters. Theblocation in the Jewish Ghetto was really nice. It gave the feel of what real Venice is away from the tour crowds. Paulo and his family treated us great. The room was big and very nice. The view of the canal from the two bedroom windows was great. The bathroom was spacious and nice. The girls had to sleep on a pull out bed but it was ok. The breakfast on the canal was the highlight of the stay. It was really fun to sit and watch the normal work day of Venice go on while we ate breakfast. They let us keep our bags in the lobby after we checked out which was nice. I really didn't like Venice much because it is so crowded and touristy but this place is a great hide away. I would definitely recommend it and stay there again

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: toronto4
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Ca' Dogaressa during a heat wave in July. We were warmly greeted upon arrival and given a much appreciated cold bottle of water. Our first night was spent in a quiet room beside the front desk and breakfast room. The room was decorated with beautiful lacquered furniture. Due to prior reservations, we were upgraded the second night to a lovely junior suite, on the second floor, overlooking the canal. Each morning, we enjoyed breakfast outside watching "traffic" along the canal. Then we had interesting walks from the hotel to the various major tourist sites. On my next visit to Venice, I would definitely stay at the Ca' Dogaressa again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto!”
Reviews.Author: celine0606
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Ca' Dogaressa in Venise and we can only recommend it ! It is ideally located near the main train station, in a very interesting area. The room are totally clean and charming, the service is simply great ! Both Hotel responsible and employees are client-oriented, helpful, caring, flexible, easy-going and smiling. They gave us very good tips as where to go eat and what to visit. Breakfast takes place outside, by the Canal, in the sun, the food tastes good and coffee is delicious ! If you this Hotel piqued your curiosity, we definitely encourage you to go ahead !

Reviews.Title: “Reviews too good to be true?...”
Reviews.Author: JoeGem
Reviews.Content: ... absolutely not! This is a fabulous little hotel (only 9 bedrooms) and we were made to feel so welcome, with no request being too much trouble. On arrival we were greated with some complimentary bottled water, which although not a grand gesture, could not have been more welcome as we had just walked from the train station, with our luggage, in the searing midday heat. Our room was ready early, and we were able to check in straight away, around 1 o'clock. We were in room 2, and despite being the smallest in the hotel, it was perfectly adequate for our needs. It was beautifully decorated in a Venetian style, and was impeccably clean throughout. Breakfast on the canal each morning was a really pleasant start to the day, with the continental selection proving more than enough to fill up on. The staff were teriffic, always helpful, and were happy to bring a tray of tea's up to our room on request (for a small fee, 5 Euro's I think) as we didn't have the facilties to make them. The location was fantastic, very quiet, but such a short distance away from the main attractions. All factors considered, this without doubt is one of the best hotels we have stayed in. Perhaps not the most luxurious, but perfect for Venice where you really shouldn't be spending much time inside!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Nice Area of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kiwis-travelling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Junior Suite for our 2 night stay recently, prior to our cruise. Our suite was on the first floor overlooking the canal. The room was the largest we have stayed in during our 5 week trip to Europe, and was very quiet, and had fantastic air conditioning. The hotel is lovely, in a pefect position if arriving by train as we did. It is approx. 10 mins to walk to the hotel from the train station, and it is approx. 25 mins walk into St Marks square which is perfect, because you meander through many small alleyways and shops en route. Breakfast was served outside by the canal, and was more than adequate for a days walking and sightseeing. There are some excellent restaurants along the same canal which we tried. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends, and will never stay anywhere else whenever we visit Venice. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hope48
Reviews.Content: Fabulous position beside the Cannaregio canal with a lovely roof terrace to sit and watch the boats go by. Traditional venetian decor in the room but very comfortable with modern bathroom and very importantly air conditioning. A real treat to sit by the canal eating breakfast and relaxing over a cappuccino. All the staff were very helpful and welcoming. Lots of nice restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in recommending this hotel whatsoever - a fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Runrabbitrun1970
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ca Dogaressa for one night only - the 04th July 2010 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed in a Junior Suite overlooking the canal - room # 501, it was large, clean & elegant. We arrived quite early and dropped our luggage at reception before heading off to explore Venice. The weather during our two days in Venice was unbelievably hot and humid, even the locals were feeling it! We returned to the hotel later in the afternoon completely worn out from the heat and all the walking around we did to find our room ready for us. We climbed the two or three flights of stairs to our room, opened the door and were welcomed by a beautiful room with the air conditioning already turned on to greet us - just what we needed. The staff are lovely and very helpful, the hotel has a homely family atmosphere and it is located not too far from Piazzale Roma and has a water bus stop just a minutes walk from the front door of the hotel. All in all, a great experience - we will return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful base for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: Steveh15
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at Ca Dogaressa in Venice following the Trip Advisor recommendations. All I can say is that the great reviews on Trip Advisor are absolutely true and if we return to Venice I would not hesitate to stay there again. Nothing was too difficult for Paulo and his team - on day one, my daughter lost one of her earings down the sink - Paulo arranged for someone to come in and retrieve it, much to her delight. Breakfast on the canal every morning was a delight - great espresso too. Our room was immaculate - from the terrazzo floors to the Murano glass fittings and fabric covered walls. The only suggestion I could possibly make is better pillows (having said that they are certainly acceptable). The hotel is an easy walk to the station and a Vaporetto stop (although we didnt really get the value out of the 48 hour pass we bought - walking through Venice is easy and alot of fun (hence we didn't really use the Vaporetto all that much). One last thing - in summer, Venice is seriously hot!!...coming back to a comfortable, pristine air-conditioned room every afternoon was just perfect! Dont consider anywhere else - Ca Dogaressa is perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: atwell4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca' Dogaressa on our final leg of a 17 day, self-guided tour of Italy. What a wonderful way to end our vacation. The 24-hour staff was excellent. My friend was celebrating her 50th birthday and they had a bottle of champagne waiting! How thoughtful. The breakfasts--right on the canal--were very tasty...and filling. The generous supply of food and beverage continued until we said "enough!" We loved the location--on a working canal--where we could watch the boats bring in supplies each day. Our room was "roomy" for Italian standards and the bathroom was fresh and clean. We appreciated the safe in the room where we locked our passports during our stay. We also enjoyed the rooftop terrace where we celebrated her birthday with the complimentary bottle of champagne and Venice views in the background. Totally picturesque. What I liked best? This is NOT in the touristy area. People live and work in this neighborhood. It was easy (and pleasant) to "get lost" on our treks to St. Marks Square. It was a quiet location and we felt very comfortable walking--even late at night. I liked the peaceful location away from the tourists. I loved the hospitality of the staff. Travel to and from the hotel with luggage was extremely convenient. I am ready to return and would definitely stay at this property again! And they provided a laptop computer so we could check email and complete our airline check-in. Thanks Ca' Dogaressa for a wonderful experience at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous intimate hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ItalianoStalliono
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying in this part of Venice, definitely inspired us to return. The hotel was in a good location, not too close to the main tourist area but close enough to walk into. The staff were exceptionally helpful, especially the younger man on the reception desk. He was friendly and knowledgable and happy to offer advice and call restaurants on our behalf. The breakfast by the canal was really enjoyable (especially due to the unexpected good weather) and the brioche were particularly good! The hotel has fewer rooms than most and we stayed in the suite at the front, overlooking the canal. The room was the perfect size and the decor was what one would imagine to be classically Venitian. The bed was comfortable and the only change we'd suggest is the addition of a shower in the bathroom. We would recommend taking a regular water taxi from the airport as the hotel is on the near side (although the private water taxi is brilliant fun!) Overall, a fabulous intimate hotel, which we look forward to returning to.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Wonderfully Accommodating"”
Reviews.Author: Sutton_Miller22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ca' Dogaressa because of the superior reviews on Trip Advisor. They were right! The hotel is about a 7 minute walk from the train station, very easy to find. The bathroom was large, which is unusual for Italy. There was a long bathtub (I am 6'4" and fit in it with room to spare) equipped with a hand held shower. The only criticism is that it was virtually impossible not to soak the floor, as there was no curtain. Another thing that would have been nice is to have a full length mirror somewhere in the room. That aside, the hotel was more than we had anticipated. Being in the residential area, we were not confronted by mass crowds, tour groups, or noise. We were able to walk very peacefully and comfortably at night. The room itself, named Laura, was on the third landing, and was quite cozy with a Murano glass chandelier and gold leaf accents on all of the furniture. The concierge, Daniele, was extremely helpful, warm, and friendly. Breakfast was nice with fresh orange juice and a typical assortment of pastries, jams, and yogurt served alfresco. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, incredibly helpful and friendly owner”
Reviews.Author: MrsP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my brother and sister-in-law for two nights, having booked on the recommendation of fellow Tripadvisors. We were not disappointed! The hotel is small, more of a guest house really, only 9 rooms. Immaculately clean and decorated in Renaissance style giving it a luxurious feel. All the usual facilities such as toiletries, air con and mini bar. Paulo the owner was very friendly and helpful, always going above and beyond to make our stay special. As my sister in law has mentioned he even gave us a chilled bottle of Prosecco to drink on the roof terrace and served us breakfast at an outside table by the canal. Location is quiet but just a short walk from the Grand Canal and a Vaparetto stop. (I would highly recommend buying a Vaparetto pass for unlimited rides). Breakfast was simple but nicely presented and perfectly fine for us. I plan on returning to this hotel, in the hope of seeing more of Venice, in better weather!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic, excellent, brilliant. outstanding what more can I say.”
Reviews.Author: jsp55red
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel with my Sister and Brother-in-law for our yearly city break. I really dont know where to start. From the second we arrived until the second we left the owner Paulo could not do enough for us. Nothing was too much trouble. What a difference from the chain hotel we stayed in the night before our flight. The hotel was immaculately clean throughout, the decor was beautiful and the whole feel of the hotel was very relaxing. My husband and I opted for a superior room which had a little more space than the standard rooms but our sister and brother in law stayed in a standard and it was just as good just a little less floor space and we had a bath. If you prefer a shower to a bath I would not upgrade we did have a shower over the bath but it was not high up on the wall and we were not able to stand under it. The roof top terrace was a real bonus and we enjoyed drinks on it before we went out for dinner, and also enjoyed or night cap on it before bedtime. The roof top over looked the canal on the front of the hotel so it was nice to relax on an evening. On our first morning Paulo set up tables on the side of the canal where we sat and enjoyed our breakfast whilst watching the boats go by with the local fruit and veg deliveries amongst other things. When we returned to our room from breakfast the house keepers had been in and our room was all cleaned and tided with the bed made and fresh towels. On our second evening Paulo gave us a bottle of very nice wine free of charge and we were very appreciative of that and we enjoyed that before going out for dinner. On our day of leaving it was torrential thunder storms so we had breakfast in the downstairs breakfast room which was nice. We had to check out before 11.00am which we did although we were not leaving for the airport until 12.30. Paulo stored our luggage for us and also let us use the hotel umbrellas to just do a bit of last minute shopping. My husband managed to break one of the umbrellas and we offered to pay for it but Paulo would not here of it. Even after checking out there was a courtesy bathroom with a shower in it and Paulo was more than happy to give us fresh towels if we needed them. Upon departing from the hotel Paulo was there and shook our hands what a personal touch. This hotel is a little bit away from the centre of the attractions but with the water boats everything is within easy reach so I would not worry about that. As it is a little bit away from the centre it is much quieter on a night so you get a better nights sleep. I would definatly go back to this hotel again if I visit Venice it made our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and great value”
Reviews.Author: EATALIA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in May and were completely charmed by our first time in Venice, the hotel and the lovely proprietor. The hotel is a short 10-minute walk, even with bags, from the train station. The hotel overlooks one of the canals in Venice, although our room (Lucretia Tancredi) did not have a view. The room was large for Italian standards and was clean and well-appointed, with a double bed, nightstands, writing table, TV and mini-bar. The room was also appointed with Murano glass type chandelier and light fixtures and the bedcover matched the beautiful fabric wall paper, which was a sumptuous touch that was really nice for achieving that â€œIâ€™m in Veniceâ€� feeling. The bathroom, too, was large, including the shower, which was a welcome change to the tiny showers one has come to expect in Italy. I donâ€™t mean to make the room sound extravagant, but nothing about it at all felt cheap. The A/C was not yet on in the hotel, but the room felt cool during the day, despite the heat outside, and we slept with an open window at night, so the room was actually well cooled by nice breezes and we found that we didnâ€™t need the A/C. We were able to borrow a laptop from the hotel for use in our room for a few hours, free of charge, which was very handy for checking up on things back home. There is no elevator in the hotel, but our room was only one flight up, so it didnâ€™t bother us. The hotel has four floors, though, so book a lower floor if climbing stairs is a problem. There is also a balcony on the roof of the hotel, with tables and umbrellas, providing views of the canal and daily Venetian life passing by. The location is very convenient, away from the hustle and bustle. As soon as you turn off the main street to reach the hotel, it feels like a different world, away from the tourists, and felt like it was just us and the Venetians. Venice is not that large, so it was no problem for us to walk to the sights, and Venice is so entertaining anyway that you donâ€™t notice the walk as you partake of everything you see along the way. Breakfast is the typical Italian breakfast â€“ cornetti and rolls with jam, Nutella, etc. and your choice of espresso, cappuccino, tea â€“ nothing large, but enough to get you going. The proprietor was so thoughtful and accommodating. On our last night, we brought a pizza back to the hotel and sat at a table outside to enjoy the view. He noticed this right away and came out to ask if we needed glasses, ice, or utensils. He then bade us a formal goodnight, shaking hands as he retreated to his home next door. Early the next morning, he was already up and was dismayed that he couldnâ€™t convince us to stay for breakfast. Again, there were formal handshakes to say goodbye â€“ such a charming Italian gentleman. A very welcoming hotel and atmosphere â€“ convinced us that we would like to go to Venice and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: APD611
Reviews.Content: Based upon the many positive comments posted on TripAdvisor, my wife and I decided to reserve three nights at Ca' Dogaressa for the first leg of our Italian vacation. The hotel and its staff lived up to its high rating - and more. Unfortunately for my wife and I, weather delays, volcanic ash clouds, and plane mechanical problems at the outset of our trip robbed us of nearly two days of precious vacation time. During this time, we sent a steady stream of emails to Ca' Dogaressa keeping them informed of our changing travel timetable. We finally arrived at Ca' Dogaressa late on the second day of our planned stay. When we checked out, we fully expected to pay the full 510 Euro for our reserved three night stay. Imagine our surprise when we learned that Ca' Dogaressa was not charging us for the first missed day, saving us 170 Euros! That, in our opinion, was exceptional customer service! They didn't have to waive the 170 euro room fee, nor did they even ask if we had trip insurance coverage (we didn't, but they didn't know that and it wasn't factored into their decision to waive the one day). A very loose translation of the explanation given by the proprietor was, "Because its the right thing to do." I am not saying that Ca' Dogaressa has a stated policy of waiving room fees for missed reservations. That is not the intent of this posting. But the treatment my wife and I received was genuinely personal and very much appreciated. I won't bore the reader with describing the other amenities of this hotel, it convenient location, and friendly staff. Those points are well covered in other prior postings. We solidly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: PerryGee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel on a quiet but very central canal within walking distance of train station and a 45 minute river bus to/from airport. Great service, wonderful breakfast outside next to the hotel. THe oewner couldn't be more accommodating as he let us wait there as we had an overnight train to catch at 9pm. Would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: bdwhite1
Reviews.Content: Located on one of the main canals, we were very impressed with the friendliness, service and cleanliness of the hotel. Every morning we ate breakfast on the canal, watching water taxi's and other boats go by. The rooms are decorated in 18th century style, so you won't forget staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in all respects”
Reviews.Author: travelizfun0327
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy and our last stop in Venice was the most special. Paolo the owner could not have been any more accommodating! He got us glasses and serving items so we could enjoy the 4th floor patio with drinks and snacks. Breakfast on the canal was picturesque and lovely. I'd recommend paying the extra for the upgraded room - we had one of each and the larger one was definitely worth the extra 20 euro a night! This hotel is by the Jewish quarter in a truly residential district. It's walking distance to the train station and easy to get to the hustle and bustle of Venice....but was truly Venice as we wanted it - quiet and peaceful. Truly a great experience. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Poppie11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ca' Dogressa with 3 girls friends for a weekend at the beginning of May. We had two rooms converted into twins on the 1st floor - they were extremely comfortable, clean with great size shower rooms. Breakfast served by the very charming Paolo can be taken outside by the Canal if warm enough and luckily enough it was for us on the Sunday morning. Fabulous breakfast with warm brioche, juice, delicious coffee and we were able to eat the fruit we had bought in the market earlier - try the peaches as they were like nectar! As mentioned, Paolo is a great host and nothing is too much trouble and we were treated like royalty!! The hotel is in a fantastic, quiet area that is well worth exploring in it's own right and very close to the Jewish Ghetto but it is also only a 20 minute walk to St Marks square and very close to a number of vaparetto's. Burano is well worth a trip as it is so pretty but the best way to enjoy this beautiful city is to walk, walk and walk and wonder off down the quiet back streets and canals. The hotel can be easily reached by taking a number 5 bus from the Airport and walking from the Bus Station - you can also buy a joint bus and vaparetto pass for the number of days you are staying, which proved very cost effective. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this little jewel...

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: lmf325
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed at the hotel after reading about it on this site. It is a 5-7 minute walk from the train station and right on the Cannaregio Canal. Our room was pretty & comfortable and the breakfast was very good. We got in early & dropped our luggage off before our room was ready, and on the day of departure we left the luggage again so we could sight-see before our train. It was very convenient and allowed us to make the most of our time in Venice. The host was very friendly & helpful. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully local experience.”
Reviews.Author: The_Travelling_Ts
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times at the Ca'Dogaressa as guests of Paolo and his family. The location in Carnareggio is not central but is surrounded by fabulous restuarants and bars, more affordable than the better known areas. Breakfast on the canal, served and prepared by the owners is a treat and it's amazing to start the day watching the locals at work and play. Take the time to buy some local delicacies at the local markets and enjoy the evening sunset from the rooftop patio. Paolo provided us with wine glasses, plates and cutlery when we did this and nothing is a problem. Have recommended to others and will hopefully stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jb_sr
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel/B&B was a delight from start to finish. Our host Paolo was very welcoming, and went out of his way to assist us. He even made us a coffee after the official breakfast time had finished, when we overslept one morning. The room was beautifully decorated, and very spacious. It was great to open the shutters on the windows in the mornings and see the boats out on the canal, and watch the locals greeting each other on their way to the markets or work. We would definitely stay at Ca' Dogaressa again.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: signorands
Reviews.Content: This was a slightly more expensive hotel than we had stayed in before, but it was so much nicer than anything we have seen before as well. The room was exquisite - beautifully detailed, modern clean bathroom. My wife flipped when she saw it,completely in awe - so it's clearly a good spot for a romantic gettaway! The hotel is perfectly located, facing onto a canal, within easy reach of good, canal-facing restaurants, 50m from the airport vaporetto stop and a short walk to the train station. It's also far enough away from the main pedestrian channels and the Canale Grande to be quiet and peaceful. And to top it all off, t he staff were wonderful - incredibly helpful and friendly. All in all, in was so much more than what I expected from a Venetian hotel. This was my third visit to the city, and, in large part thanks to the hotel, it was my favourite visit.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler036
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ca' Dogaressa last week and it was a wonderful find in Venice, very close to the train station- just 5 minutes walk located in a beautiful canal. the price was good for venice, and it was 20 minutes walk to san marco, the vaporetta stop is right in front of the hotel, mere 200 metres which is very important with kids who do not want to walk nonstop. the rooms are done in venetian style, very luxurious, everything spotlessly clean. the owners are very friendly, they even brought up breakfast to our room in person because my daughter was very tired to go down, you can also have your breakfast by the canal in tables arranged in front of the hotel. everything about the hotel, staff, location, rooms, breakfast, was perfect. it is far from the touristic crowds so you can experience venice as locals do but in an easy distance to all the major sites. safe location and definitely worth trying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about room”
Reviews.Author: SCohen48
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay away from the crowded streets. The room was very small, we were quite shocked when we saw it. We had arrived from Florence and there we had a beautiful, massive room overlooking a piazza, so we were disappointed with the small room with view on to a wall. The receptionist even made a joke about the size of the room being "sufficiently small" as he counted our cash at checkout, which we felt was over stepping the mark. I would recommend paying a bit more and getting a larger room, although as nobody had written about this in the reviews, we simply looked at the photos and thought we would also be getting a good room. Or simply finding another hotel in the Jewish quarter, which is where this B&B is located, as it is a lovely quiet area of the city. Breakfast was ok, again had better in Florence and also the people who were in bigger rooms seemed to have the preference on sitting outside next to the canal. The beds were small and didn't make for a good nights sleep. Overall I don't think it represented value for money, even in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldFrancophile
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great staff, beautiful rooms, breakfast good - by the side of the canal if warm enough. Away from tourist area but near enough to walk to all parts of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JBeck1967
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! Right from the start it was easy to get to from the train station and once there Daniele at the front desk immediately got out a map and showed us how to get around and located hot spots on the map for us. The area is so great because it is a little less touristy than near St. Mark's so the prices are better too but it is still an easy walk to all the major sights. One of our favorite meals in Venice was 2 blocks away on the same street at the Gam Gam. Awesome falafel and shawirma! We went back twice! Our room was beautiful and clean. Guests can go down to the breakfast room for breakfast or have it sent up to their room which we did and it was so great to eat breakfast in bed. Good food too. We would definately recommend this place and stay here again. The place was great and the staff were excellent!.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST little hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: mandywalter63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ca' Dogaressa for 4 nights. It was an excellent place to stay! I was looking for a hotel that was within walking distance to local sites, cleanliness, private bathroom and it needs to be quiet. I wa not disappointed at all. The room was very nice. We were able to sleep with our windows open and it was so peaceful...no cars, no scooters, no barking dogs, no people.....ahhh.... The hotel staff was wonderful and the breakfast was very nice, which was included in the price. We walked from the train station. Easy walk and took us about 15 minutes. Water taxi is almost right in front of the hotel. Exellent restaurant a little ways down the street from the hotel called, "GAM-GAM"It's a Kosher Bar and Restaurant and they serve "Jewish-Venetian" food. It was DELICIOUS and a welcome change after all of the heavy pasta and meat dishes we had been eating. My husband and I highly recommend it. Service was excellent also. We will definitely be staying at the Hotel Ca' Dogaressa on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little gem, we will go back again”
Reviews.Author: Big_Steve_HB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights whilst on a road trip across Europe between France & Slovenia. The place is small and family run (Paulo was the main man) and the quality of the rooms was brilliant. We had a room facing the canal and it had a little settee area as well. Only things to watch out for are the shower isn't a full sized one, it was over the bath and at low level (so you need to sit in the bath to wash) as we were only staying for a couple of nights it didn't bother us but if you are staying longer you might want to ask for a room with a proper shower in it. The view we had over the canal more than made up for the shower and the attitude of all of the staff was brilliant and really friendly. On the warmer morning they were more than happy for us to take breakfast outside on the canal side. The hotel is on one of the main waterbus routes around Venice (the 41 & 42) and you can buy tickets for the bus from the hotel reception. We took the 42 all the way round and it gave us a great value sight seeing tour including the ability to stop off on the island of Murano (where the famous Venetian glass is made). All in the boat trip took us 1.5 hours and cost us 15 Euro's each for a 12 hour day ticket.

Reviews.Title: “An off-the-beaten-path mom and pop hotel with old world charm and new world conveniences”
Reviews.Author: newyorktraveler96
Reviews.Content: This hidden gem off of the main walkways to and from the canal was a quick 10 minute walk from the train station. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Gianpaolo, the owner, who showed us to our first room, which in and of itself was a beauty. As we were getting settled, he stopped in to offer us an upgrade to one of the suites on the second level, overlooking the canal. His reasoning was that we should not be distracted by the noise of the check-in desk and the eating area (which the room was sandwiched between) and hence, offered us a more spacious suite with larger bed, stand alone closet/bureau, a large sitting area with pull-out bed, and a luxurious bathroom with spa tub. He told us he would keep the same price as the other room - we had booked the night before on an online website and were only there for one night. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the main thoroughfare that connects you to the rest of the island. The only drawback I could say we had was that it is located opposite the majority of the attractions, hence a longer walk. For some this may not be an issue (it really wasn't for us). Gianpaolo's wife, Graziella, offered us a great suggestion for lunch, where we had one of the best meals in our 10-day excursion of Italy (and that included visiting other cities like Rome, Florence, and Bologna!) Their hospitality in the morning during breakfast and at check-out were beyond all expectations. Fresh squeezed orange juice, homemade croissants, offers for cappuccino or American Cafe, etc. all added to the feeling of welcome. Definitely a 5-star experience here!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: juleslillie
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because all the good reviews. And it lived up to the reviews! Everyone that worked there were very pleasant and helpful, the only complaint is the restaurant they told us to go too.... The room was kind of small, but I'm from America and everything here is Big! I loved the fact that it was off the beaten path but too far from all the tourist attractions. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: Andi_and_Thao
Reviews.Content: We received a free upgrade to Junior Suite with canal view since all standard rooms were overbooked. In addition to the special offer we booked we got the best room of the hotel for just 70â‚¬ per night. I can figure the nice guy running this hotel wasn't all too happy about that, but he wouldn't send us away because that would hurt the reputation of the hotel too much. The hotel is in a reachable distance to the collective bus station, only bugger is that not all the bridges leading there have flattened staris to easily move heavy luggage. Other than that it's excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Einypw
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a quiet location. First time to Venice and found this little gem by reading reviews on here. Very welcoming staff and very helpful. Rooms are clean and well maintained. A good 30 minute walk to St. Marks square but its all the better for it a chance to wander the streets of Venice! Easy to reach via a water bus from airport ( stop 200 yrds from hotel 13 euros or a 10 mins walk from Bus station which is 2.50 euros). Breakfast in your room can be delivered free which is a great touch. Fantastic time in Venice and this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: Jon5440
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Ca' Dogaressa for four nights in February. We chose the hotel based on the excellent tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. We arrived by train and, despite horror stories about the difficulties of finding anything in Venice, had no trouble at all locating the hotel, which is situated on a secondary canal that was big enough to be interesting (lots of varied boat traffic to enjoy) yet more quiet and authentic feeling than the Grand Canal. It was an easy and enjoyable 10 minute walk from the train station, even with a light drizzle. We were greeted by Daniel, who we (wrongly) guessed to be the owner based on his knowledge of the facility and his stellar customer service. We chose the junior suite to have some extra room for our 4-year-old and enjoyed the canal views and the large size of both the room and the bathroom. The room was very clean and comfortable. The small tv has one or two English-language stations and the fridge has a little extra room for a drink or some just-purchased cheese. The room was large enough to even enable us to host friends also staying in the hotel with us for an impromptu picnic dinner with some great wine (decanted from those large glass jugs you'll see in some of the smaller shops), cheese, meat, and other goodies procured from the stores that shared the block. Breakfast is served either in your room or in the small breakfast room, and although not extensive, was fresh and filling (and the good cappachino certainly helped). Too bad it was winter, as I understand you can take breakfast out along the canal in warmer months - and mornings on that canal are really interesting with an interesting mix of boats passing by. We also had no problem with the free internet access, once we were lent a plug-in cord. The hotel even helped arrange a babysitter one night, which allowed us to really enjoy some of the fantastic restaurants in the nearby area. In addition to the hotel itself, the neighborhood is a great draw as well - not sure there is much of an "authentic" Venice left that is untouched by tourism, but we were so glad to be in a neighborhood where school kids were walking to class in the mornings and people were going about their everyday lives. Although only a short boat ride or longer (but rewarding) walk from St Marks, it felt far from some of the tourist excesses nearer to the square. Four nights allowed for hitting most of the tour book highlights, a few boat trips to nearby islands, and some worry free "lost' moments where nobody was in much of a hurry to get found! Finally, I'd recommend a multiday vaporetto pass - much easier and less annoying than shelling out 6.50 euro per ride. And even the 72-hour pass for two cost less than one gondola ride. This small hotel deserves to be sold out all the time - if there is a room available, grab it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Venice, even in Italy”
Reviews.Author: StephanieXF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conient for travel with big suitcase. the water bus stop is just in front of the hotel. our room was excellent (like a palace). the staff was very helpful. we visited different city in Italy, this was the best hotel in our jounery (better than 4 start hotel). i just want say: you must try this hotel. It was so valuable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Nique88
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in December and enjoyed our two nights at Ca'Dogaressa. The staff were some of the friendliest we came across in our European trip - always helpful with any questions we had. The hotel is very clean, comfortable and quiet. It is located in a lovely area of Venice with good restaurants and shopping. It is an easy 20 min walk to San Marco over lots of gorgeous little canals. We actually never noticed that it took 20 mins as there is so much to see along the way. Also it is an easy Vaporetto ride to Murano Island (only 5 stops away).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, Yummy breakfast, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGnomeUSA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent trip to Venice with my husband and infant son. The hotel was very quiet, the rooms were decorated in a fun renaissance Venician way which made it a fun place to stay. Our room had a nice wardrobe, little TV and a minibar/fridge (which was great for storing food for our baby while on the road). Everything was spotless. The breakfast was delicious and quaint with made to order cappuccinos (yum!). The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and welcoming to our son (not all hotels are so nice to those with babies, even a good natured quiet one like ours). They gave us great advice and a great map and even let us check in early since our room was already clean at that time. The hotel is a stone's throw from the train station, which was great for us: our last day there we toured the whole day, leaving our stuff in the hotel and were able to just stop by and pick it up on our way to the train (we only had to carry it for the 5 minute walk tot he train). It is located right on a large canal making it pretty easy to find. Only comment: lack of clock in the room was a little annoying: our room was pretty dark in the morning b/c it faced another building and we couldn't set an alarm. They gave us a wake up call, but a clock would have been better. Next time I'll bring my own. In any case, I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet spot in Venice to actually relax!”
Reviews.Author: mongolianyak
Reviews.Content: Venice is an amazing city, but it is also incredibly crowded as I'm sure you've read. The Hotel Ca'Dogaressa is a short walk off the Guglie Vaparetto stop if you come from the Airport. Walk to the left when you get off the boat about 50 yards. At first look from the outside we were a little shocked but being our first time to Venice I didn't realize how old looking some of the building facades were. Around the corner is the entrance and after stepping inside we had no doubt that we made the right choice. Paulo was a gracious host and was always available for anything we needed. The staff all worked hard to create a very warm atmosphere and at the end of each loooong day of walking we looked forward to returning 'home' to Ca'Dogaressa. What we really appreciated is that it is just far enough from the hustle of the main streets that you feel like you can breath a little. There's some great restaurants nearby and a few less travelled bridges over the canal for photos and soaking in the view. Our room was on the first floor right off the breakfast area but we heard no noise at all. It was very spacious and immaculately clean. We had read about some hotels with small rooms being the norm but that was not our experience in Italy. Breakfast was served each morning with fresh hot cappuccino to get you started. You can sit indoors or out by the canal which we did the day it didn't rain. It was a beautiful way to relax in the morning and take in the sights before heading out on another day of walking, sometimes shuffling, through Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: jrdurbin
Reviews.Content: We spent a week end there Mid November 2009 on the way to the Cruise terminal. Checking in at 2pm was very friendly and easy. The owner Paulo was around to assist with few queries we had about Venice itself. Nice rooms in very good condition. Good A/C warmer system. Calm environment, slightly off the main pedestrial streets of Venice. 5 minutes walking from Train station 1 minute walking from Boat station 20 minutes walking from San Marco, that appeared at first to be a down side, it made up for wonderful walks in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in Venice-don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: callinghomekids
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Ca Dogaressa on foot, having walked from the train station-this was an easy 15 minute walk and the directions given by the hotel were excellent.Our room wasn't ready (we were early in the morning arriving), but they looked after our bags, and made us a wonderful coffee in the meantime.The room was well worth the wait-it was huge, with a vast bed, a big bathroom with bath for our sore feet after much walking, and views out onto the canal from our windows. Breakfast can be had out on the canal in the morning, or in the tiny breakfast room-they make your coffee to order. It was easy to get around on foot, or the water bus stop was a 2 minute walk away(this also goes to the airport). Our canal was quiet, but close to shops, and there were many different restaurants open at night, complete with serenading accordian player.we tried the Kosher place for something different and it was excellent-plus no smokers! The people here really made the place-very obliging and happy to chat-Paulo was great fun-although we had to guess some of his translations, and Daniele should be proud of his excellent establishment. Would love to have the chance to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - as good as I'd hoped”
Reviews.Author: MartinPowellOxford
Reviews.Content: Just off the beaten track. Very friendly and helpful staff, generous breakfasts, excellent location, clean and comfortable. The only downside is noise from canal traffic in the very early morning. But we only noticed this once in 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best and friendliest places”
Reviews.Author: mrl26001
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, from the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty. Agree with other reviewers about great location and cleanliness of rooms. I especially found the laptop with free internet convenient and used it often. We would stay here again in a heartbeat Marie.

Reviews.Title: “lives up t its reputation”
Reviews.Author: dmead46696
Reviews.Content: This hotel has developed quite reputation; it is rated #6 on tripadvisor, all reviews are positive. Ca' dogaressa is all that it is reputed to be. Every room is beautifully decorated in true Venetian style. There is great value for the money. The one thing that should be mentioned and can not be measured in dollars is the feeling created by the staff and the staff consists of one person, Daniele. He will make you feel comfortable from the moment you arrive. The one criticism people seem to have is the lack of an elevator. If you need help with your bags, Daniele will be there for you, rest assured. No one seems to have mentioned the availability of a (free) laptop for use in your room. I would just advise people to remember that while its location is convenient to the train station, it is a hike to St marks and the Rialto bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for a Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Upsilon6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, outside the heavily touristed area of Venice but only a short vaporetto ride to the sights. One of the great pleasures of this hotel is breakfast by the canal, watching the boat traffic and the university students on the other side of the canal. Our room was the usual (small) size but it was air conditioned, which we appreciated in the warm weather, and the furnishings were spotless. The bathroom was huge by European standards and had a tub. The staff could not have been more helpful. The only drawback was the absence of an elevator, so we had to carry our luggage up and down stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best!”
Reviews.Author: WAaussiedreamer
Reviews.Content: Wow! Can't say enough good things about Ca' Dogaressa. Our room (we stayed in number 4), not one of the junior suites, was spacious and clean. The room was a good size (some others are a bit smaller) and the decor was perfect for Venice - cloth walls to match the curtins and murano glass light fittings were beautiful. The bathroom was modern, clean, spacious with a really good size shower (with a screen - not curtin) and the water was always hot which is fantastic after a day of sightseeing. The staff are all wonderful, helpful and friendly. We had some unexpected business to attend to one day and they were more than happy to send and receive our faxes for us. We had beautiful weather whilst there so were able to enjoy canalside breakfast every day. This is wonderful, the canal is large but not crowded and noisy like the Grand Canal can be, it was the perfect way to start each day. We also spent an evening on their rooftop terrace, although the wall is too high to see down to the canal whilst seated you could still look out over the surrounding buildings and listen to the sound of local life below. We bought some cheeses, meats, fruits and other snacks - coupled with a bottle of Chianti wine we bought whilst touring Tuscany, asked for a bottle opener, glasses and plates and had the terrace to ourselves all evening. This was by far the most enjoyable meal we had in all of Italy (and we had some great ones whilst there)!!! With a less than 10 minute walk from the train station you couldn't ask for a better location although I must warn the walk into St Mark's will take a while - you're in and out of so many shops along the way you tend to lose track of time! We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a pleasant, relaxing and friendly place to stay. This was our second time in Venice and will simply have to come back so we can stay here again - wouldn't consider staying anywhere else and would warn anyone wanting to stay to book in advance because this one is a real gem and has lots of repeat customers.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: HGUDenmark
Reviews.Content: Being a family of two adults and two children (7 &10 yrs) the options are limited. But this hotel is great. If we ever go back to Venice, weâ€™ll stay here again, going as family or as a couple. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They were sort of expecting us as we arrived, knew who we were, and we were always greeted and given the key as soon as we returned from an excursion. The room is very different from any thing we have ever stayed at before, but if there is one place in the world where a dÃ©cor like this is just right, it must be Venice. It isnâ€™t English breakfast, but for Italian standard itâ€™s fine. It is served outside along the canal (if the weather permits). Itâ€™s not a buffet, but just nod when the long list of options is listed. We stayed in a family room, had one double and a sofabed for the children. Itâ€™s a very good sofabed, suitable for adults. Being Scandinavian we never get use to sleeping between sheets, not having our duvet, but the bed is good, a little on the hard side, but we experienced they often are in Italy. The room was very, very clean and was cleaned thoroughly during our stay. Bathroom is also good, clean and spacious (as the room) although desperately missing a shower curtain. When you arrive donâ€™t get scared by the old padlock door. The entrance is just round the corner. The location is within walking distance from where the airport bus ends and the train station is even closer. In our opinion a perfect location. Very easy when you arrive and leave Venice. And when you are heading for the main attractions they are very easy to reach either by waterbus or by foot, giving you plenty of atmosphere to soak in. We walked to Rialto Bridge and back with the children on our first afternoon/evening. The main attractions are great, but you must make sure to just wander around the narrow streets and the numerous bridges. The waterbus is a great way to get around, but again, we highly recommend to just wander around, otherwise you havenâ€™t seen Venice.

Reviews.Title: “GO FOR IT............................!!”
Reviews.Author: adventurer04
Reviews.Content: I found this wonderful establishment through trip adviser and it more than exceeded our expectations. We have just returned from a 4 night stay that simply wasn't long enough!! The host and colleagues were incredible - extremely obliging and hospitable, the room was superb with a wonderful bathroom and the location was ideal. We particularly enjoy walking and exploring so there was lots to see and do and we had no problem in accessing the more tourist areas. However, the local water buses are an alternative form of travel if you don't like walking and these run regularly minutes from ca dogaressa. One of the most memorable aspects of our trip was breakfast by the canal - it was like another world!! We do so hope to return as we absolutely loved this place!!

Reviews.Title: “The best from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: jagjetfly
Reviews.Content: Arrived early morning to drop the suitcases off (they allow this) what we didn't expect was to be given a cup of coffee and croissant whilst they checked us in and be offered a freshen up in the shower room alongside reception before we ventured out for the rest of the morning until actual check-in time at 2:00pm. A true travellers welcome. We didn't book it but were given the Junior Suite overlooking the canal, may I say it is absolutely gorgeous and as pictured, what you cannot see on the website is the couch and chairs in the room. I will have daughter upload the trillion pictures she took of the room. The bathroom was spotless, typical Italian hygiene and cleanliness that I am accustomed to. Was also huge, the shower is over the bath with no curtain but I can shower without making a mess, not a problem for me. A bath is a must when travelling and doing heaps of walking. The beds were comfortable and warm. There is a wardrobe, desk, side tables, minibar and TV as well. Plus beautiful Murano glass light fittings and marble floors. We were given the rundown on how to operate the airconditioning system must have been a problem with prior guests as there was a note do not touch see reception on the controls. There were shutters you could close at night to keep out the light. It was so peaceful. Breakfast is outside alongside the canal or in the little breakfast room, we had ours inside as I couldn't be bothered going back upstairs to get a cardigan, it was a bit cool the morning we stayed, but a very nice outlook first thing in the morning The area was great for shopping and eating and there was a vaparetto stop a few meters down. It only took 10 minutes to walk with luggage from the station, over one bridge. We only stayed one night and I wish we had booked longer. One of the best standards of service to customers I have ever come across. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and warm staff”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Columbus1
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Very conveniently located -5 minutes away from the train station, 25 minute walk to St. Marco, 10 minute walk to ferry to Murano. Charming breakfasts over the canal. Very good service.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Khalid_Nadeem
Reviews.Content: The hotel was one of the best in our month vacation. We stayed two nights and very satisfied. The staff was helpful and hotel is just twenty minutes walk from the main train station on a canal. Try to book early otherwise you will end up staying in the last room as we did with no view and just besides the reception. We paid 105 euro per night which is cheap for venice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Linda583
Reviews.Content: My partner and I both highly recommend staying at Hotle Ca' Dogaressa. The rooms were extremely clean and the staff were very friendly. It is situated in a great location-in a quiet area, yet only minutes from the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a Queen”
Reviews.Author: DeeKay18
Reviews.Content: Lovely and Immaculate rooms; perfect location - right alongside the scenic Grand Canal yet a quiet and pleasant strip; and most of all incredible customer service. I only stayed two nights yet I felt I was their #1 guest. The owner constantly pre-empted any need and couldn't do enough to make me comfortable. Brought in fruits for my breakfast, set out chairs for me to sit alongside the canal, carried in/out my suitcase - Got the picture!? An authentic family-run establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay in Wonderful CA Dogaressa”
Reviews.Author: IzziB
Reviews.Content: What can I say.. this was our third trip to Venice and our third stay at CA Dogaressa.. and it wont be the last .. I absolutely adore Venice and this precious gem â€¦ thanks to wonderful hosts Paolo & Graziela and Daniele who can never do enough to make our stay wonderful. Thank you to the whole team so much for making our stay so pleasurable. The Junior suite overlooking Canale di Canaregio is just the greatestâ€¦ and big enough to suit a family with 2 kids.. Breakfast by the Canal every morning is the best thing ever. We were there end of August during a big a heat wave but we did not feel like Venice was overcrowdedâ€¦. we loved getting lost in the little streets of Dorsoduro and walking around all over beautiful Venice but it is so good to come back to CA Dogaressa at night time to enjoy a few glasses of Venitian wine in the Canaregio area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the friendly staff & location and great value too”
Reviews.Author: Sophdobe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very easy to get to from Marco Polo airport, just take the Alilaguna Arancio (orange) line from the water bus station and get off at Guglie, it's 5mins walk from Guglie station (the hotel entrance is in the alley - can be easy to miss sometimes). The hotel rate includes breakfast which finishes at 10am - we didn't wake up until 9.55am on the 1st day and when we got downstairs - the staff said to us "we saved you a table outside", it made us feel extra special that they noticed we haven't had breakfast yet. You can almost reach everywhere by walking and the good thing with Ca' Dogaressa is that it's not right in the centre (like san marco square) where restaurants and stores are a lot more expensive than the Cannaregio area. The hotel has interenet access but it's not wireless - so you need to bring you own LAN line (the hotel does provide free ones but sometimes they run out). I'd definitely go back again and many pple I met there were return customers - it shows they really do provide good service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, friendly and helpful staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Canada2062
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this wonderful hotel and wished we could stay longer. The room was beautiful, typical Venetian style. The owner showed us how to operate everything in the room when we checked in and personally pulled out the sofabed. Easy 7 minute walk from the train station and very easy to find. Owner was waiting for us when we arrived. Our room looked out onto the grande canal with beautiful views. In the morning, tables were set up along the canal for breakfast. My son slept late and the owner prepared a plate of food for me to bring up to him (his suggestion, I did not even ask). Breakfast was substantial as well. We asked for a recommendation for a restaurant. Not only did the owner give us good directions and send us to a wonderful place but he also phoned ahead to let the restaurant know we were coming and to look out for us. Due to the heat, we did drink the water in the mini-bar, but the hotel said they would not charge us. They happily stored our luggage for us the next day and even provided water to us While the hotel is located in the Jewish Ghetto area and is a 20 minute walk to St. Mark's Square, I believe the location is ideal. In Venice, of course, there are no cars. The water taxis are not really too convenient with luggage. From the train station, it was nice in the heat and humidity to only have to walk 5-7 minutes with our luggage as opposed to 25 - 30 minutes to get to a hotel closer to St. Mark's Square. As we later walked to St. Mark's Square empty handed, enjoying all the street performers and sights along the way, we saw many tourists dragging suitcases, overdressed and very hot, trying to find their way to their hotel and eventually pulling over to the side using their cell phone to call for help. Unfortunately we had a very short time to stay at this hotel and in Venice. Will definitely return to Venice and this hotel for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “A fine Gem of a small hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DougR
Reviews.Content: As we sat on the canal outside of this lovely hotel having breakfast, I once again thought that Tripadvisor.Com is deserving of my gratitude. I found Hotel Ca' Dogaressa listed and highly recommended by travelers on this website... The small junior suite accommodations were spacious, comfortable and furnished in the Venetian style. With a view of the canal, and a safe and quiet neighborhood location, this guest and his family had a wonderful stay. The owner, Paolo, and his friendly,gracious, and helpful staff (family) made our stay even better... I would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ledj2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful city, beautiful hotel, wonderful owners and staff. A special thanks to Daniel for everything. It's the little things that make a hotel stand out. Offering bottled water & the use of the hotels extra bathroom, before & after we checked in & out. Our room wasn't ready at 11am so we went for a walk, came back at 1pm. Not only was our room ready but Daniel had put our bags in our room. Our family of 4 had a Junior Suite overlooking the canal. For the price this room was fantastic. The room was larger than what I thought it would be after looking at pictures & reports, so we left the sofa bed out for our 4 night stay. Breakfast on the canal was great each morning while watching the local folk carrying out their daily routine on & off the canal. At night we opened the shutters & windows & enjoyed looking & listening to the night time activities outside our hotel. When the windows & shutters were shut it was so quiet. We ate dinner at Trattoria da Mimmo, basic food but really good, also cheaper than nearby restaurants. We had Steak, Baked Lasagna, a creamy pasta dish plus a side of chips & salad. One night my son wanted fried rice with chicken, when my son wants to eat we go as he doesn't eat a lot, so we tried Ristorante Cinese China Town across the canal. The food was fantastic. The water stop for the Aliguna to & from the Airport is approx 150 meters from the hotel, how convenient. I would recommend this hotel to anyone but book early, you don't want to miss out!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice family hotel in real Venice. Friendly welcome.”
Reviews.Author: BigHoward
Reviews.Content: We had 8 days here in Venice. The hotel have very friendy staff that really make you feel at home. The rooms are fantastically decorated with nice modern bathrooms and air conditioning. It is in the "real Venice" where ordinary Venetians live. Breakfast by the canal every morning. Just a few minutes from the nearest water bus stop. There is a park locally which has lots of nice Italian families with their children. We were able to take our two year old daughter to it every day. The Lido is less than 40 minutes away by boat. Murano is even nearer. The Tourist areas are not far away, but it is nice not to have to step out on to them. The owner is a very nice gentleman who genuinely wants all his guests to be happy. For a 3 star rated hotel this is an absolute gem! This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done Dogaressa”
Reviews.Author: balmac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights after a Mediterranean cruise and thoroughly recommend it. It was our 2nd stay in Venice and we had previously enjoyed the Gardena but they never got back to me this time :( . The Dogaressa proved to be an excellent choice and it is a beautifully decorated, family run hotel with very helpful staff. Well priced too, as we booked off the internet site. We had room no. 4 (on first floor so good with bags) .. it was HUGE, with an equally substanial bathroom. Do not miss a meal at the Alla Fontana just along the canal. Their gnocchi and gorgonzola is to die for ... Would not hesitate to stay here again ...

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo”
Reviews.Author: carolg2510
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel was one of the delights of our month long european trip. The decor was georgeous and the location was ideal- everything in walking distance, right near ferry stop but not too busy. The real gem though was the staff, they could not do enough for you and made our stay a very memorable one. I would definitely recommend this to anyone heading to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in an Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: nunda
Reviews.Content: We used ratings on this site when choosing a place to stay in Venice, and we weren't disappointed. Ca' Dogaressa is lovely - relatively inexpensive, spotless, well-situated and staffed by friendly, helpful folks who went out of their way to help us with details such as train schedules and storing luggage after checkout. The breakfast itself was so-so, but eating breakfast alongside the canal while watching the myriad delivery and passenger boats was a real treat. The hotel was an easy walk from the train station and we loved the Jewish Ghetto area with its quite square and good food. Surprisingly, our favorite place to eat (3 days in a row!) was the Gam-Gam felafel stand a few hundred yards from the hotel - 5 euros for a huge felafel cooked fresh and garnished with lots of tasty vegetables, and served with real lemonade - very refreshing on a hot day.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming Hotel but off center.”
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in this small and charming Hotel with extremely nice rooms and very good price for Venice. The staff is very gentle. My reasonable large twin bed room had everything one could wish for, very well appointed with beautiful traditional materials. No lift, as one could expect in Venice. Extremely calm location, no noise during all night. Air conditioning is very efficient and silent but a little strange to operate. Bathroom is large and well furnished. Breakfast is reasonable good and can be taken in the room or better still outside in front the Hotel. The location, although good for those coming from the train station is off centre and this must be taken into account for those people not well fitted physically. So hosts must be prepared to walk through all day possibly with no rest to refresh at midday. Overall a very nice Hotel indeed!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotel Stays on European Trip”
Reviews.Author: WinterTikaani
Reviews.Content: My husband, son (11yrs) and I found Hotel Ca'Dogaressa charming, extremely clean, and the staff was warm, friendly and very helpful. This was one of the best hotels during our month long trip to Europe. During this trip we toured throughout Germany, Austria, Italy, France and Croatia. Breakfast was a wonderful experience each morning along the canal. They serve the very best cappuccino I have had anywhere in the world. Their croissants were served warm and filled with a wonderful apricot filling, wonderful! They are conveniently located a short walk from the train station and easy to locate. We arrived very early and the owner and staff were very accommodating in storing our luggage and treating us to cappuccinos and a map to find our way. We also run a bed and breakfast in Alaska and appreciate TLC from our patrons while traveling. I have to say this was one of the best experiences we have had touring Europe.
