The decor is fabulously Venice and the bathrooms luxurious! We enjoyed sipping Proseco on the roof terrace while enjoying the fantastic views and sharing stories with fellow guests. Ca Dogaressa is simply a wonderful hotel with a great location to call home while exploring Venice. We cannot recommend them highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Venetian splendour at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Bel-Bee
Reviews.Content: Venice was the first stop in our travels, and what a welcome relief to arrive at such a beautiful hotel after a lengthy delay at London Gatwick, where we had to sit in the aircraft for the entire time! My sister and I spent two nights in this small, cosy and impeccably clean hotel, and we couldn't have asked for a better hotel in such a convenient part of the city. - There's an array of restaurants nearby (2 mins walk). - It's a 10 to 15 minute walk to the central bus station (with buses to and from the airport) or you can catch a water bus to the same point, which would take about 7 minutes. The nearest water bus stop is a 3 minute walk from the hotel. Water bus fares are a little pricey though (around â‚¬6 from memory), and the walk is not strenuous so I'd recommend that option. - Piazza San Marco is a little further away (just follow all the signs), but the walk is an enjoyable and lively one. Breakfast on the piazza in front of the hotel was a wonderful way to start the day. Enjoy coffee and croissants whilst you watch the Venetians pass by on various water craft, shifting grocery stocks and all other form of goods. We had to check out at 6.30am to catch the bus to our next destination, and although breakfast starts at 8am, we were offered coffee and biscuits before we left - so thoughtful. But I guess that personalised touch is just one of the benefits that comes with staying in a family run hotel. We were asked to change rooms on our second night, but we were advised of this by email when we booked. For the same price, we received an even better room (much bigger and with a view over the canal). No complaints here. Hotel Ca' Dogaressa is a little oasis amidst the heat and crowds of Venice - how we longed for accommodation of the same quality throughout the rest of Europe (and for the same price) - we didn't find it! My sister and I have often been referred to as "princesses", so we're pretty picky when it comes to hotel accommodation - we both loved it and would definitely stay here again, as well as recommend it to anyone travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveler777
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the hotel during the second week of June 2009. The hotel definitely lives up to all the great reviews. I can't say enough good things about the family running the hotel, they all worked very hard to make sure we had an enjoyable stay in Venice. What we really liked was the quiet location of the hotel after a day of sightseeing, but it is still close to the water ferries and train station. Also, there are a couple of good restaurants just down the canal from the hotel -- Gam Gam and Fontana.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay by the Canal”
Reviews.Author: babydeen1
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my parents to Italy, and I wanted a place that is quiet, clean, and comfortable. Our stay at Ca' Dogaressa was so much more than that! The furniture and decor were beautiful, and the room was kept very clean. Good amenities including the good working A/C, and updated bathroom. We enjoyed staying in the room facing the canal, and having the breakfast next to it was just wonderful. I was initially concerned that the location may be far away from the central area, but we really enjoyed our nice walk through the maze-like little Venetian streets. The hotel staff was hospitable, and I would definitely recommend it to my friends and anyone travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the ground floor bedroom!”
Reviews.Author: BornToSleep
Reviews.Content: We made a very last minute booking last October for this hotel. We were given the only available room which is on the ground floor sandwiched behind reception and next to the breakfast room. When the guy behind the counter started walking towards the door I assumed he was going into a cupboard to get our key or something, but it turned out to be our room! It was essentially a windowless cave, but one that was decorated to a very high standard. Our first night was dreadful as we could hear every sound from reception including every time the phone rang, the TV, even a cup being placed on a saucer! It wasn't that they were unusually loud noises, just that the proximity made it sound like we were sleeping under the reception desk. Because it was already chilly in October guests were eating in the breakfast room and not next to the canal, so from 7am onwards we had to listen to all sorts of eating noises. The wall was about a foot from our bed and we could literally hear people chewing, and that's not an exaggeration! However we bought some earplugs for the next night and began referring to the room from then on (almost affectionately) as 'the bat cave'. The hotel is in a great location and was clean and friendly. I would stay here again but I would definitely avoid the bat cave!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jieheerah
Reviews.Content: Ca Dogaressa not only had a unique and very Italian decor but very friendly staff as well. We booked a water taxi ride from the hotel to the airport at 1 pm on the day we are leaving Venice. Unfortunately, there was a rowing competition in the city and no water bus or taxi was allowed in the area. However, the friendly staff of the hotel not only helped me set up an alternate route but helped me with the luggage to the area where we could catch a water taxi. Although our luggages had wheels, the walk was quite long, with many number of steps in the bridge. I don't know how we would've carried them if they didn't help us. When I offered tip for their service, they refused, saying that "you can tip me next time you come to Venice." That is what I call "great service"!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clayharris
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was clean, spacious, well decorated comfortable. One night we brought in dinner and ate it on the third-floor terrace, which was beautiful. All of the staff went out of their way to make us comfortable. Though not "close" to alot of the tourist areas, still no more than an enjoyable 20-30 minute walk just about anywhere. Being away from throngs of other tourists was actually pretty relaxing at night, when we opened up the windows to enjoy the air and relative quiet. ** Great breakfast served every morning, at a table on the canal, or in your room!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel don't look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: indecisiveMarlow_
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights from may 10th.Searched on trip advisor and was very pleased with this hotel.The owners were helpful,friendly and made you feel very welcome.As it was my partners birthday they gave us a bottle of prosecco which we drank on their lovely roof terrace.Stayed in room 4 which was more than adequate,had lovely full length shower(requested as some are only over bath.) Breakfast by the canal was the best way to start the day.Plenty of food and coffee was offered and available.A quieter part of Venice,but i think better because the food,good and maybe not as dear as in other parts.Good restaurants on this canal and outside seating which is a bonus. Venice is very expensive so be aware of prices.Beer and coffee can be expensive. Hotel is very easy to find especially if arriving by water vaparetto(13 euros). Murano worth a visit,a gondola ride a must but expensive but best tried at night time as canals quieter. Paolo and his wife and Daniele were great at this hotel, i am glad i read the reviews which all seemed to be very accurate..

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RodgerCashel_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ca Dogeressa Venice on 13th May. Don't be put off by the exterior. The hotel d'osnt own the ground floor facade. We passed off the hotel walking and had to retrace our steps. We got a last minute deal at 90 euro's . It was worth every penny. Great location and had breakfast by the canal. Free WiFi as well. Enjoy. We stayed also at another hotel but that was expensive at half the price

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon at Ca' Dogaressa”
Reviews.Author: plee425
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week honeymoon in Italy and I felt compelled to write a good review for Ca' Dogaressa. The owner, Paolo, and his wife, actually live in the building next to Ca' Dogaressa, which is a well-maintained boutique hotel. It sits right on the canal, and on sunny days, breakfast is served right on the canal, which is a delight. We were greeted by Daniele, who is the best English speaker on staff. He is extremely helpful and very congenial. Paolo take over reception desk duties in the evening and he is equally up to the task. He recommended many good restaurants for us, including Fontana (just a few blocks down) and Vini da Gigio, which is a freshness-obsessed, high-end restaurant about 10 minute walk away. As most people should know, Venice is a pedestrian city and the Vaporetto (public water taxi) is one of the most reliable and efficient systems in the world (I am a New Yorker and I take public transit every day, so you can trust my assessment). Ca' Dogaressa is within a 1-minute walk of the Guglie vaporetto stop (41,42, 51, 52, and A lines), which can take you to San Marco. However, more often than not, we walked 6-7 minutes to either the San Marcuola (Casino) stop or the Ferrovia (main train station) stop to catch the faster number 2 vaporetto. It was also great to be able to walk 6-7 minutes from the train station to the hotel and vice versa, which was so easy with our rolling luggage. Overall, their location is residential and quieter than the touristy parts of Venice, and 100x more convenient to access from the train station. It is perfect. We would come back in a heartbeat. Bravissimo.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mikeyp69
Reviews.Content: booked ca'dogaressa after looking at trip advisor reviews, wasn't my first choice mainly because the photos people had posted didn't seem too good. we were really pleased with the hotel and the staff, who went out of their way to help. we stayed in the junior suite which was large and comfortable with views of the canal. breakfast was good by the canal when the weather was good, inside if not. the hotel position was away from the crowds but close enough to see everything by boat or on foot. very easy transfer from the airport by boat, as the airport boat goes right past the hotel. hard to say whether it's value for money or not as everything in venice is ridiculously expensive! but compared with others i looked at it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel for the most romantic city in the world”
Reviews.Author: Israeli_traveler1984
Reviews.Content: The "Ca' Dogaressa" hotel is a small, cute, hotel. it's right in front of the canel in a perfect "quiet but close to all the main attraction" location. the breakfast was the best we got in Italy (very plain, but it was more then a small pastry and a sort of coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: travelbunny
Reviews.Content: Like so many others, I spent hours reading reviews, trying to decide where in Venice to stay. We had the Gold suite which I think is exactly the same as the much reviewed Green Suite but a floor above. There is simply nothing you can fault at the Hotel Ca' Dogaressa. We were so excited when we saw our lovely room and then opened the windows to that wonderful view. Our room was spacious and the staff quickly came and made up the foldout for our sons. The staff are friendly and helpful -they couldn't do enough for us. The highlight was having our leisurely breakfast on the canal each morning. It was such a wonderful relaxing way to start your day on vacation sitting out there watching the locals, sipping your coffee. For that reason alone, I would choose to stay there again, it was that good. We were there on Palm Sunday and watched the local church congregation parade down the other side of the canal. When my boys went to watch, the priest gave them his palms! The neighborhood has its own vibe and altho it was a little bit of a hike to the main tourist areas (especially on your way home at nite after a full day sightseeing with the kids), it was nice to be with locals as opposed to tourists. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime!”
Reviews.Author: divinefeeling
Reviews.Content: Great location and quiet. We had a room on the ground floor without views but this was OK as we were busy seeing the sights most of the time! Room was beautifully decorated, sumptuous actually. Only beef I had was with the shower/bath, plenty of water on the floor. Service was good, we only ate breakfast there which was served on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “I will dream of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shady-Grove
Reviews.Content: A gorgeous room with fabulous furnishings. I felt like I was waking up in a fairy tale every morning. Our family of 4 had the 1st floor green Junior Suite which has a king size bed and a sofa/sleeper. The room is huge and beautiful with a canal view, and Murano glass light fixtures. Staff was friendly and helpful, and included breakfast was good. We really loved the location, a bit away from some of the tourist craziness, close to the train station, and convenient to the water bus. We were there for 2 days during the week in February when Venice was calm & quiet. The next 2 days were Valentine's weekend and the opening weekend of Carnavale--they told us it was even more crowded than in summer!. That is when it was nice to escape down our own less crowded canal where you could get a serious wine, bread, and cheese snack for about $4! My sons add that the gelato was cheaper and better in our neighborhood too!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: kboese
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC Room! Love everything about it- Paolo, the owner, set up a nice breakfast in front of the hotel, by the canal. What an experience. Venice is very beautiful, and to stay in this beautiful room, was just fantastic!!! Thank you Paolo.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with hotel room,location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: venezia08
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here overnight( to our regret) but were so impressed with the " GREEN ROOM" , as we called it, that we did not want to leave!!! The canal view outside was FANTASTIC! The sight of this plus the hustle and bustle of the people in the morning just takes you back in time! The location was perfect if you want a quiet and restful night. MR. Paolo and staff were friendly and accomodating.WILL DEFINITELY COME BACK HERE IF WE VISIT VENICE AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Inexpensive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shimmykim
Reviews.Content: The hotel was charming and the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was very good value compared to hotels in pricey Venice. The hotel is not in the nicest part and it is not in the central location of Venice, but is very convinent to get in and out of venice. It is within walking distance from the train station and there is 40 min water shuttle stop to the airport right nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: harvey16
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. I would hightly recommend it. The rooms were very nice and clean. Were decorated in true Venetian style. Very close to the train station. About a 5-10 minute walk. The price was also very reasonable at 85 euro a night for a nice room. The staff was very helpful in giving us directions and suggesting places to go and places to eat. They also have a nice breakfast there included in the price which includes croisants, breads and cereal. They even prepared a breakfast for us at 6 am the day of our departure because we were leaving early that morning. The bathrooms looked brand new. The only drawback would be that it is a little far from some of the main attractions like St. Mark's (about 30 minute walk). Venice is a very walkable city so it wasn't a problem for us but may be for older people.

Reviews.Title: “The only Place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: birtleman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property before and would not stay anywhere else in Venice. I would echo the comments of the last couple of reports. Paulo and Daniel are outstanding as is Paulo 's wine both sparkling and his sweet after dinner wine. This is a great hotel and is great value for Venice

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: thetrees
Reviews.Content: Ca' Dogaressa is a wonderful hotel! We stayed in the junior suite which overlooks the canal. The room was large, lovely and spotlessly clean. The staff, especially Paolo and Daniele, were friendly, thoughtful and so helpful. We enjoyed the breakfast outside facing the canal. We especially liked the location. Ca' Dogaressa is on a small canal and away the the crowds, which was a welcome respite at the end of a long day. Yet, the hotel is only a 15-20 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. You can pick up the water taxi about a block away. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and wouldn't stay anywhere else. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: sav21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. It's in a great location for touring venice. Very clean, good service and lovely cosy rooms. The breakfast was also excellent, though I didn't have time to sample lunch/evening meals there. I hope to stay here again when I next go to venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: calitracy
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our stay at Hotel Ca' Dogaressa but our favorite part was the wonderful continental breakfast served to us alongside the canal by the terrific and helpful owners/staff. Our room was very clean and quiet as well. Close to everything and a short walk to the train station. We've already recommended Hotel Ca' Dogaressa to our family for their trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: BelfastWanderer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money in a good location in Venice.The area is near to the main tourist streets but also peaceful and relaxed.The rooms and a good size with everything you could need and very clean.Great continental breakfast with all the tea /coffee you want served by the very pleasant owner right on the canal watching venetian life go by.An added bonus is the roof terrace where you can sit and chill or have a cigarette break! Happened to mention 40th birthday and were offered a complimentary bottle of wine on the terrace,a lovely touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alpha1234
Reviews.Content: 1) Great location: less than 10min walk from Santa Lucia Station but still seems away from the tourist trail 2) Very friendly and helpful staff 3) Very cosy rooms with air-conditioning (you'll need it in July/August) 4) With only six rooms, you get a sense of exclusivity 5) Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: albertros
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Ca Dogaressa going by the really good reviews it had right here on TripAdvisor and I can say that the Hotel was excellent, Great People running it, very nice rooms cleaned every day, breakfast outside on the edge of the canal and it was only a 10 minute walk from the Railway Station so you don't even need to fork out for a Taxi Boat! It's in a really ideal place where it's really quiet yet it only take a short walk to get to the main parts of Venice or to the Public Transport /Taxi Boats. It's really good for a three star hotel and would definately stay there again if I can every afford to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: p_malpass
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from Venice and I can say with sincerity that this is a fantastic hotel to stay in. It's clean and comfortable, and I think the air conditioning saved my life. The hotel is easily accessed from the Guglie stop, you don't have to drag your suitcases over any bridges just take a small stroll up the canal side. The staff in the hotel are really friendly, helpful, kind and considerate and nothing seems too much trouble for them. Next time I go to Venice I AM stopping there again. Some reviews say there is not enough food provided at breakfast, but I don't know if they've increased the amount but we found we had far more than we can eat.

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fzuck
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights in Venice at Ca' Dogaressa. A real gem in the Ghetto area. The Hotel staff was very accomodating to our travel needs and responsive to our questions. The breakfasts are nice right along the canal. Room was very clean and efficient in layout and resources. Would definitely recommend to anybody looking for the B&B feel in a unique location outside of the tourist center. We will return next year when we visit Venice in the Summer!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!! So close but quiet and romantic! Venice at its best!”
Reviews.Author: italy614
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and it was so romantic and perfect! Paolo is so nice and offered us Prosecco when he found out we were on our honeymoon. The hotel is gorgeous and the rooms are beautiful with huge bathrooms. Everything is clean and there is a gorgeous rooftop terrace that overlooks the canal. In addition it is easy to find (very close the to the train station and Piazzele Roma) and is close to 2 vaporetto stops. It is so close the 'main strips' of Venice but is far enough away that it is quiet and peaceful. The breakfast is wonderful served on the canal...cereal, juice, coffee, rolls and jams..very good and filling. I cannot say enough about Paolo and everyone there (I think it is his family). They are all friendly and seem to really love their jobs and take pride in the hotel. When we were going out one night and it was raining he lent us an umbrella and then called ahead to a great restaurant to let them know we were coming. When we left they stored our luggage for us until our cruise left and they even have a bathroom with shower that you can use to freshen up in again if you need to. We are hoping to go back to Venice in a few years and will for sure be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJH
Reviews.Content: An imptomptu visit to Venice brought me to Tripadvisor. I wanted 4 nights in Venice but could only get 1 night here. I decided the hotel could make or break the trip and so I booked the one night available and made other (luckily good) arrangements for the 3 remaining nights, We had the 1st floor room overlooking the canal and it was superb. Tastefully furnished (repro) and spotlessly clean. Great, friendly service. Good breakfast. The trattoria on the other side of the canal is good as well. Please bring a few words of Italian with you!

Reviews.Title: “magical stay at Ca Dogaressa”
Reviews.Author: melaniejoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 magical days at Ca Dogaressa.The Junior Suite was exactly as portrayed on the website ,extremely clean comfortable and beautifully appointed. Breakfast on the canalside was a highlight. Owner Paolo and manager Daniele could not have been better hosts...a big thank you to them for helping to make our visit to Venice so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient location in 'real' Venice”
Reviews.Author: MirandaSmoothy
Reviews.Content: Venice is expensive, teeming with tourists and touts of one kind or another. So the real benefits of this hotel are:- a peaceful, colourful, location on the Canal di Cannaregio (one of the old ways into the city) where you see real Venetian life around you - mothers taking children to school by boat, delivery barges plying the water, old ladies with cats leaning out of balconied windows. The local restaurants have local customers, and the small grocery shops are also for residents so don't have 'tourist tat'. an easy travel distance from the station and airport - not to be underestimated in a city of small canals/streets and many bridges, where a water-taxi is ludicrously expensive. It is a short walk from the Guglie water-bus stop, where one of the special airport water-boat also stops (12 Euros per person each way, but the easy and comfort are worth it). a friendly, family run hotel where you feel at home with the thoughtful/friendly little touches. It has beautiful traditional Venetian decoration, clean marble bathrooms, and modern conveniences - safe, air conditioning, TV (not flat screen), fridge. When warm, breakfast is taken on the canal side - a nice feature. the sites of Venice can all be walked too quite easily if you are able-bodied; but the best thing to do is to buy a water-bus travel pass and jump on and off at will - useful if you need to cross to other islands or want to explore the outer islands of Venice. Two other stops besides Guglie are very close by, and another two only a short walk away. The hotel is practically next to the historic and evocative Jewish Ghetto - one of the few havens for Jews in Europe since the 14th century - at a price. The things you may not like:- Only a low level shower attachment on the wall over the bath - so take some aromatic bath oils and have a wonderful long soak after a hot day site seeing instead. TV is small and some people may not like the fact it is not flat screen. But you can spend the whole evening sitting in one of the small restaurants only a stones throw away - watching the Venetians and tourists parade out in the evening cool as the sun goes down. (Obviously different when the weather is chilly.) Breakfast is 'continental' and may not be enough if you are used to big breakfasts. But if you do want another croissant or more coffee (very good) just ask. That is the advantage of the hotel being family fun. We were extremely happy with this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn_and_Troy
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel - the room we had was beautiful and decorated in the traditional Venetian style, but with the mod cons you need on holiday (aircon, fridge, safe, TV etc). Staff all spoke English and were present 24 hours a day, offering advice on where to eat etc. We had to leave at 7am for our train but as it was before breakfast, they even made us a small bag of drink and food to take with us. Great location for the train and bus station, as well as 100m from the nearest boat stop. Only gripe we had was the shower (hand held in a bath with no curtain), but this was a very minor thing. Great value for money - will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Everthing great”
Reviews.Author: awp064
Reviews.Content: Everything great about this hotel - only wish that they served snacks and drinks on the canal terrace at other times of the day as well as breakfast as the setting was so nice. My only (very tiny) moan would be the lack of shower curtain (stayed in room 1 - the junior suite, had a shower over the bath) but having created my own mini canal on the bathroom floor on day 1, found the best way to shower was by sitting down in the bath and when using soap,shampoo etc, try holding the shower head between your feet so that you don't have to keep switching the water off. Not ideal I know but everthing else is so good at the hotel, it wasn't too much of a hardship and the water was constantly, consistently hot which as we all know is a bit of a rarity when on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: verbet
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 nights in early May which is situated on a smaller canal . The hotel is only small but the rooms are larger than the average european hotel room, the decor was very venitian & pleasing to the eye ,the room & bathroom were exceptionally clean with small toiletries provided.The hotel is situated in a quieter area of Venice but was still bustling with the local life. the restruants & shops were plentiful in the near by streets & the water bus stops were in easy reach. We chose this hotel because it is near the main train station 15mins walk with luggage as we had to leave for Paris early in the morning because of this Paulo organised a packed breakfast to take with us which was very thoughtful & appreciated by us, Paulo & Daniel are the ultimate hosts only too happy to help in any way whether it be extra coffee at breakfast or assiting in tourist directions.My memories will be very lasting of this hotel --a wonderful ,wonderful stay thank you to all at Ca'Dogaressa

Reviews.Title: “understanted Elegance! PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: virtuallywithyou
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing stay at what I consider to be an outstanding hotel. The room was clean, fresh and all the stops were pulled out to make our stay a memorable one. AMAZING! Darren + Ivka

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in nice location with thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: UserX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Italy. We stayed in this hotel for two nights. We booked this hotel for the good reviews in TripAvisor and in general it was what we expected. The hotel is located in a nice and quiet district away from the expensive and crowded areas, just a few minutes walk from the train station . The room was beautifully decorated clean and spacious, breakfast in bed was good. The staff was friendly and helpful. This hotel has, in my opinion, a major thin wall problem, we could actually hear the conversations in the next room. Surprisingly no one mentioned it before. May be we just got the one bad room.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderhythm
Reviews.Content: Ca' Dogaressa was probably the nicest place we stayed in Italy on our honeymoon. We stayed in the junior suite, which is beautifully decorated and has a nice canal view. The service was impeccable! We arrived from the airport early in the morning on a rainy day. When we came in, the manager offered us free breakfast and coffee, even though we were only supposed to get one the next morning. They offered to watch our bags until check-in while we explored Venice. When we told the manager it was our honeymoon he gave us a free bottle of Prosecco, and it was so good, we took a second bottle from the minibar. The next day at checkout, they even comped the second bottle and a bottle of water we took as well! Great location, beautiful room, exceptionally clean bathroom. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: traveler1680
Reviews.Content: I went stayed here in 2006 and loved it so much my Mom stayed here a few months ago. The building is absolutely gorgeous! Bedrooms are large with air conditioning units (very important during the hot summer months!) bathrooms are large and beautiful. Traiditional Venetian decor! Breakfast on the canal is the highlight of this hotel. Visit the roof top terrace at sunset for amazing views. It's an easy 10-15 min walk to train station, we did it with heavy rucksacks on our backs. Once you are over the bridge and walking down the canal towards the hotel, don't miss the little food shop--it sells soda, water and snacks for much cheaper than anywhere else we saw. This hotel is away from the major hustle and bustle in a residential area, gives you a feeling of what life is really like in Venice. The staff is simply outstanding. The day we arrived they gave us water bottles and maps and sent us off for sightseeting. The day of our departure, we had a 6am train and they packed us breakfast to go. Oh how I wish I was there right now!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pianomarm
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay six months in advance directly with the hotel. With the declining dollar, it would have been better if we could have pre-paid! We arrived by rail and walked to the hotel with luggage in tow. It was only about a 10 minute walk from the train station. The hotel is located in a quiet residential section equi-distant from two vaporetti stops. On our trip home, we began to hear the horror stories of using the earplugs given on the flight to Europe to sleep in the noisy, tourist sections of the city! Thankfully, our stay at Ca' Dogeressa was very quiet. Our deluxe double was still a bit small, but luxuriously and tastefully decorated, including Murano glass chandeliers, sconces, and lamps. We were always greeted warmly each time we left and returned to the hotel. We received a lot of information from the desk about navigating the city. The breakfast was good, but a bit more sparse than our hotel breakfasts during this trip in Prague, Salzburg, and Villach. All in all, this hotel is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “I want to keep this wonderful place a secret”
Reviews.Author: allegro_barbaro
Reviews.Content: As my caption states, I want to keep this hotel a secret so that I will be able to get a room in future, but that would be unfair to the lovely people at Ca' Dogaressa. My family and I spent a thoroughy relaxing week in this gem of a hotel located in the peaceful Cannareggio district. Paolo and Daniele are about the friendliest hotelliers I have ever come across and thier warmth and hospitality made it a holiday to remember. Breakfast was delicious, the rooms were bright & beautifully decorated and the location was thankfully quiet and away from the expensive and noisy tourist areas. I will most definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very cute and a great staff”
Reviews.Author: jennifer1347
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room at the Ca' Dogaressa for two nights. It's an extremely charming hotel. Paolo, the owner (I think), is very nice and helpful, as is all the staff. The room wasn't very big as I expected but it was nicely decorated and very clean. The bathroom was a decent size and also very clean. My only complaint is that there was no shower curtain or even a hook to place the shower head on. So you had to hold the shower head thw whole time, which is difficult to do when you are trying to wash your hair. I know that it's common in Italy not to have a shower curtain, but I still didn't like it. It was very cold and I made a huge mess. The breakfast was good and satisfying. As I already mentioned, the staff was very friendly and helpful. When I forgot to pack a converter that would fit our laptop, Paolo immediately let me borrow one without me even asking. The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood, but it's extremely easy and fast to get down to San Marco, etc. Venice isn't very large so it wasn't a problem at all. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: brglasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my mother just before Easter, and this was the perfect base for our visit - beautifully decorated, immaculately clean, and in an ideal location in a fascinating part of Venice, an easy 15 minute walk from the main bus station but away from the crowds. The staff are charming and go out of their way to be helpful - obviously they take pride in what they do. And we paid just 355 Euros for two people for three nights - an excellent deal given how expensive I had been led to believe Venice would be. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Venetian hotel by the canal”
Reviews.Author: TXwonderer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an easy 15-minute walk with small luggage from the train station Santa Lucia. We followed the hotel directions without any problem. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood but you can walk to St. Mark Sqaure and the Grand Canal leisurely. We got a first floor room so it was easy to carry our small luggage upstair. The room is decorated in Venetian style and the bath room is very clean. The internet connection is very good. The room is non-smoking. The front desk is staffed all the time and they are very helpful in recommending restaurants. We left early in the morning to catch our train and they graciouly packed a sack of breakfast for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: coffeegirl247
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely charming! It's located in a quiet part of Venice in the Cannaregio District where you see many locals shopping for their dinner, strolling with their dogs, and eating at local restaurants. It is a 30 to 45 minute walk to Piazza San Marco, but well worth it to be away from the intense crowds in that area. There are wonderful shops and bacari (cafes and bars) along the way that make the walk to the main sights of Venice enjoyable. You can also take the vaporetto (water bus) to San Marco if you're tired of walking. The train station is a short walk from the hotel as well. The hotel is unassuming from the outside, look up to see the sign on the side of the building or you'll miss it. Once inside you'll be impressed by the beautiful furnishings and ornate Murano glass light fixtures. The reception desk is manned 24 hours a day. We were welcomed by a very friendly host who spoke good english and gave wonderful directions and a map. The room rates are very reasonable for this city, especially considering how comfortable and beautiful the rooms are. The room was delightful with beautiful furniture that included a desk, wardrobe, side tables and chairs. The chandelier and bedside light fixtures are made of beautiful Murano glass which add to the charm of the room. The bathroom was very modern and impeccably clean. Breakfast is included in the room rate and is served in the breakfast room or out by the canal on warm days. It includes delicous pastry, cereal, juice, milk, biscuits, jam and coffee (cappucino, latte, espresso.) I especially enjoyed the glazed croissant, apricot juice, and cappucinos. Delicous! This hotel is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: RachelHove
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, especially considering the price compared with other similar accommodation. It is located on a tranquil canal in a lovely area only 15-20 mins walk from the hustle and bustle of rialto / san marco. Very near vaporetto stops to get around town and also to the airport. Rooms are done out beautifully in venetian style with comfortable beds, spotless bathrooms and the hotel is very quiet at night. The hotel website is a good representation of the accommodation. Reception is manned 24 hours, all the staff were very friendly and helpful. Would not hesitate to recommend or return!

Reviews.Title: “Just the right distance from the madding crowds”
Reviews.Author: Hedleyman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 2 nights of a 4-night stay in Venice (our first time) and loved it. It is located at the western edge of the Cannaregio district (sestiere) and it is amazing the difference 200 yards makes - all is tranquility in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, but a 2-minute stroll away and you can be swept up on the tourist tide flowing inexorably towards San Marco. The hotel is located very close to two vaporetto stops - Guglie and Tre Archi - but Venice is all about the walking! The Ca'Dogaressa only has 6 or 7 rooms and ours (a superior double) was beautifully furnished, looking every bit as good as the website pictures suggested. The ensuite bathroom was equally well appointed. The room featured a TV and air-conditioning and, although there were no tea/coffee making facilities, these were provided free-of-charge to the room by the ever-obliging Paolo or Marita. We also had our breakfast brought to the room one morning - again, no extra charge. All in all I would heartily recommend the Ca'Dogaressa, both for its location and charm, not to mention the value for money it represents. The Cannaregio sestiere provides an abundance of characterful bars and bistros within a 10-minute walk of the hotel, with great value to be found much easier than you would've dared hope for in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: FrancoisH
Reviews.Content: Very quiet room at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: router
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. I travel to Venice quite a bit and have stayed in all sorts of hotels from the very best to the more ropey. This hotel is an absolute gem. Handy for everywhere - no need to worry about how close to St Marks you are, you are close enough and waterbuses are your friend - plus walking is the best way to see Venice and from this hotel to St Marks has some of the best streets for taking it all in. Its close to the station - worry not about your bags, its not that far maybe 5-10 mins walk - one bridge with teeny steps and then a left and you are there. We stayed in a Suite overlooking the canal, it was spacious, super clean - the bathroom was perfect. The staff are wonderful -could not have made us feel more welcome or at home. Breakfast by the canal watching everyone start their day was brilliant - I could have sat on all day. Perfect - I would try here before anywhere when going again. I've found my perfect hotel for Venice now.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: irelandkim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Ca Dogressa in Sept 08.The staff are helpful friendly and kind.The rooms are very impressive decor fab very Italian.Did nt have any noise problems at all stayed in a side room without canal view and did nt hear a sound and i am a light sleeper and hotel was full.Overall a great experience and will definitly stay there again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DrGY
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The owner Paolo is very helpful and he recommended some good and reasonably priced restaurants nearby. Rooms are amazing - 18 century venetian decor with modern bathroom. Well maintained and clean. Easy walk to the train and bus stations. Close to ferry stops. Friendly family feel atmosphere. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. Reasonably priced for Venice. We went to Prague and Vienna as well during our trip and stayed at similarly priced establishments and Ca Dogaressa was the best by far!

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome, very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Vananelim
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in the Hotel Ca' Dogaressa and loved it. The hotel looks rather ordinary from the outside but the welcome we received at 10pm was brilliant. The receptionist spoke great English, and gave us a very quick but detailed overview of Venice, offered breakfast in bed and couldn't be more helpful. 24 hour service too. Venice was freezing but the hotel and room was perfect temperature during dayt and at night. The bathroom was amazing and marble floors throughout the room. The room, which was spotlessly clean throughout our stay, looked over the canal and had shutters which added to the romance of the stay. The hotel is located a little way out of the main areas to eat and drink although the waterbus stop is 2 minutes walk and the main bus and train stations only 10 - 15 mins, so I don't think it's worth staying any closer. The room was lovely and queit at night, and the noise of the hustle and bustle of the buses and other boats on the canal in the morning was amazing to hear. I would definately recommend the hotel purely on the basis of its complete charm and the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawnage
Reviews.Content: Our bedroom and bathroom was decorated beautifully and with care. It was peaceful and comfortable, if a little small. The hotel is friendly and charming, with helpful and welcoming owners. There is the option to eat a simple, but decent, breakfast by the canal, which is very pleasant. We had a lovely stay and would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cla1127
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Ca' Dogaressa Nov. 22-24. Everything is nice about this hotel. Our room was beautiful, clean and well maintained, Daniele and Paolo were very pleasant and helpful, and the coffee they served us for breakfast was superb! We will definitely stay in this hotel next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DiscoveringTravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ca' Dogaressa lived up to all the wonderful reviews. Our room was beautiful. We stayed in a junior suite with a view of the canal. The location was great - it was within easy walking distance of everything and yet it was not on the tourist circuit. We would definitely stay at Hotel Ca' Dogaressa again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: natsparkl
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on hotels in venice we finally settled on Ca' Dogaressa. I am so happy we did! The hotel is not too far from the train station - I was 6 mos pregnant at the time and managed the walk + my luggage with no problem. Once we arrived we were greeted warmly by Paolo - so friendly and sweet. Our room was beautiful, just like the photos on their website. The bathroom was sparkling clean. The hotel sits right on the canal and we enjoyed lovely breakfasts each morning by the water...so romantic! Paolo served us the best cappuccino we have ever had along with an assortment of bread, cheese, brioche and yogurt. We had a wonderful time in Venice and loved our stay at the Ca' Dogaressa.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: PoloM1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our 2 night stay at this hotel and the next time we are in Venice, this place would definately be our first choice in booking a place to stay. The room was clean. The service and staff were excellent. You have internet access in the room, but you need a laptop. If you do not have a laptop, they are willing to rent one to you. As others have mentioned, the distance to the train and bus stations are totally walkable and even easier by the water bus. Which is something I found to be quite convienent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: yearbook1
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Venice. Very close to shopping, food stores, restaurants, and quick access to the vaporettos. Choose the junior suite and overlook the Cannaregio Canal in a spacious, attractive room. One major plus. Just a ten minute walk from the train station crossing only one bridge which has a ramp. No hefting luggage and paying extra for it on the extremely crowded vaporettos. Do yourself a favor. Only sort of down. Meager breakfast. Brioche, coffee, juice, yogurt, and cereal. Every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: screenname2000
Reviews.Content: Like all the other reviewers who praised this hotel they are right. The location is just a short walk from the bus station. The Orange stop for the airport on the Alilaguna line is 100 yards away. Our room was beautifully finished and exceptionally clean and the most silent hotel i have ever been in, not a squeak from the corridor's or other rooms. The desk staff were very helpful. We had juice, yogurt, and brioches for breakfast (no hot food or meat was available) inside as it was not possible to eat by the canal as others have done this year due to the cold weather. Thought the bed was a bit hard but it could just be me being old after being out walking about in Venice for 12 hours shopping !

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beaten!”
Reviews.Author: glennite
Reviews.Content: What can I say, it has all been said before! For the money it can't be beaten.The owner is very keen to please and goes out of his way to make sure everything is just so. The only slight negative is a lack of lounge area, but we knew that before we booked. Area is great and everything is within walking distance. For the difference in money would recommend that you try and book the junior suites. Can be really difficult as this hotel is often fully booked. The owner told us that this has been a really busy year. I suppose recommendations on sites like this are the reason. So book early!

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Kilin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great option. The area is quite nice and close to the train station (walking distance even if you carry your luggage). You will have the chance to have breakfast next to a canal, which is a lovely experience. The staff, which is a family, is the most helpful people I have met during my trip to Europe. It was heavily raining at the day of our departure, and they offered us a couple of their umbrellas and didn't accept us to pay for them.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weltreisender77
Reviews.Content: This is a great little economical hotel in Venice. It's about a 10 to 15 minute walk from the Santa Lucia train station and a 3 minute walk from the water bus stop where you can catch the boat to the airport. The owners greeted us warmly and were very pleasant throughout our stay. The room was a bit small (standard for Europe) but very nicely decorated and quiet at night. The is a rooftop terrace with a great view of the surrounding area. The breakfast was tasty and we even ate outside along the canal on Saturday morning. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleChris
Reviews.Content: Can't be beat for price, room condition and hotel helpfulness/friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quiet Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelers06
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet section of Venice, but not too far away from the grand canal. They had a nice breakfast every morning along side the canal upon which they were locacted. Our room was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. Above all this, however, was the helpful, freindly staff. They were able to help us arrange tours and answered all of our questions. They even went out of their way to make sure we had breakfast early in the morning on our departure day. I would highly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a jewel.”
Reviews.Author: scguy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Ca' Dogaressa and I must agree with the others that have reviewed this hotel. I have stayed at several different hotels in Venice over the years and this one is by far the best one yet. I will definitely try to stay here next time. But, it is very often completely booked up, as are a lot of hotels in Venice. I loved the breakfast by the canal and the furnishings in the room. Well worth every Euro cent it cost.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: wpapadop
Reviews.Content: A wonderful small hotel in a good location in Venice. I would return any time and can recommend it to anyone. The room was splendid and elegantly arranged with a lot of small details. The bathroom was perfectly clean and inviting. Although the hotel is located in a rather central location it is very calm at night. We had a wonderful breakfast near the canal and were always served warmly and courteous from the hotel personnel and the hotel owner. From the hotel you can reach any relevant point in Venice in maximum 30 minutes on foot. I have never been to Venice before and was impressed from the city. Almost every street in this city offers something new to see. But avoid the water-bus ... it is expensive and always slower than walking. And also you will see more from the town. Wasili/DÃ¼sseldorf

Reviews.Title: “Be careful - you might get ripped off”
Reviews.Author: ginchick
Reviews.Content: I never got a chance to stay at this hotel and never will. I booked a room for 3 nights for this September but unfortunately had to cancel. I called the hotel and asked them to cancel my reservation. This month I got a credit card statement which shows that they charged me for one night stay. When I contacted them to dispute the charge, they claimed that the only way you can cancel is by email or fax. That would have been fine if the person I was talking to made it clear that in addition to cancelling over the phone I had to email them or fax them my cancellation. This hotel is looking to rip people off and isn't considering that someone might be traveling without any access to email or fax. I think a phone call should have been enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Summer_rain28
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at this lovely little hotel, which is right on the side of the wide and beautiful Cannaregio canal. With a typically Venetian feel, in a quiet location with easy access to the historic sights and bustling waterways of Venice, Ca Dogaressa is just ideal. Situated very close to the local waterbus stops, the Grand Canal, and the Jewish Ghetto, a place of great historical significance for Venice. The room decor is ornate 16thC Italianate and our room was on the ground floor at the back and had a great view of a wall, but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom immaculately clean and modern. The shower was suitable for people 3ft high or less, but we learnt to live with that, and the air-conditioning worked astonishingly well, controlled from within the room. Everything worked as it should and the free internet was very fast and reliable. I recommend that you book a spacious canal view junior suite - the slight premium is worth it. The hotel is owned by Paulo and his wife, who live right next door. They really are a lovely, friendly couple who go out of their way to make their guests welcome and happy. . Paulo is a popular character - a greengrocer turned Hotelier - and all the passing boatmen seems to know and call to him as he tends to guests and helps his wife look after little Omar, the very well behaved small son of one of the Dogaressa staff. Everything contributes to a peaceful homely feeling that we took to in minutes. The front desk is manned in the daytime by Danielli, a well educated and urbane man who had us laughing with him often. His English is superb, and he is a marvellous source of information. Everyone makes you feel welcome here, and we felt like invited houseguests rather than yet another set of annoying tourists. I would like to say this sort of welcome was typical in Venice, but in my experience, itâ€™s exceptional. Itâ€™s easy to fit into this neighbourhood. The lady walking her ancient dog slowly down the canal side and then taking him home on the waterbus every day was touching, the skill of the boatmen little short of breathtaking. The elderly ladies dressed in their best finery heading for Mass, the younger mothers gossiping in the small alleyway beyond the hotel â€“ this is real Venice, with real Venetians. In good weather, breakfast is served canal side, with excellent and attentive service from Paulo and his staff. Breakfast in Italy can be disappointing to the uninitiated and could be more imaginative here - I would like to see more choice, but the coffee is great! There are few better ways to start your day in Venice than sitting at the edge of this lovely wide canal, watching the city wake. The Hotel position is ideal. 300 yards away from the busy Guglie bridge with its waterbus stop, but you are 15 minutes walk from the heaving sweaty masses of St Marks Square, and there is a serenity here that has long been lost in the commercialism of other parts of this lovely city. If you a wine lover, steer away from the outrageously overpriced restaurants and find the little wine shop 250 yards from the hotel, towards the Guglie bridge. Itâ€™s a tiny shop and next to a small provisions shop. The wine shop owner is a gentle, friendly man who speaks English well, who is happy to let you sample before you buy, and he decants from large containers into plastic bottles for you. We bought really good quality wine here for as little as Euro 1.60 a litre! Compare that to the Euro 4-6 a glass average for indifferent â€œplonkâ€� and rush down there - he even provides the bottles! The small shop next door has a good range of hams and cheeses, and the bakery a few doors down has good bread. We took a picnic up to the Caâ€™ Dogaressa roof terrace and toasted all the boats that passed as the sun set. There is a great little chemist / pharmacy by the Guglie waterbus stop, with helpful English speaking staff. For those who have been travelling there is a good self service laundry nearby, up to the Guglie bridge, turn left away from the bridge and 30 yards along on the right. The hotel will arrange laundry for you if you are too busy and donâ€™t mind paying the premium. Prices in Venice are outrageous for tourists. If you really want to pay a lot for a little, it isnâ€™t difficult. Try the green canopied place next to the Rialto hotel, by the Rialto Bridge for instance. 10 Euro for a glass of iced tea and a coffee - thatâ€™s nearly Â£7 or nearly $14! You also get really rude and cheerless service here too - give it a miss! A much better deal is the little cafe in the Jewish ghetto - in the Ghetto Nuovo square, 5 minutes from the hotel. The food is good and the service is fast and cheery. The prices are better than most in the Cannaregio area and the house the house white wine is crisp and good. There is a good restaurant virtually opposite Caâ€™Dogaressa. Turn right out of the hotel, 100 yds down to the Tre Archi bridge, cross over the canal and itâ€™s the first place you come to. Food is very good, service excellent. We met a local family here and were invited back to their home, along with the restaurant manager, and had a wonderful evening on their roof terrace. Danielli, Caâ€™Dogaressaâ€™s manager, will show you how to avoid the crowds and take the waterbus out to the Lido and to Burano. Lido has wonderful beaches. We bought 30 euro tickets for unlimited waterbus travel for 72 hours, which is a fantastic deal compared with the 6 euro single trip ticket. These tickets also cover land bus travel. The waterbus stop is just along the canal side - Numbers 41 & 42 are the ones that circumnavigate the city. Check which way they are going, as they go both directions. This is a great way to get a feel of the size of Venice and the way the city works. Unless you are an incurable romantic with deep pockets, 80 Euro for a 40 min gondola trip is pricy- take the waterbus and see a lot more for a lot less. If you really must do a gondola, find someone to share with â€“ up to 6 people can go together for the same price. Good way to meet new people and keep costs in budget. If you have a late departure the hotel will look after your luggage for you and have a shower room available for freshening up before your trip home. Take the waterbus 3 stops to the bus station, Piazza le Roma, and take the airport bus. The very comfortable buses run every 15 minutes and only 2 Euros. The airport is the last stop, about 20 minutes from the Piazza le Rome terminal. We shall return to Venice soon and are looking forward to staying at Ca' Dogaressa again.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our three week vacation in Europe”
Reviews.Author: karenagnew
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a gem! The owners and staff are so helpful and friendly. They even put a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine in our room to celebrate my 40th birthday. We stayed in the "apartment" on the top floor overlooking the canal. There was so much room for our family of four. Our children (ages 10 and 12) slept very comfortably on the pull out sofa. And, our bed was massive. The room had three windows where the shutters could close to block out any canal noise when you went to bed. The room was spotless and beautifully decorated. Actually, it was the prettiest we'd seen in our three week vacation to France and Italy. Definitely worth the price! The bathroom was very spacious and done completely in marble. The breakfast was wonderfully romantic by the canal. The breakfast was large by Italian standards and the coffee was the best we had during our entire vacation! We didn't seem to think it was too out of the way. We enjoy the walking and the main canal is crazy busy with tourists. This area is much quieter and gives you a glimpse into how the locals live. My entire family loved this hotel and we would definitely return next time we are in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Most Charming Host!!!”
Reviews.Author: cookie43
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely small hotel in Venice. The hosts were so helpful and ready to assist you in any way. The breakfast by the canal was lovely. It is a bit of a walk to the sites, but really you walk all day in Venice anyway. I followed the directions from the train station that I read in another review on this site and found it no problem. The room was clean with traditional decor (for Venice) it had a very modern bathroom. The shower is a bit of a challenge, but different and you get used to it. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Everything they say is true !”
Reviews.Author: kidd007
Reviews.Content: CÃ  Dogaressa Hotel, we stayed for 2 nights on a trip around Italy and what a Hotel, would highly recommend this hotel, just perfect. Booked after reading all the 5 star reviews, everything about just right. Breakfast served on the Canal bank, sun terrace on the roof, staff friendly, location is just 2 stops from main Bus station Roma, and Hotel only few minuites walk along the bank from Bus stop. Also great cocktail bar over other side of canal only 5 euro each, which is great price. Would stay again at the CÃ  Dogaressa Hotel and would visit Venice again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParsonsFamily5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the highlights of our trip. We stayed here in mid July. The owner is a wonderful , caring man who went way out of his way to make sure our visit was comfortable. We had a room that fit 5 people and it had a wonderful view over the canal. There is also a very nice patio on the top of the hotel where you can sit back and relax. Each morning we woke up and the owner had set up a table right on the canal where he served us breakfast. The hotel is an easy 5-7 minute walk from the train station and you only need to go across one bridge that has a ramp to make it easier to roll your luggage. It is a bit away from the main crowded areas but you can easily walk anywhere in Venice from her. All in all, this was a fantastic place to stay and I would return when I am in Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Ca Dogaressa!”
Reviews.Author: kellyclayt
Reviews.Content: Ca Dogaressa was such a great hotel. It is located on a quieter canal - Canareggio -which still has great access to public transportation. The proprietors, Paolo and his family, are so friendly, they make you feel like family. We stayed in room #1 with a view of the canal - awesome. If you go, take the allilaguna line from the airport (12 euro per person) and get off at the Guglie stop and just walk about half a block (no bridges!). The breakfast on the canal is great. The air conditioning is great - which was very important during the heatwave. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews”
Reviews.Author: chewpei
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and the property met my expectations easily. We booked a superior double and the room was clean and it's furnishings were lovely. The staff was very helpful and answered all our questions and, as a previous reviewer mentioned, loaned us their laptop for free internet access in our room. Breakfast outside on the canal was not lavish, but the setting made up for any lack of variety. (And what we did have was good.) The location is off the beaten path, but that's we were looking for. Venice is very crowded with tourists and it's a relief to get away from the hordes. The walk from the train station wasn't too bad (although the luggage gets heavier when carried over a couple bridges!), and the boat to the airport stops at the vaparetto stop just a couple blocks down. There are several areas of restaurants and shops within a short walk, so it's not like you have to be by the Rialto Bridge or St. Mark's anyway. The only possible complaint l could have is there is no enclosure around the shower, but this seems to be a common problem in Italy. I don't understand this -- do Italians not take showers or do they wipe up puddles after each one?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff - Venice was a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: scubagirrl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nites at this wonderful little hotel. We had a suite overlooking the canal with a great view. Our host was wonderful as was the staff, they could not do enough for us. They spoke both french and english as we needed, and were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Although Venice was indeed unique, after a day or so, it loses it's charm. We traveled by vaporatta and water taxi, and then walked, walked and walked some more, only to find that most of the areas were much of the same and filled with tourists. Food was ok, but not great. I expected better than what I can make in my own kitchen. A word to those who are not walkers, this is not the place for you. I have a bad hip that was worsened by the ups and downs of the bridges. (yes, I knew this would be a problem, just pointing it out.) Murano was unique at first glance, but then became rows and rows of the same souveniers. Burano, colorful and quaint, nice way to spend an hour or so. All in all, I had a great trip, but would chose more wisely in the future. When I think of Italy I think of good friends, good food and stunning views. Venice had it's own vibe, but not what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: joyce_ch
Reviews.Content: There is little I can add to the chorus of wonderful reviews for this hotel. Yes, it is a bit off the beaten track, but that is part of its charm. We loved being in a neighborhood rather than a touristy area. Sitting by the canal for breakfast and watching parents walk children to school and people going to work was a treat. Paolo is the "Guardian of the Corner" and knows almost everyone who passes. I'm a crank about noise, and it was quiet as a pin even though we were overlooking the canal. The decor is lovely, and everything is scrupuously clean. There is no elevator so if one has trouble with steps, you might avoid this hotel. We absolutely loved our stay here. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Venice. The ghetto is a neat place too. It is an oasis of calm in the city, and there are some wonderful Jewish art stores there.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful haven”
Reviews.Author: bronygraig
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last December. Perfect. Just as all the reviewers claim. Easy to get to by water bus and a lovely stroll down the canal. Other reviewers will sell it a lot better than I will. Clean, well decorated, excellent service and good value. Once again, trust the reviews and go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Stylish Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: artistandarchitect
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have recently spent a blissful week at this wonderfully romantic â€˜boutiqueâ€™ hotel. Located alongside a peaceful canal just a short stroll away from the delightful bustle of a daily market, stylish shops, cafes and restaurants, it really was the most perfect setting. The hotel itself is so elegant (inside!) with its wonderfully stylish dÃ©cor and the friendly helpful staff made us feel so welcome. We stayed in room 8 a â€˜standardâ€™ double although it was far from being just standard with its charming gilded, painted furniture, Baroque mirrors and glass chandeliers! After spending the day amongst the breath taking Venetian architecture/interiors how perfect to return to the Ca Dogaressa and relax in its elegant surroundings. The room itself was spotlessly clean and offered every modern amenity to make our stay so blissfully comfortable. During our week (in June) Venice experienced a heat wave so we were very grateful for the air conditioning which although had independent controls in the room, it was automatically set at the perfect temperature particularly for sleeping (no waking up during the night shivering)! The bed was so comfortable with immaculate bed linen and white towels in the bathroom, all which were changed daily. The shower was spacious and powerful and included a hand held attachment for us girls who donâ€™t like to get our faces wet whilst washing our hair! It was also the little added extras such as the powerful hairdryer in the bathroom, plenty of coat hangers in the wardrobe as well as a mini-bar fridge and safe which made this such a perfect choice of hotels. There was only one thing I would have added but itâ€™s a minor detail and that is a full length mirror, (for us girls trying to compete with the immaculate Italians a full length mirror would certainly help) like I said a minor point! The best start to the day was our leisurely Ca Dogaressa breakfast sitting by the canal with fresh apricot filled pastries, fruit juices and yoghurt - fantastic! As for the coffee it was most certainly the best in Italy particularly the espresso â€“ highly recommended for that kick-start! We also discovered some fabulous restaurants during our stay only a short walk away (manageable even in heels!) and I had no problem as a Vegetarian. Do try the pumpkin ravioli in the Alla Palazzina restaurant (literally at the end of the street from the Ca Dogaressa â€“ the address is Alla Palazzina Ponte delle Guilie Cannareggio). Itâ€™s such a romantic trattoria where you can eat under a vine-covered pergola along side the canal with pretty glass votive candles on each table. Like many we choose the Ca Dogaressa from the wonderful comments on Tripadvisor and booked directly via the hotelâ€™s web site, which couldnâ€™t have been easier. It certainly lived up to its excellent TripAdvisor reputation and in many ways far surpassed our expectations particularly on the excellent location. We are now counting the days until our return. If we had the choice of any hotel in Venice (money no object) it would still be the Ca Dogaressa!

Reviews.Title: “Lovey hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: usakiwi
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this wonderful little hotel on a six week tour of Europe, it was our favourite. We arrived in unseasonably hot weather and were hot and tired after walking from the water bus with our luggage. Paolo got us settled in our room and when we came downstairs for information on the area, he treated us to a refreshing Bellini. Ca' Dogaressa is in Cannaregio which is more of a neighborhood than a tourist spot. It is on one of the small canals and a 5 minute walk from the water bus. We had the Junior Suite, which overlooks the canal. The room was beautifully decorated with antique like furniture and Murano glass fittings. The bathroom was beautiful and modern with good water pressure. Aside from being a lovely hotel, what really makes it special is Paolo and his team. They were great hosts and made us feel at home. The location is great, far enough away from the tourist areas so it is not crowded and noisey but close enough to walk most everywhere. One of our highlights was to watch the neighborhood come alive each morning. Breakfast by the canal was magical. There are many good restaurants in the neighborhood and most of them are frequented by the locals. One of our favourites was Roberta di Ponti, right by the water bus stop. It is a great place to people watch and the food was good and reasonably price. We would recomment Ca' Dogaressa highly and hope to come back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dallerton53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during Carnival. It's a lovely little hotel close enough to the Rialto and other tourist spots for convenience but far enough away to enjoy a quieter side of Venice. I'd been to Venice several times but this was the first time I had a good look around the Ghetto and found it very interesting. The service at the hotel was charming and welcoming and the rooms and facilities were very good, nice size comfortable bedrooms, well equipped bathroom, and a nice breakfast. of cereal, croissants, coffee, fruit and yoghurt.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: The_Wentworth_Family
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, beautifully restored in 19th century Venetian style, but very modern facilities, bathroom, bath and air conditioning. Located in the north of the main Venice island on the canal close to Boatbus stop, 3 stops from Ple.Roma (where all the buses terminate from the airport). This part of Venice is great, near University, very chilled out and much quieter than the St Marks area. The staff in the hotel were so welcoming and friendly. Our breakfast was served alongside the canal and was lovely. Good value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by its cover”
Reviews.Author: allsportsfanG
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel.We stayed here for 4 nights during our 2 week Europe/UK Honeymoon.We arrived by train and inside the train station there is a hotel booking place,and if you go in there and ask where the hotel is they give you pretty good directions.Make sure you bring mosquito repellent if you open the windows we got bit at least 10 times. The owners are really helpful in telling you how to get to places.Even if you walk around Venice and try to get lost you can't because its just an island after all.Make sure you go on a gondola ride.We paid 90 euro for ours and it was about 8:30 pm.It was awesome.So are the Pigeons in st marks.The Italian restaurant across the canal from the hotel by the last bridge by the college was the best food on our honeymoon!!Make sure you go on the roof of the hotel and enjoy the view over a glass of wine its fun

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: mbgk420
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a second floor room in May 2007. Rooms are nicely decorated and very quiet. Very clean and modern facilities. Water pressure is just ok. The family is very nice and accomodating; they speak English very well. There is someone available 24 hours so when we had to checkout at 4:00 am they were there and helpful and had packed a breakfast for us to take along. Breakfast is (normally) served out along the canal which is really special. Great brioche and as much as you'd like. Very convenient to the main water taxi lines, train station and bus station and easy walking to all sights. It's really nice to be a little removed from the Rialto and St. Marks areas. Would definitely stay again. They offered a discount for paying cash but we didn't know it until too late and couldn't withdraw enough from the ATM. You shoud inquire in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Julian5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a delightful 5 night stay at this great little hotel, booked on the strength of reviews on Trip Advisor, which proved to be great value. Past reviews have commented on the location being 'quiet, far from the centre of Venice, etc, etc...', but for this hotel I would say the location is a definite plus. The hotel is adjacent to one of the minor canals, and there is a waterbus stop only 5 mins away. However, this is not on a main route and we only used this stop on the first and last days when we had our luggage, but the Hotel is also only a 15-20 mins leisurely stroll from the busier water bus stops at Ferrovia and Port le Roma, which makes travelling up and down the Grand Canal very easy. The hotel is also a 15-20 slow walk to Rialto bridge with Saint Mark's Square slightly further on, just follow the signs. All in all, the hotel is in a great location if you're looking to stay somewhere away from the crowds where you can relax in comfort, but still be in easy reach of all the sights and sounds of Venice during the day. Our room was fantastic, very comfortable with excellent decor, daily maid service and the management and staff couldn't have been more helpful. They responded in a very friendly manner to our terrible Italian, but everyone spoke excellent English so language was never a problem. Breakfast can be enjoyed at tables next to the Canal if the weather is good, as it was during our stay, and this just adds to the hotel's enchantment There are one or two decent restaurants more or less opposite the hotel, with one in particular that was excellent (if you enjoy a great home made pizza) - turn right, go over the bridge and back along the opposite bank and it's the first place you come to. You may, however, prefer to venture a little further for a better standard of food and service for the majority of your stay. If you're looking for a hotel in the centre of the action, or a 5 star+ hotel at 3 star prices this may not be the one for you. But if you're looking for a quality hotel that 'does exactly what is says on the tin' I couldn't recommend this one any more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaLass
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel & loved the location even more. Our room was called Laura, a double on the second floor with a vaulted beam roof. Spotlessly clean & very stylish. Venetian fabric wall coverings, speckled marble floors, ornate gilt mirror and murano glass lamps and chandelier. Having explored palaces in Venice you see realise this is very in keeping with grand Venetian homes. Having breakfast by the canal; watching it as people went to work, deliverd post, hauled building supplies etc you got to see working Venice. A lovely way to start the day. At the end of the day you can sit on their quiet roof terrace and have a drink as the sun goes down. For dinner, avoid San Marco & enjoy one of the may restaurants & bars along Misericordia. Cheap by Venetian standards, very romantic & a place to hang out with the locals. Would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to anyone who'll listen!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sukyTelAviv
Reviews.Content: we came to this hotel after we so all the recomendtion on the web site , this was our hoony moon, we gut room no' 5 with canal veiw , the hotel was a verry good exprience starting from the staff - nice and helpfull , the location is 15 ninuts walk to allmost anywhere , the room is beutiful and clean , we hed brakfast on the terrace and evrything was dreamy. we recomend this hotel , and ask for room no' 5 .

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: from
Reviews.Content: We arrived a bit early and were welcomed with coffee and brioche. The owners speak Italian and some French, but the son speaks English. The bathroom is very modern, with good water pressure. There was free broadband internet in the room. The breakfast can be taken on the canal, which was very interesting - brioche, cereal, buns, cheese, cookies, juice and coffee were all available. I believe the room decor is somewhat restrained for Venice, painted wood furniture and glass chandeliers. We were in a third floor room with a lovely beamed ceiling. There is a terrace available to the guests, with evening sun. The windows do not appear to have screens, and can therefore let in mosquitos, but perhaps there is airconditioning in the summer - we did not ask about it. Due to a very early flight departure, we were able to arrange to check out the evening before, and leave the key at the unstaffed desk at 4:15am.
