This hotel was a 20-25 min walk to Piazzale Roma at 4:15am, plenty of time to make the first 5:00am bus to the Marco Polo airport.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Castringblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights towards the end of April after checking through comments on Tripadvisor. To be honest I have nothing different to say that hasn't been said already. Although the hotel is a 20 minute walk from St Marks Square we loved the location. After a busy day it was relaxing to get back to a quieter oasis of calm so that we could recharge our batteries. The hotel is perfectly clean and functional. We had one of the suites with a view of the canal. The only thing that we would have had additional was a balcony so that we could relax and watch the world go by, however this is only a minor issue and we were fully aware that there weren't any before we arrived. Breakfast was served by the canal each morning and was easily adeqaute for us. The owner and his wife were very attentive and helpful when required without being overly fussy, which we prefer. I can't imagine that anybody would be disappointed with this hotel. Get yourself to Venice because it is the best city in the world. No matter how often you see it on films, nothing will prepare you for the experience once you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “No better place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: threeoaks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 wonderful nights here over Easter and cannot say enough about this little gem of a hotel! We booked our room based solely on the rave reviews we read here on trip advisor and were not disappointed in any way. We were warmly welcomed on arrival and shown our room by a very enthusiastic fellow - he was obviously proud of the room and hotel facilities and rightly so. We had booked a junior suite and when we were taken to our room I was concerned as it was not room 5 - so often mentioned on this site. I need not have worried, our suite was wonderful in every way. The decor surpassed our expectations, the bed was huge, we had 3 enormous windows that overlooked the canal, splendid bathroom and comfortable sofa and chairs to relax on and read. We took the option of breakfast in our room every morning - although the sunny terrace was also very inviting. For us the location was perfect - away from the tourist drag and crowds but close enough to get everywhere relatively quickly. We walked everywhere and found that discovering quiet backstreets to be a highlight of our stay. We have already recommended this hotel to our parents for their 60th birthday in May and would not want to stay anywhere else in Venice. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely stay at the Ca'Dogaressa”
Reviews.Author: CarlyMegsMom
Reviews.Content: This small hotel/bed and breakfast was a lovely place to stay on our recent trip to Venice. Our room #3 was a "regular room" but had 2 nice windows onto a narrow alley and a modern bathroom. The roof terrace was pretty much our private domain as I never saw another guest there, and one night we simply ordered pizza to go from the pizzeria across the canal and dined under the stars with an inexpensive bottle of Italian wine purchased from one of the groceries on the main shopping street. The owner provided us with real glasses (not wine glasses, but we weren't picky), as opposed to having to use the plastic ones from the room. The location on the canal was very convenient for going to Murano using the waterbus or saving yourself the walk to St. Mark's. The hotel will sell you a 24-hour ticket for $15 Euro, definitely a good buy for a short stay. However, walking to the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's is not difficult, and you would miss much of the beauty of Venice if you don't walk the island. Breakfast was fine, the owner very helpful as other's have stated. Our only complaint was that with the windows open (temperatures were in the 70's in mid April) we found our sleep disturbed by small bugs flying around our heads. When asked if we could have the air conditioning turned on, were told that the heat was turned off and their agreement with the utility does not let them turn the air on until a specified day. Screens on the windows would solve this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Retreat”
Reviews.Author: MLG988
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this bed & breakfast! What an amazing place to fall in love with such a beautiful city! One of the best parts is that it is out of the way, and allows you the rare opportunity to live amongst the true Venetians. Very quiet and peaceful, church bells ringing, there's nothing like sitting out on the canal with a glass of vino in the late afternoon! Venice is a walking city, there's no way around that. You could make it to Rialto in 15 minutes and St. Marks in 20 if you wore blinders and had your wallet padlocked. We stayed in a junior suite with canal view; 4 huge windows we kept open the whole time, and more than enough room for a weeks worth of packing plus the extra suitcases and everything you buy! We found the room very quiet, woke up to church bells every morning. The staff is wonderful, breakfast in bed at no extra charge. And since it was our honeymoon, they sent up a bottle of chilled champagne and chocolates to us our first night there! I cannot say enough about this hidden treasure, except that I will never stay anywhere else when I come to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TYRY
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the recent reviews of this hotel. Depending on how far you like to walk defines how far you think it may be off the beaten track. It was, for us, a leisurely 20 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge & 25 mins to St Marks Square. Although the part of Cannarreggio is quiet, it is by no means lonely or threatening. The staff at the hotel give the impression that they want to make your stay a pleasurable one. The rooms are very clean & the breakfast is good. You can get a 5% discount for cash by the way. Upon our departure the owners son was at pains to ask us whether the hotel could have done anything to improve our stay - a nice touch & i am sure sincere. The only improvement would have been a small bar/lounge area, but this is being very picky. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel which represents exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Ca Dogaressa, Good value but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: lovesusvi
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel because of the price. 125 E or $165.00. It is 10-15 minute walk from the train station. When you come out of the train station, turn left and keep going. Then cross over the bridge and turn left. Keep going. The hotel is on the right and the name is on it, but it appears boarded up (it looked so bad we started laughing, wondering what in the world we had done) .The hotel entrance is on the side with cute little plants showing the entrance. The location is a little scarey at night. Not many people around. Once inside the hotel it is very pretty and the rooms are so cute. The bathroom was very modern. There is not an elevator and we were on the 3rd floor, but that was not a problem for us. The only bad thing about this hotel is the location and the thin walls. We could hear the man and woman next door talking and then his snoring that night. So, bring ear plugs if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: spiderwicks
Reviews.Content: Based off TripAdvisor reviews, we booked this hotel for a weekend break and were not disappointed. The family running it are friendly and helpful, and the room and bathroom were newly done over and very clean. We stayed in room 6, a little bit smaller than the others (I think) but plenty roomy enough - the skylight and traditional wooden eaves gave it a lot of charm, too. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the railway station, in a quieter more residential area - but in my opinion this is a very good thing as it's easy to walk to anywhere (or take the vaporetto) but you are away from the main throngs of tourists. I'd recommend anyone looking for reasonable, clean and quiet accommodation with a little personality and great staff to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A real taste of Venice”
Reviews.Author: J&ADublin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night break in Venice. The hotel was a little jewel just off the Grand Canal. We chose the hotel based on recommendations from this site and we were not disappointed. The staff were were very friendly and most helpful. The room was not overly large but it was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The decor was most impressive and the bathroom was excellent. We arrived late in the evening and the man behind the desk was able to find us a restaurant that was open late and also very good. The hotel is slightly away from the main tourist areas so you can get an idea of everyday Venice too. Be sure to get a 3 day ACTV Bus/Vaporetto ticket at the airport for â‚¬30 each, it will get you to and from the airport and cover for all Vaperetto travel between the islands and around Venice for 3 days. A couple on the same flight spent â‚¬90 alone on a water taxi to their hotel which was next door to ours. We would highly recommend this hotel to any visitors to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet haven”
Reviews.Author: mid-age-travellers
Reviews.Content: Great friendly small hotel. Stayed in the junior suite overlooking the canal. Clean, comfortable, nothing too much trouble for the staff. Not in the thick of things in Venice but in a quiet area which was a 20 minute walk to St Marks. A couple of local trattorias and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Ca Dogaressa”
Reviews.Author: davinarichards19
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Venice Carnival, was such a great atmosphere with everyone dressed up, i will definitely go again some day. I found the Ca Dogaressa on this site and it more than lived up to its reputation. A lovely warm welcome with beautiful Venetian style rooms and clean modern bathroom. The location was also perfect, just next to a canal near to the train station for convenience. Very good value, i will be staying here again when i next come to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: wimbli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Nov last year. I was probably expecting a bit more for the superior room, it was quite small but at least it was clean and quiet. The bathroom had been renovated and so that was very nice. The breakfast room is a bit too small - only four tables and if you have an annoying loud person in the room, you'll have to suffer as we did. The food on offer wasn't much. The location was good and bad - only a 10 min walk from the train station which meant you didn't have to bother with the water taxis with your luggage. However it's a bit of a hike to Piazza San Marco and back (especially when you keep getting lost on the way back to the hotel!). However, for value, this is a good hotel considering it's in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Lovely Little Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Light-cruiser
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the main railway station and is very convenient though it is slightly far from San Marco Square. We arrived late at the hotel and the owner was expecting us and greeted us by our names! The room was small but nicely decorated with glass chandelier and the bathroom was clean and bright. The owner does not converse well in English but was very attentive and helpful. It's a small hotel but it was comfortable. The only minor shortcoming was the small breakfast room which has only 4 tables and it gets a bit crowded when it is filled up. Nevertheless, my wife and I had a very good time staying in this hotel and we love Venice so much that we hope to come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ca' Dogaressa: Quiet & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cmh_org
Reviews.Content: Ca' Dogaressa is a quiet, comfortable and small hotel that overlooks the Canale di Cannaregio. The room was comfortable, although since we were at the back of hotel we only had a view of neighboring rooftops. The service was excellent; the owner didn't hesitate to give us great suggestions for dinner and even offered us an umbrella when it rained. Breakfast was average. We are a gay couple and we would definitely stay at Ca' Dogaressa again. We felt completely comfortable and safe. A great little hotel at a great price in an out of the way neighborhood, away from all the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, small breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: BrianGlover
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend in Nov. As highlighted by the other posts this a is very good value hotel for Venice providing excellent bang for bucks. We booked a superior room (2nd floor) and had a very nice room. Breakfast is spartan (i.e. cofee & croissants) but was fine for us.We walked to the hotel from the bus station as the vapo stops at the train station stop which can take ages depending on what time of day it is. Therefore a brisk 10 min walk and you are there. The hotel area is very quiet at night but bustles in the early morning. I would recommend walking to the grand canal stops as there are far more vapos passing through. I was tempted to give the a 5 award for the hotel but found 2 small negatives. Firstly when we arrived (at c.21.30 hrs) we asked whether there was anywhere we could get something to eat and were recommended a distinctly average restaurant that must have belonged to a family relative. Secondly, we were first down for breakfast on our second morning and the room quickly filled up so that people were waiting on the stairs for a table. Only a small gripe, and overall a v. good hotel. N.B. you can buy vapo tickets at the hotel reception. In Venice we would definitely recommend the vivaldi concerts and the Secret tour in the Doge's palace.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: ml3369
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the trip advisor community for a very good tip - this is an excellent little hotel for the price. Good size rooms, reasonable price, nice staff. Breakfast was basic - bread, croissants and coffee - but fine. If you want to get here cheaply from Marco Polo airport, I recommend the following route. Take the airport fast bus directly outside the airport (3 euros, every 20 minutes, blue coach. Buy a ticket from the machine by the bus stop or from the driver) to Piazzale Roma. Then buy a ticket for the vaporetta ferries from the ticket office on the quayside - recommended is a 3 day (25 euro) or 5 day pass depending on how long you are there, as you will find yourself hopping on and off the vaporetti to get around. You can also buy a single ticket on board for 6 euros. You take the number 52 or 42 and get off at Guglie stop - about 10 minutes away. Turn left from the stop, walk along the quay and the hotel is n umber 1018, about 5 minutes away. Remember to keep looking up as you might miss it - it has a big sign up above, but if you don't see that, it looks like a brick building. Another alternative is to take the Alilaguna ARANCIA line from the airport dock and this stops at Guglie - but currently only runs till about 5pm . Cost at time of writing was 12 euros each way.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Le_Walrus
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the stength of the reviews on this website and was not disappointed. I would recommend calling the hotel or emailing directly when booking as when I tried to book through the website I was contacted by email to be advised that a particular date was unavailable. The recoptionist speaks excellent English so calling is probably easiest. On arrival, we were given a warm welcome and taken to our room (room 4 - superior double). The room was absolutely spotless. The shower was very good too. My only gripe about the bed was that it was a double bed base but actually 2 mattresses pushed together so there was a join in the middle. That said the matresses were firm. Shutters keep the light out and the room is double glazed which kept any noise out. Breakfast was also good, the cappucinos especially are highly recommended. We thought the location was really good in a working part of venice slightly away from the hordes of tourists but still in a convenient location. The whole of venice is in easy walking distance with St Mark's square being about an hour to an hour and a half away or a pleasant 20-30 minute chug by Vaproetto. Eating out is hideously expensive in Venice and the best deals are to be found off the beaten track and definitely not on the main drag or near any bridges. The student areas near Accademia were good value. Avoid the Trattoria del Ponte near the hotel like the plague. Prison food at its worst! If you have the time I recommend walking to the Guggenheim via the Rialto and taking in all the sites on the way. Taking a Traghetto over the grand canal is great fun and a bargain at 50 cents! Also check out La Fenice website to see if anything is on during your stay as the setting is spectacular. Finally, check out the Osteria Vecio Forner near the Guggenheim museum. Amazing Cichetti and great value prosecco! All in all a very pleasant hotel. Thank you Trip Advisor members!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, value for money with pleasant owners”
Reviews.Author: Liam'O
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over first weekend in December 2006. The hotel is located in a good, quiet position in what used to be the Jewish Quarter, just off the busy Station to Rialto Street. Its only four stops and 10 mins on the Waterbus from 'Roma station. We paid for the standard room, and we were given the down stairs room on arrival. (No. 9 I think) We found it to be spacious, immaculately clean with a good bathroom. (Good power from the shower - unlike other reviews). Only problem was that it wasnâ€™t in the quietest location in the building with the other side of the wall being the breakfast room and reception. Every word of every conversation could be heard and no doubt every word we spoke could be heard also. But we were late in at night and wanted to get up early every morning so that wasnâ€™t a problem with us. (On checking out we were asked if the room was too noisy for us, so it seems that previous guests found it a problem) Overall this was exactly what we wanted for our stay. A good standard, clean hotel that was value for money (225 Euro for 3 nights) and we would definitely stay again. (Maybe ask for a room upstairs next time)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but some Minor Issues”
Reviews.Author: rpandjm
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was pretty good, but a few things make me deduct a couple stars from my rating. The location isnâ€™t bad. Itâ€™s a quiet area on a side canal that does have a vaporetto stop nearby. It is somewhat far from all the action at St. Markâ€™s square, which can be a positive or negative, depending on how you look at it. I chose the location because we arrived by train and left by bus, so we were able to walk to both, which worked out well. It is a good walk though â€“ note it isnâ€™t next door to the train station. Our room (#6) was a good size, and the bathroom was very modern. Both the room and bathroom were very clean, though there were some significant cobwebs in the ceiling beams. Breakfast offered a good selection. The bed (two twin beds pushed together) was very firm, which I know some people really like, though we prefer a softer mattress. The first problem we had was that our room was very warm. The thermostat was at 26 degrees Celsius, which is almost 80 degrees Fahrenheit. We called the front desk, but the person on duty had no idea what to do, so that night we roasted. The next day we told the day person about it, and he agreed that the room we were in gets very hot in late fall and early spring, due to its location near the furnace. He agreed to do what he could. However, the solution they arrived at was to leave the window open. It may be perfectly safe to do that, but in a city Iâ€™m not familiar with, Iâ€™m just not comfortable having the window open, especially because there was a roof right below. The next issue we had was that the internet site clearly states â€œfree ADSL internetâ€œ and â€œIf you do not have a PC yet you would like to use the internet, the hotel will make one available to you right in your room.â€� So when we inquired, they pulled out a laptop. They failed to state that there was a rental charge on the laptop, but said that such information was on an information sheet on the desk. They did reduce our charge in half, and perhaps we were partly to blame for not reading the sheet (though it was written in half English, half Italian, so Iâ€™m not even sure I would have fully understood it anyway), but this was our third hotel in Italy, and the first one provided an in-room computer at no charge, and the second one had one in the lobby at no charge. The last issue was that we were leaving very early in the morning. The sign stated that breakfast was from 8-10, so we did not expect we would be able to get breakfast. However, when we told them we were checking out very early the next day, they told us we could get an early breakfast, but it would have to be the previous dayâ€™s croissants, because they wouldnâ€™t have picked up the fresh ones yet. As this was much more than we were expecting, that was absolutely fine. We told them we would be in the breakfast room at 6. The next morning, we went down at 6, and nobody was at the desk â€“ all was dark. Had they not told us they would have something, I would have thought nothing of it, but telling us about it, then just not showing up was not good. So overall, it was a very nice place, but these three issues do force me to take off some stars.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: codladh-samh
Reviews.Content: Just right for us. Small hotel but generous room (ours was the junior suite), spotlessly clean, very well-managed by a completely dedicated proprietor, located by the canal that used to be the main route into the heart of Venice before the road/rail bridge was built. Ready access to the vaporetto nos. 41 and 42 (to F. Nove, Murano, P le Roma etc) and to the Alilaguna Orange Line ferry out to the Airport - very useful, 12 euros - note that the boat from the Airport stops elsewhere though so you walk or catch the 41 at F. Nove). In a living part of the city but close enough to the tourist sights. Sounds of routine canal traffic not intrusive in our urban ears and eliminated if needs be by simply shutting the windows. Breakfast fine but may be more enticing in the place opposite. Overall a real pleasure to stay here. Wish there were more places like it. And a big thanks to the tripadvisor community for steering us in the right direction!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MontrealMember
Reviews.Content: I can only add to the list of compliments of this wonderful little hotel. I was in the Venice area for several days of meetings and only had an afternoon and evening to enjoy Venice itself. The location of the hotel is excellent, whether arriving by bus (10 minute walk) or train (5 minute walk). The Alilaguna waterbus which services the airport also stops within 250 meters of the hotel (12Euro) on an hourly basis. The room I was given was lavishly furnished (perhaps overdone!) and spacious by European standards. Breakfast on the canal was wonderful although I fear I hurt the poor man's feelings as I ate somewhat hastily to make the 9:00 waterbus for the airport. Wonderful hotel combined with wonderful service at a great price (110Euro) only served to make a brief stay more rewarding.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Scientist-Mad
Reviews.Content: What a gem!! My husband and I spent 2 nights here from 17-19th Oct. Thanks to Tripadvisor, we couldn't have been happier with the choice. Location: Central. 10 mins walk from Central station, 2 mins from waterbus stop Guglie. 20 mins walk to St. Mark's Square. Room: We stayed in Room no. 6, standard room. Romantic, spacious and clean. Bathroom: Spotless with a big shower room. Staff: Friendliest staff in Italy. Breakfast: Simple and nice, u can have it in your room/breakfast room/up on the terrace or by the canal. Overall: Very pleased and would not even think of staying anywhere else in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Paolo the owner was a delight and so was the hotel”
Reviews.Author: whatthe111111
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4 we travelled around Europe for 5 weeks and Ca Dogaressa was our favourite. Paolo the owner was such a gentleman and so lovely to our young daughters, he went out of his way to make us feel welcomed as did his wife and son. The hotel is in a great location - 10 minute walk from the train station, the rooms are spacious and spotless as well as the bathrooms. Breakfast is served outside infront of the Canal with plenty to eat. All the main attractions are close and easy to get to. Rather than eat at the expensive restaurants all the time buy your food and lovely wine (which is so cheap) and eat it out in front of the hotel on the Canal. Paolo is more than happy to set up table and chairs for you. Great value for money and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nostradamus
Reviews.Content: Just as others have said in the past, this hotel is excellent. The room is spacious, well decorated and clean. The owner is very friendly and accomodating, and the location is very convenient - easy to get to via the vaporetto and just far enough from the touristy part of town so that you can get a peaceful night's rest. The room: My wife loved the wallpaper, and how it matched all the furniture. Both the room and bathroom are spacious by European standards, and spotless. Breakfast: The weather was excellent, so we were served breakfast outside right in front of the canal. The food was good, and it was a great atmosphere for breakfast. Location: It's a very short walk to the vaporetto stop and from there about 10 minutes to either the bus or train terminals. The hotel is on a side canal, just a turn off the grand canal. I believe this is an advantage as it is quiet but very easy to get anywhere via foot or water transport. Owner: The owner was very friendly and spoke english well. He even lent us a book with reviews of restaurants and pricing. All in all, this is a great place to stay - only wish we could have stayed more than one night!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: The_Magoos
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely lovely time when we spent two nights of our honeymoon at Ca Dogaressa. The location on Cannaregio is fantastic for access to the main train station and was close to 2 vaporetto stops for transport around the city. The hotel itself was a delight! It looks like every other rundown Venetian building from outside, but inside it was clean, cosy and extremely comfortable. The bedroom and bathroom we had were immaculate and decorated in traditional Venetian style. However, the best thing about this hotel was the owner. He was an absolute gentleman. He fussed over us at breakfast, worked extremely hard to accommodate our lack of Italian and gave us a warm and friendly welcome whenever we returned. For the price, this hotel is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: Chris_FFM
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from Venice having a wonderful stay for two nights in this wonderful hotel. It is run by a family which lives across the street and they really seem to love their work. Our room on the 2nd floor was very clean, quiet und with great antique furniture. We were told, that the rooms are named after family members. The first day we had our breakfast at the channel and enjoyed it. The second morning it was raining heavily, so we had to breakfast inside, which was nice, but in a relatively small room. The friendliness of the staff is remarkable. As as small example, they didn't accept that we wanted to pay the minibar and because it was raining so hard the gave us an umbrella for the trip back home. Small things but given with a smile. Big recommendation for this gem in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not given the chance”
Reviews.Author: JLCGarnier
Reviews.Content: After reading all the good reviews, we decided give it a try too. We booked throught the hotel's website and confirmation was sent to us within a day. However, upon arrival, we were told that no room was available for us because the hotel was overbooked; instead, they have arranged a room (without nice decoration) for us in a nearby 2 star hotel. We stayed in Venice for only 2 days, and hoped to have a nice, romantic room there ....... very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “No doubt, the best choice.”
Reviews.Author: Virx
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Venice several times before, I can assure you that Caâ€™Dogaressa is the best place one can find in this incredible city. We arrived at Venice by bus from the airport and get off at Piazzale Roma. From here to the hotel, itâ€™s just a 15 minute wonderful and marvellous stroll; and it is very easy to get at it, thereâ€™s no way to get lost (something very common across the city). When we got there, we got panicked, because we saw a door completely closed facing the Fondamenta di Cannaregio. We thought the reservation through internet had been a fake!! But fortunately, we realized that the main entrance was right after the corner. The hotel has just 6 rooms, being 2 of them suites overlooking the canal. Ours was facing a narrow and very quiet street on the second floor. Each of them has it own name: We stayed at Pifana corner. When we opened the room we were astonished: it is very spacious and luxury decorated, with a 18th century style. It has all kinds of amenities (minibar, safe box, hairdryer, independent air conditioning which was fabulous in Augustâ€¦) and, over all (having stayed at other Italian hotels), it is extremely clean. Moreover, being August, we could have the great and unique privilege of having our breakfast served next to the canal. This sensation was a great gift from the hotel. It is a pleasure hard to describe, each morning we were very happy to see the sun shining brightly and have the chance to go outside in order to eat our croissants, our nutella filled small breads, the cappuccinos, the chocolate cookies and the orange juiceâ€¦ among many other things you can order. It is a winner. Last but not least, we had the chance to run into some of the kindest staff in Venice. Though we do not know the names (we should have asked, I know), the recepcionists of Caâ€™Dogaressa were at all times extremely gentle and nice. They helped us with the luggage (many thanks!! I had a terrible backache), they gave us all the information about how to go to other places, they recommended us restaurants, etcâ€¦ Besides, at least one of them (we tried out Italian with the rest!) speaks fluent and good English which made things easier. Believe us, it is the best place to stay in Veniceâ€¦ and the prices are very affordable. It is for sure that we will come back very soon. Virginia & Noe, Barcelona (Spain)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: foxy-rooney
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two day stay at Ca' Dogaressa, and cannot say enough good things about the hotel, the service, and location. The rooms are fantastic, clean, well furnished and comfortable. Much more than can be expected for this price in Venice. The location about 10-15 minute walk to Piazza San Marco is perfect because you are far enough away from the crowds to have a little peace, yet close enough to enjoy the sights. The owner is extremely helpful with restaurant recomendations as well as any other questions you have concerning the city. Eating on the canal is fantastic! Recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: tiv
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night out of a total of 7 nights in Italy and we have to say it was the best hotel. It's located in a quieter area of Venice, which was perfect for a stroll around before hitting the more touristy areas. The staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. The room we stayed in was quite small and did not have a view of the canal. However, it was very clean and the lack of a view was made up for by having breakfast on the canal. We strongly recommend staying at this lovely hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: shawnvice
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. It was certainly the best one we stayed at on our honeymoon in Italy, and the others were great too (thanks Tripadvisor). Staying out of the tourist fray on the Canneregio canal, and yet within close walking distance of everything, made it ideal. The junior suite with canal view is gorgeous, very romantic. And the owner Paolo is the sweetest guy imaginable, gave us all kinds of restaurant recommendations - plus a bottle of sparkling wine as a honeymoon gift! Really, look no further, book here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: monkeylizard
Reviews.Content: Ca'Dogaressa is about an 8-10 minute walk from Venice SL train station in the Cannaregio siestre. It was absolutely fantastic. When we go back, we are DEFFINATELY staying here. Don't bother with the vaporetto to Guglio stop. Even with luggage, just turn left from the station and follow the main street until you cross yuor first bridge. Make a left as soon as you cross and the hotel is a few hundred meters down the fondamente (big sidewalk). Paulo is a very nice older man who owns the place with his wife and we think their son. Wife and son do pretty well with their English, but I got to use some of my Italian with Paulo. Between my beginner Italian and his beginner English, we had no problem communicating. It was lots of fun talking with him. The whol family and the ir staff are so helpful and friendly. We wanted to move in! The hotel is a small B&B type place, but each room has its own bath. Easily a 4+ star by European standards, and a strong 3.5 to 4 by US standards. We had a non-smoking Junior Suite (Room 5) facing the canal. Marble bath and a well appointed and spacious room. Clean as a whistle. Paulo did this place up right. The room is the yellow and gold room and has the green and white marble bath. The hotel is on the opposite end of Venice from Saint Markâ€™s, so there is very little tourism next to the hotel, but youâ€™re on the main shopping street in about 2 minutes from the hotel door and in St. Marks in 30 by foot or 15 by vaporetto. Breakfast was delicious with freshly made croissants delivered from the bakery each morning, plus the other things already mentioned in other reviews. The hotel is brightly lit at night so it's easy to find and we felt very safe walking back very late at night. Only two minor things, but neither would keep us away. One: Our room had a tub with a hand-held shower head and no shower curtain. I guess we're stupid Americans, but we couldn't figure out how to use it without getting water all over the floor. Oh well, the fluffy towels soaked it up easily. Two: those bright lights that make the hotel easy to find and safe, shine in the front windows and the drapes don't close together. Fortunately I had a couple of safety pins, so that took care of that. Very minor things that are barely worth mentioning. We had a wonderful time. 5+ recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KFit
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here as part of our Honeymoon. Arrived in Venice on an Italian public holiday and wondered what we'd let ourselves in for! Luckily we found the hotel was off the main drag but within easy reach. Room was very spacious and true to the website photos. Only downside would be lack of a standing shower attachment. Family owned and staff were great - certainly trying to speak the language gets you further. Venice is expensive and we found it very busy which did spoil things slightly but the rowing regatta was on that weekend which was great fun. Definitely get off the main route and explore down the backstreets and go off season - I think you could soak up the city's atmosphere much better. Couple of good restaurants situated on the other side of the canal from the hotel - short stagger home! Take advantage of hotel's roof terrace if weather is good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! A true taste of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Seaforth35
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this charming hotel for 3 nights and I wish it had been longer! The rooms are lovely and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was nice but by far the best part was eating it by the canal! The location was great too, away from the hectic tourist haunts but within walking distance of all main attractions. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kajnkween
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Junior Suite over looking the canal - the room was much more than I ever imagined! We were there for only 2 nights during our trip to Italy and Greece. We would definitely stay there again. Although it was not right in the tourist area, you are going to walk everywhere anyway - don't you go to Venice to experience the boats and the city! Great way to do it - the location is perfect for wandering around the less touristy area, but close enough for an easy walk or water bus ride down to St. Mark's Square. The area that the hotel is located in is the Carnieggo - very charming, very quiet - we loved both the area and the hotel. Because we only had one full day there, we didn't have the pleasure of having breakfast with them - but we made it to St. Mark's Square before the crowd! Don't hesitate to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: NewToChicago
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The owner was very helpful and friendly, the breakfast was excellent. The room was the most beautiful I have ever stayed in. The location is great, just a short walk from tourist shops and places to eat. If you happen to have an early flight out, it is not a bad walk from the taxi stand and the staff is wonderfully helpful in arranging a reservation. We found that the people of Italy are really friendly, it is especially appreciated if you try to converse, at least the common courtesies, in Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Loved CaDagaressa”
Reviews.Author: gstern42
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were high because of the earlier excellent reviews on Trip Advisor, but we were not disappointed at all. The hotel is in a great location, close to everything we wanted to see, and in a charming location away from the crowds. Ten minutes walking to or from train station, and about 20 minutes to major sights, but we took the vaparetto (water bus) as much as we could. What a wonderful vacation! Owner, Paulo, is as nice as can be, and so is his key employee, Danielle (who speaks English). Hotel is located on a small canal that runs off the Grand Canal. Vaporetto stop is Guglie. Room was nice with very modern bathroom. Comfortable bed. Local noise (from the boats) at about 7:30 AM, but we did not mind because we are early-risers. One night there was a band playing across the canal at a restaurant, and the music stopped at 11:00. To the extent those are negatives, they are all the negatives we can think of. In the morning, Paulo set up tables right off the canal, where all guests ate breakfast. Usual assortment comprising a continental breakfast, including cereal, yogurt, cheese, bread, jams, crackers, teas, juice, and delicious coffees. (I got hooked on Apricot juice.) Charming breakfast room inside, but in mid-May, who would want to eat inside? We had perfect weather from May 11-14. We were sorry to leave Venice. When we return, it will be at the CaDagaressa. Room cost (standard)was reasonable ($500) for three nights (that's dollars, not Euros). More expensive rooms available facing the canal. We ate three dinners at a nearby fish restaurant that was just to the right of the hotel as you faced the hotel. Two minute walk from the hotel. Osteria Vecchia. Excellent fish dishes and pasta. Friendly service by English -speaking servers and English translations on the menu. But we were the only tourists. Everyone there is a resident of Venice. Great mussels. Dinner for two with wine and water was about 30 Euros. Here's a tip: Instead of going to the Cathedral at St. Marks Square during the day with thousands of tourists being moved quickly through the Cathedral, go at about 6:20 PM for mass. Lovely service, singing, and they light up the frescos. Feel free to leave the service any time. We did walk, and it was a wonderful city to walk in. Very safe at night. But get 24 hour or 72 hour passes for the vaporetto and use it for wonderful sightseeing. We became addicted to the vaporettos. Get on a crowded boat, and soon you'll be seated, preferably at the front of the boat. We took a bus from the airport and then bought our first 24 hour vaporetto (water bus) pass. We should have bought the 72 hour pass. I think it was 25 Euros, but we got our money's worth. The 24 hour pass was about 12 Euros each. One water bus ride is 5.50, so the bargain is either the 24-hour or 72-hour pass. The following day, we bought another set of 24-hour passes. Oh, hotels give a discount for cash, even dollars. Worth bringing cash since new credit card charges are steep for conversions into dollars. I'd be happy to answer questions. From Venice, we went to Florence and enjoyed another Trip-Advisor recommended hotel, and then we stayed at a rented-apartment in Tuscany and did day trips. Gstern42@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Good Area To Stay”
Reviews.Author: tiny123
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a six night stay. We found the Cannaregio area really lovely, it was great to walk back to after the crowded tourist areas. Very easy to find, vaporetto stop just a couple of minutes away. Train station less than ten minute walk. The hotel was very clean, fresh towels daily and nice bathroom. Breakfast was ok, cereal, juice, croissant, coffee or tea. The best thing about breakfast was having it outside next to the canal which we were able to do almost every day. Our room was on the ground floor, right next to the reception desk, which is not the best place for a bedroom! It was far too noisy, we could hear every conversation at the desk or on the phone. It was a small room but very comfy bed. The worst thing was the size of the window, very small, facing a wall. We had to put the light on every morning as there is no natural light to speak of. The staff were friendly and they gave me a lovely bouquet of roses on our Wedding Anniversary which was really nice. We loved Venice and if we go back we would stay at Ca Dogaressa again as it couldn't be faulted on cleanliness and it was our favourite area. Just NOT the downstairs room next time please, Paolo.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and loved it. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was definitely North American standard. It had a bath and new tile floors - very clean. So much better than other hotels we stayed at in Italy. This hotel is in a quieter neighbourhood, but still only 5-10 minutes walking from the Train station. We picked it because it was so close to the train station and were totally surprised that we loved it. (usually being near the train station is a crappy neighbourhood). The best part was eating breakfast along the canal. In the morning there were lots of boats going by and we watched as Venetians left their houses and went to work. It was fantastic. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It was so much better than the hotel we stayed at on Lido.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Good location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ian∠ie
Reviews.Content: We Have just returned from a four night stay (May 2006) at this small family run hotel. The hotel is clean and beutifully decorated. The staff were all helpful and friendly. Our room was cleaned and supplied with fresh towels each day. The ample breakfast served by the canal was a treat, in this less touristy area most of the traffic was local. we had no problems with noise as mentioned in previous reviews. we strongly recomend this little gem ian & angie Smith

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on 8, 9, 10 and 11 April because of the positive reviews on this website. They were well and truly justified! Breakfast was very enjoyable in their quaint dining room. Staff were very friendly and more than helpful with tips on restaurants. Room was gorgeous (even though it didn't face canal) with a very modern and impeccably clean bathroom. We wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel to other travellers. It will definitely be our first choice when again in Venice. Thank you for making our stay in Venice even more memorable.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ca' Dogaressa
HotelInfo.Address: Fondamenta di Cannaregio 1018, 30121 Venice, Italy
